hebrew_text: קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. שְׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָן בַּצָּפוֹן, בַּצָּפוֹן וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָן בַּדָּרוֹם,
human_translation: Offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered them in the south misusing them, slaughtered them in the south and collected their blood in the north, or in the north but collected their blood in the south,
llm_translation: Holy of Holies that slaughtered in the south - they are disqualified. Slaughtered in the south and received their blood in the north, in the north and received their blood in the south.

hebrew_text: שָׁחַט בַּיּוֹם וְזָרַק בַּלַּיְלָה, בַּלַּיְלָה וְזָרַק בַּיּוֹם, אוֹ שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן חוּץ לִזְמַנּוֹ וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמוֹ – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: one slaughtered during the day and sprinkled at night, at night and sprinkled during the day, Or where one slaughtered them beyond its time, or outside its area, misusing them
llm_translation: He slaughtered during the day and sprinkled at night, at night and sprinkled during the day, or if he slaughtered them outside their designated time or outside their designated place - they are disqualified.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כׇּל שֶׁהָיָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ, וְכׇל שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua stated a principle any that had a period of fitness to the priests not misusing it. And any that did not have a period of fitness for the priests misusing it
llm_translation: General Rabbi Yehoshua said: Anyone who had a time of permissibility for the priests - they do not commit treachery with it, and anyone who did not have a time of permissibility for the priests - they commit treachery with it.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹ הִיא שֶׁהָיָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים? שֶׁלָּנָה, וְשֶׁנִּטְמְאָה, וְשֶׁיָּצְאָה.
human_translation: Which is that had a period of fitness for the priests? whose remained overnight and that became ritually impure, and that left
llm_translation: Which is the one that had a time of permissibility for the priests? That of menstruation, and that of impurity, and that of childbirth.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים? שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה חוּץ לִזְמַנָּהּ, חוּץ לִמְקוֹמָהּ, וְשֶׁקִּיבְּלוּ פְּסוּלִין וְזָרְקוּ אֶת דָּמָה.
human_translation: And which is that did not have a period of fitness for the priests? that was slaughtered beyond its time, outside its area, or that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: And which is the one that did not have a permissible time for the priests? That it was slaughtered outside of its designated time, outside of its designated place, and they received it while disqualified and they threw its blood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי: קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. פְּשִׁיטָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁחִיטָתָן בַּדָּרוֹם אַפֵּיקִינּוּן מִידֵי מְעִילָה?
human_translation: teaches: offerings of the most sacred order one slaughtered them in the south misusing them. obvious? because their slaughter was performed in the south, should we revoke their as subject to misuse?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "Gemara: Holy of Holies that were slaughtered in the south - they are disqualified. It is obvious, because their slaughter in the south removes them from the domain of the curtain?"

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ – יָצְאוּ מִידֵּי מְעִילָה דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, הָכִי נָמֵי קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לְגַבֵּי דָרוֹם, כְּמָה דְּחַנְקִינּוּן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: It was necessary enter your mind to say since Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Sacrificial that died are excluded from misuse by Torah law, so too, offerings of the most sacred order in south, they are considered as though they were strangled
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded, I say, since Ulla said, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Holy items that became lost - they are exempt from the obligation of a Torah verse." So too, the most holy of holy items in the south, just as we have strangled him.

hebrew_text: קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ – לָא חֲזוּ כְּלָל. אֲבָל דָּרוֹם – נְהִי דְּאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים, אֲבָל רָאוּי הוּא לְקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים.
human_translation: teaches us sacrificial animals that died, are not fit at all. But south, although is not fitting for offerings of the most sacred order, yet is fitting for offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: We have learned: Holy items that became impure - they are not considered at all. But in the south - even though it is not fit for the most holy items, it is fit for lighter holy items.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי כׇּל הָנֵי?
human_translation: Why do I to teach all of these
llm_translation: "Why to me to learn all these?"

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי: אִי תְּנָא שְׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָן בַּצָּפוֹן, הָכָא דְּאִית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּקַבָּלָה בַּצָּפוֹן הוּא. אֲבָל שְׁחָטָן בַּצָּפוֹן וְקִיבֵּל דָּמָן בַּדָּרוֹם, הוֹאִיל וְקִיבֵּל בַּדָּרוֹם הוּא – נָפֵיק מִידֵי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: are necessary. If taught one slaughtered them in the south and collected their blood in the north, here, that are subject misuse, as collection in the north. But he slaughtered them in the north and collected their blood in the south, since the collection, is in the south, removed of subject to misuse.
llm_translation: I need: If a Tanna slaughtered in the south and received their blood in the north, here where there is a cloak, because he received in the north it is. But if he slaughtered in the north and received their blood in the south, since he received in the south it is - he is exempt from the cloak.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא הַאי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: יְמָמָא זְמַן הַקְרָבָה הוּא, אֲבָל שְׁחָטָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה וְזָרַק בַּיּוֹם – לַיְלָה לָאו זְמַן הַקְרָבָה, וְהַאי דְּשָׁחֵט בַּלַּיְלָה – דְּנָפֵיק מִידֵי מְעִילָה!
human_translation: And if taught these I would say day, is the time for sacrifice. But one slaughtered at night and sprinkled during the day, night is not the time sacrifice, and this who slaughtered at night, removed of subject to misuse.
llm_translation: And if one were to suggest this, I would say: The day is the time for offering, but if one slaughters at night and throws it during the day - at night is not the time for offering, and this one who slaughters at night - he is exempt from the covering.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא שְׁחָטָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְקִבֵּל דָּמָה בַּיּוֹם – אִית בַּהּ מְעִילָה, אֲבָל שְׁחָטָן בַּיּוֹם וְזָרַק דָּמָן בַּלַּיְלָה, הוֹאִיל וְלָאו זְמַן הַקְרָבָה הוּא – כְּמַאן דְּחַנְקִינּוּן דָּמֵי, וְלָא אִית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if taught slaughtered it at night I would say: Since he collected the blood during the day, is subject to misuse. But he slaughtered during the day and sprinkled their blood, at night, since it is not a time for sacrifice, it is considered as though they were strangled, and they are not subject to misuse. teaches us
llm_translation: If one slaughters it at night, I might say: Since he received its blood during the day - it has a covering in it. But if one slaughters it during the day and throws its blood at night, since it is not the time for offering - it is as if he strangles its blood, and there is no covering in it. This is what we have learned.

hebrew_text: חוּץ לִזְמַנּוֹ וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמוֹ. לְמַאי חֲזוּ?
human_translation: beyond its time, outside its area, For what are fit?
llm_translation: Outside of its designated time and outside of its designated place. For what purpose?

hebrew_text: הוֹאִיל וּמְרַצִּין לְפִיגּוּלִין.
human_translation: Since renders them accepted their piggul ,
llm_translation: They are willing and they run after the invalid sacrifices.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אִי עָלוּ, מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּרְדוּ? רַבָּה אָמַר: אִם עָלוּ – יֵרְדוּ, רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אִם עָלוּ – לֹא יֵרְדוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before if had ascended what is as they descend, Rabba says: If they ascended they shall descend. Rav Yosef says: If they ascended they shall not descend.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ibaya lehu: If they went up, what should they come down? Rabbah said: If they went up - they should come down, Rav Yosef said: If they went up - they should not come down."

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאִם עָלוּ – יֵרְדוּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: In accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, you should not raise dilemma, as everyone, agrees that if ascended the altar, they must descend. They disagree when according to of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yehuda, do not ask, for the whole world does not argue that if they ascend, they will descend. When do they argue? In the school of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבָּה אָמַר לָךְ: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶלָּא בַּנִּיתָּנִין לְמַטָּה שֶׁנְּתָנָן לְמַעְלָה אוֹ בַּנִּיתָּנִין לְמַעְלָה שֶׁנְּתָנָן לְמַטָּה,
human_translation: Rav Yosef holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, Rabba said to you: Rabbi Shimon states only with regard to placed below which one placed above or with regard to placed above which one placed below
llm_translation: Rav Yosef is like Rabbi Shimon. Rabbah said to you: Until here, Rabbi Shimon did not say except when you built below what was given above, or when you built above what was given below.

hebrew_text: וּלְעוֹלָם דִּשְׁחָטָן וְקִבֵּל דָּמָן בַּצָּפוֹן, אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם – כְּמַאן דְּחַנְקִינּוּן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And actually with one slaughtered and collected their blood in the north, But here, since one slaughtered them in the south, it is considered as though they were strangled
llm_translation: And forever they slaughtered and received their blood in the north, but here, since they slaughtered in the south - it is as if they strangle the blood.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּה קַשְׁיָא! מַאי מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן – מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: We learned offerings of the most sacred order one slaughtered them in the south misusing them Granted, according to Rav Yosef, works out well. But according to Rabba, difficult: What misusing them? by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one slaughters holy sacrifices in the south, they are disqualified. According to Rav Yosef, this is satisfactory. But according to Rava, it is difficult! What does it mean that they are disqualified? It is due to a Rabbinic decree.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לְרַבָּנַן? דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְשַׁלְּמִין חוֹמֶשׁ, דְּרַבָּנַן – לָא.
human_translation: What is there between by Torah law by rabbinic law? by Torah law pay one-fifth by rabbinic law not
llm_translation: What is the difference between biblical law and rabbinic law? Biblical law requires the payment of a fifth, rabbinic law does not.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא מְעִילָה מִדְּרַבָּנַן? אִין, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ – יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה, דְּבַר תּוֹרָה. אַלְמָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אִית לְהוֹן, בִּדְרַבָּנַן אִית בְּהוֹן. הָכִי נָמֵי – מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And is there misuse by rabbinic law? Yes as Ulla said Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Sacrificial that died removed from misuse by Torah law. Evidently, by Torah law not apply to them, by rabbinic law apply to them. So too by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there a case of a cloak from the Rabbis? No, as Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Items of holiness that have died - have exited from the realm of the cloak, a Torah matter." This implies that they do not have the status of a cloak from the Torah, but they do have it from the Rabbis. So too, it is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּעוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן! אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְנֵינָא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ דְּעוּלָּא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הָכָא לָא בְּדִילִין מִנְּהוֹן,
human_translation: let us say we learned that which Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan Even though we learned of Ulla was necessary: enter your mind to say here, will not distance themselves from them,
llm_translation: Let us say that we should teach regarding that which Ulla said: Rabbi Yochanan said! Even though we have taught, it is necessary for Ulla, for I might have thought, here we do not distinguish from them.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ, הוֹאִיל וּבְדִילִין מִנְּהוֹן, אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ מְעִילָה מִדְּרַבָּנַן לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But sacrificial that died, since distance themselves from them, say not misuse even by rabbinic law. teaches us
llm_translation: But holy things that died, since they are distinguished from them, say: even if a rabbinic decree does not apply, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מֵתוּ – נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הַחַטָּאת כְּשֶׁהִיא חַיָּה – לֹא מָעַל עַד שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם. וּכְשֶׁהִיא מֵתָה, כֵּיוָן דְּנֶהֱנָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – מָעַל.
human_translation: Didn’t we also learn died One who derives benefit from a sin offering while it is alive not misuse until he damage. But when it is dead, once he derives benefit he is liable for misuse.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meitu - namei t'nina: Ha'nehenah min ha'chatat k'shehi chayah - lo ma'al ad sheyifgom. U'k'shehi metah, keivun d'nehenah kol shehu - ma'al." English translation: "They died - we learned: One who benefits from the sin offering while it is alive - does not transgress until it is blemished. And when it is dead, since one benefits from anything - he transgresses."

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ
human_translation: enter your mind
llm_translation: The text you provided, "סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ," translates into English as follows: "Sal'ka da'atakh."

hebrew_text: אָמֵינָא: חַטָּאת, הוֹאִיל וּלְכַפָּרָה קָא אָתְיָא – לָא בְּדִילִין מִינַּהּ, אֲבָל קָדָשִׁים, הוֹאִיל וְלָאו לְכַפָּרָה קָאָתֵי – בְּדִילִי מִנְּהוֹן, וְלֵית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: say: Since a sin offering is brought for atonement, do not distance themselves from it But sacrificial since they are not brought for atonement, distance themselves from them and no they are subject to misuse. teaches us
llm_translation: I say: A sin offering, since it comes for atonement - it does not have separation from it, but with regards to holy items, since it does not come for atonement - they have separation from them, and there is no intermingling, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתָה מִי אִית בַּהּ מְעִילָה? וְהָתְנַן: חַטָּאוֹת הַמֵּתוֹת וּמָעוֹת הַהוֹלְכוֹת לְיָם הַמֶּלַח – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין!
human_translation: And is a sin offering that died subject to misuse? But didn’t we learn sin offerings die and money which goes to the Dead Sea may not benefit but not misuse?
llm_translation: "And a sin-offering that died, who has in it a covering? And we learned: Sin-offerings that died and sin-offerings that are taken out to the Dead Sea - they do not benefit and they do not cause detriment!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: חַטָּאוֹת הַמֵּתוֹת – בְּחַיֵּיהֶן בְּדִילִין מִנְּהוֹן, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הֵיכָא דְּמֵחַיִּים – דְּלָא בְּדִילִין מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: They say sin offerings die, during their lifetimes distance themselves from them, to the exclusion of that during its lifetime, as do not distance from it,
llm_translation: They said: The dead sacrifices - in their lifetime they are distinct from them, to the place where they are alive - for they are not distinct from them.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף לְרַבָּה חֲדָא מִגּוֹ חֲדָא, וַחֲדָא מִגּוֹ חֲדָא:
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection to Rabba, one from one, and one from one,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection to Rava from one source to another source, and one source from another source.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן, אֵין מְטַמְּאִים בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן,
human_translation: And all of not ritually impure garments are rendered impure in the throat. And misusing them.
llm_translation: And all of them, do not become impure in garments of the house of swallowing and are treacherous in them.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מֵחַטַּאת הָעוֹף שֶׁעָשָׂה לְמַטָּה, כְּמַעֲשֵׂה חַטַּאת הָעוֹף לְשֵׁם חַטָּאת.
human_translation: except for the bird sin offering that one performed below according to the procedure of a bird sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering.
llm_translation: Outside of the sin offering of the bird that was made for below, like the act of the sin offering of the bird for the sake of sin.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ: כׇּל שֶׁהָיָה פְּסוּלוֹ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ – אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה, וְכׇל שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה פְּסוּלוֹ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ – מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה.
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to any whose disqualification in the sacred it does not render garments impure in the throat. And any whose disqualification did not in the sacred it does render garments impure in the throat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is taught in the Mishnah: Anyone whose status is disqualified in matters of holiness - does not render garments susceptible to impurity in the house of immersion, and anyone whose status is not disqualified in matters of holiness - renders garments susceptible to impurity in the house of immersion.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי: כׇּל שֶׁהָיָה פְּסוּלוֹ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ – אִם עָלוּ, לֹא יֵרְדוּ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: And it is taught any whose disqualification in the sacred if ascended shall not descend. The refutation of Rabba a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is taught: Anyone whose offering was disqualified in the sanctuary - if they ascended, they may not descend. A refutation of Rabba! A refutation.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּפְלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עוֹלַת בָּמַת יָחִיד, שֶׁהִכְנִיסָהּ לִפְנִים –
human_translation: And that which Rabba and Rav Yosef disagree obvious to Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: a burnt offering on a personal altar, that one brought inside
llm_translation: And this that Rabba and Rav Yosef disagreed about it - it is obvious to Rabbi Elazar, for Rabbi Elazar said: A burnt offering of an individual, that he brought it inside -

hebrew_text: קְלָטוּהָ מְחִיצוֹת לְכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: admitted by the partitions for all matters;
llm_translation: Received it from partitions for all things.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: [עוֹלַת בָּמַת יָחִיד שֶׁהִכְנִיסָהּ, שֶׁנִּפְסְלָה] – עָלוּ, מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּרְדוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar asks: a burnt offering on a personal altar that one brought into and was rendered unfit if ascended what is as they should descend?
llm_translation: The inquiry of Rabbi Elazar: A burnt offering of an individual that was brought in and became disqualified - they ascended, what should they descend?

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לַחֲדָא, מִכְּלַל דְּאִידַּךְ פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, אִי כְּרַבָּה אִי כִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: From the fact that asked with regard to this one that the other obvious to him. either in accordance with Rabba, or in accordance with of Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: From when he asked him to one, from the inference of the other it is obvious to him, either like Rabbah or like Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מִגּוֹ חֲדָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ:
human_translation: he raises one as a result of the other.
llm_translation: One from another one stood in need of him.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּה הָתָם אִם עָלוּ – יֵרְדוּ, מְחִיצָה כְּתִיקְנָהּ –
human_translation: Rabba says if ascend they shall descend only there, partition properly,
llm_translation: Until here, Rabah did not say there: if they went up - they should go down, the partition is as its original enactment -

hebrew_text: פָּסְלָה, שֶׁלֹּא כְּתִיקְנָהּ – לֹא פָּסְלָה,
human_translation: renders disqualified, improperly does not render disqualified,
llm_translation: It is disqualified, if not as it was established - it is not disqualified.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמַר אִם עָלְתָה – לֹא תֵּרֵד, מְחִיצָה כְּתִיקְנָהּ – קָלְטָה, שֶׁלֹּא כְּתִיקְנָהּ – לָא קָלְטָה. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, Even according to Rav Yosef, who said if ascends shall not descend, partition properly. admitted improperly not admitted shall stand [ teiku ]
llm_translation: Or perhaps: Even according to Rav Yosef who said, "If it ascended, do not descend; if the partition is according to its regulation, it is valid; if not according to its regulation, it is not valid." This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: זְרִיקַת פִּיגּוּל אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא מִידֵי מְעִילָה בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים, וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא לִידֵי מְעִילָה בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים.
human_translation: Rav Giddel says Rav said: Sprinkling an offering the intent to consume it after its appointed time [ piggul ], does not remove from misuse, in offerings of the most sacred order. does not bring of offerings of lesser sanctity into misuse,
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: The throwing of Pigul does not render liable to bring a guilt-offering in the case of the most sacred offerings, nor does it render liable to bring a guilt-offering in the case of lighter sacred offerings.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב אַבָּיֵי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: הַשּׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַתּוֹדָה לִפְנִים, וְלַחְמָהּ חוּץ לַחוֹמָה – לֹא קִדֵּשׁ אֶת הַלֶּחֶם.
human_translation: Abaye sat and related this halakha , Rav Pappa raised an objection to Abaye one who slaughters the thanks offering inside and its loaves outside the wall, the loaves are not sanctified
llm_translation: Sitting Abaye and saying to her that thing you heard, Rav Papa raised an objection to Abaye: One who slaughters the thanksgiving offering inside, and its bread outside the wall - he did not sanctify the bread.

hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָהּ עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרְמוּ פָּנֶיהָ בַּתַּנּוּר, וַאֲפִילּוּ קָרְמוּ כּוּלָּן חוּץ מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן – לֹא קָדַשׁ הַלֶּחֶם. שְׁחָטָהּ חוּץ לִזְמַנָּהּ וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמָהּ – קָדַשׁ הַלֶּחֶם.
human_translation: if he slaughtered before the surface formed a crust in the oven, and even all formed a crust except for one of them, the loaves are not sanctified, slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area the loaves are sanctified
llm_translation: She slaughtered it until they did not blacken its face in the oven, and even if they all blackened except for one of them - the bread is not sanctified. She slaughtered it outside of its designated time and outside of its designated place - the bread is sanctified.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא פִּיגּוּל מַיְיתֵי לַהּ לִידֵי מְעִילָה! אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: Evidently, piggul subjects to misuse. was silent,
llm_translation: Verily, a harlot brings her to the status of a cloak! He remained silent.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּזְרִיקָה.
human_translation: When came before Rabbi Abba said to during sprinkling
llm_translation: When he came before Rabbi Abba, he said to him: "With sprinkling."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרָבָא: וְהָא אָמַר עוּלָּא: קוֹמֶץ פִּיגּוּל שֶׁהֶעֱלוֹ לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ – פָּקַע פִּיגּוּלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ,
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rava, But doesn’t Ulla say: a handful piggul , that was brought up onto the altar its piggul lapsed from it,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Rava: But didn't Ula say: If one brought a handful of pigul to the altar - its pigul is nullified from it,

hebrew_text: וּקְמִיצָה הַיְינוּ שְׁחִיטָה!
human_translation: And removal of handful is slaughtering
llm_translation: And kemitza, that is slaughter!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיסּוּרָא דְּמַיְיתֵי לִידֵי פִיגּוּל.
human_translation: said to a prohibited act which brings piggul ,
llm_translation: He said to him: the prohibition that leads to Pigul.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: אִם אֲחֵרִים מֵבִיא לִידֵי פִּיגּוּל, הוּא עַצְמוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: But didn’t teach If brings others, into piggul , itself, not all the more so
llm_translation: And it was taught: If others bring about pigul, he himself certainly does!

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי, אִיסּוּרָא דְּמַיְיתֵי לִידֵי פִּיגּוּל.
human_translation: this as well, a prohibited act which brings piggul ,
llm_translation: This is the case: the prohibition that leads to the status of a "rejected offering."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָאָמַר אִילְפָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁתֵּי עֲבוֹדוֹת,
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But doesn’t Ilfa say: disagreement in two rites?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But didn't Ilfa say: a dispute regarding two types of labor,

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי שׁוֹחֵט סִימָן רִאשׁוֹן חוּץ לִזְמַנּוֹ, וְסִימָן שֵׁנִי חוּץ לִמְקוֹמוֹ״, אֲבָל בַּעֲבוֹדָה אַחַת – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֵירוּבֵי מַחְשָׁבוֹת הֲוַאי!
human_translation: For example, if one said: I am hereby slaughtering first one of the organs that must be severed in ritual slaughter, beyond its time; and second outside its area, But in one rite, everyone, constitutes a mixture of intentions,
llm_translation: As an example, he said, "Behold, I slaughter the first sign outside its designated time, and the second sign outside its place." But in one act of service - all the world's eruvim of thoughts are nullified!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי, לְכִי זָרֵיק תִּיגַּלֵּי מִילְּתָא. אִי בַּעֲבוֹדָה אַחַת, אִי בִּשְׁתֵּי עֲבוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: Indeed, when sprinkled will be revealed if during one rite, if during two rites,
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: "Go and cast off the matter." Whether in one service or in two services.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי תוֹדָה נָמֵי, עַד דְּזָרֵיק!
human_translation: if so, with regard to a thanks offering, also until sprinkled.
llm_translation: If so, regarding the thanksgiving offering, it is necessary to throw!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קָדַשׁ״ – לִיפָּסֵל, דְּבָעֵי שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: What sanctified? to be disqualified, that require burning
llm_translation: What is "kadesh" - to disqualify, as it requires burning.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַפִּיגּוּל לְעוֹלָם מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיזְּרִיק דָּם, וּמְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Let us say supports piggul , from it always misuse not even though blood was sprinkled And supports
llm_translation: Let us say, it assists him: The disqualified forever we may benefit from it. Is it not even though it is dangerous with blood, and it assists him!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּלֹא זָרַק הַדָּם. אִי דְּלֹא זָרַק הַדָּם, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: No, where not sprinkle the blood, If where not sprinkle the blood, what of stating
llm_translation: Not, that not he sprinkled the blood. If not he sprinkled the blood, what to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם דְּזָרֵיק, וְכִי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בְּעוֹלָה. אִי בְּעוֹלָה, פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּגָבוֹהַּ הִיא כּוּלַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, actually where sprinkled. But when that is taught, to a burnt offering. If with regard to a burnt offering, obvious as it entirely to the Most High,
llm_translation: Rather: always of throw, and if it was taught, that one, in burnt offering. If in burnt offering, obvious, that it is entirely high.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לָן דָּמָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָזַר וּזְרָקוֹ – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: And furthermore, as the latter clause teaches: its blood was left overnight even though later sprinkled it from it misuse
llm_translation: And furthermore, as it is taught in the latter clause: for us, its blood, even though he returned and threw it - we may benefit from it.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּחַטָּאת – שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: Granted, if you say to a sin offering, well.
llm_translation: If you say "in the case of a sin offering" - it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּעוֹלָה – צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But if you say to a burnt offering, need to be said
llm_translation: Rather, if you say "with regard to an olah offering," is it necessary to say?

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא וַדַּאי מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ. רֵישָׁא, מַאי? הוֹאִיל וּמְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ סֵיפָא, מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ נָמֵי רֵישָׁא?
human_translation: The latter clause certainly supports the first clause what since the latter clause supports the earlier clause, also supports his
llm_translation: The latter part indeed supports him. The first part, what? Since the latter part supports him, does the first part also support him?

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא לָאו וַדַּאי מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא הֲלָנָה – דְּקָעָבֵיד בְּיָדַיִם, לָא מַהְנֵי זְרִיקָה לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִידֵי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: not certain the latter clause supports What is the difference leaving overnight, where it is performed in an action, sprinkling is not effective to remove misuse.
llm_translation: The latter clause is not necessarily assisting him: What is the difference between this and that? - Because he holds it in his hands, it does not require sprinkling to remove it from the garment.

hebrew_text: מַחְשָׁבָה – לָא קָא עָבֵיד בְּיָדַיִם, מַהְנֵי לֵיהּ זְרִיקָה לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִידֵי מְעִילָה.
human_translation: intent, is not performed in an action, sprinkling is effective to remove misuse.
llm_translation: Thought - not done with hands, what is the benefit of throwing it away from the cloak.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא הָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַפִּיגּוּל בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּזָרַק וּמְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ! לָא, דְּלֹא זָרַק.
human_translation: Let say this supports an offering of the most sacred order that piggul , from it misuse not even though sprinkled and supports No, where not sprinkle the blood.
llm_translation: Let's say it helps him: Pigul in the Holy of Holies - we benefit from it. Not even though he threw and it helps him! No, because he did not throw.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל זָרַק, מַאי? הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ? אַמַּאי קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ?
human_translation: But what, sprinkle indeed that not misusing it? why is it taught the latter clause in an offering of lesser sanctity, from it not misuse

hebrew_text: לִיפְלוֹג בְּרֵישָׁא, וְלִיתְנֵי: לִפְנֵי זְרִיקָה – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ, לְאַחַר זְרִיקָה – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ! הָהוּא וַדַּאי מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: let distinguish and teach in the first clause, Before sprinkling misusing after sprinkling not misusing it. That certainly supports
llm_translation: To dispute at the outset, and it was taught: before the sprinkling - we may benefit from it, after the sprinkling - we may not benefit from it! That one certainly supports him.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא הוֹאִיל וּמְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ סֵיפָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ נָמֵי רֵישָׁא? קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים – פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, הָכָא – לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shall say since the latter clause supports the first clause also supports offerings of lesser sanctity is clear-cut, here is not clear-cut,
llm_translation: Let's say, since the latter part assists the former, does the latter part assist the former? Light holy items - it is a definitive ruling for him; here - it is not a definitive ruling for him.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כֹּל שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ, וְכֹל שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said a principle any that had a period of fitness to the priests not misusing it. And any that did not have a period of fitness for the priests misusing it,
llm_translation: General principle, said Rabbi Yehoshua: Anything that had a time of permissibility for the priests - one does not render it disqualified, and anything that did not have a time of permissibility for the priests - one renders it disqualified.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹהִי שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים? שֶׁלָּנָה, וְשֶׁנִּטְמֵאת, וְשֶׁיָּצָאת.
human_translation: Which is that had a period of fitness for the priests? whose remained overnight and that became ritually impure and that left
llm_translation: Which is the time of permissibility for the priests? When she is for the moon, and when she becomes impure, and when she gives birth.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹהִי שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הֶיתֵּר לַכֹּהֲנִים? שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה חוּץ לִזְמַנָּהּ, וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמָהּ, וְשֶׁקִּבְּלוּ פְּסוּלִין וְזָרְקוּ אֶת דָּמָהּ.
human_translation: And which is that did not have a period of fitness for the priests? that was slaughtered beyond its time, or outside its area, or that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: And which is the case where she did not have a permissible time for the priests? When she was slaughtered outside of her designated time, and outside of her designated place, and when they received her while invalid, and they threw her blood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא לְבַר פְּדָת: בֶּן אֲחוֹתִי, רְאֵה מָה אַתָּה שׁוֹאֲלֵנִי לְמָחָר בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ: הֶיתֵּר שְׁחִיטָה שָׁנִינוּ,
human_translation: bar Kappara said to bar Pedat: My sister’s son, look that you will ask me tomorrow in the study hall. fitness slaughtering we learned,
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Kapara to Bar Pedat: "My nephew, see what you are asking me tomorrow in the study hall: we have learned about the excess slaughter."

hebrew_text: אוֹ הֶיתֵּר זְרִיקָה שָׁנִינוּ, אוֹ הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה שָׁנִינוּ? חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר: הֶיתֵּר שְׁחִיטָה שָׁנִינוּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הֶיתֵּר אֲכִילָה שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: Or fitness sprinkling we learned, Or fitness consuming we learned? Ḥizkiyya says: fitness slaughtering we learned, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: fitness consuming we learned.
llm_translation: Or the excess of throwing we have taught, or the excess of eating we have taught? Hezekiah said: The excess of slaughtering we have taught, Rabbi Yochanan said: The excess of eating we have taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לָא דַּיְיקָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּחִזְקִיָּה וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: The mishna is not precisely in accordance with Ḥizkiyya nor in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: It is not precise like the Mishnah, neither like Chizkiyah nor like Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שֶׁלָּנָה, וְשֶׁנִּטְמֵאת, וְשֶׁיָּצָאת. לָאו דְּלָן דָּם, וְקָתָנֵי: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ,
human_translation: We learned that remained overnight and that became ritually impure, and that left Isn’t where the blood remained overnight And teaches: not misusing it,
llm_translation: We learned: If it belongs to us, and it became impure, and then it was removed. It is not our blood, and it is taught: We do not benefit from it.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הֶיתֵּר זְרִיקָה שָׁנִינוּ!
human_translation: And learn from fitness sprinkling we learned.
llm_translation: And hear from it: the permission of sprinkling we have learned!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּלָן בָּשָׂר, אֲבָל דָּם אִיזְדְּרִיק, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: No, where the meat was left overnight, but the blood had been sprinkled due to this teaches: not misusing it,
llm_translation: Not with flesh, but with blood it is squeezed out, therefore it teaches: one may not circumcise on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר לַכֹּהֲנִים? שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה חוּץ לִזְמַנָּהּ, וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמָהּ, וְשֶׁקִּבְּלוּ פְּסוּלִין וְזָרְקוּ אֶת דָּמָהּ.
human_translation: We learned And which is that did not have a period of fitness for the priests? that was slaughtered beyond its time, or outside its area, or that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: And which is the case where an animal did not have a valid time for the priests? When it was slaughtered outside its designated time, and outside its designated place, and when they received it while invalid and threw its blood.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, אִילֵּימָא דִּזְרָקוּהוּ פְּסוּלִין וְקִבְּלוּהוּ פְּסוּלִין – לְמָה לִי עַד דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי?
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where sprinkled unfit and collected unfit Why do I until there are two
llm_translation: "How are the laws? If we say that they threw it and it was invalid, and they accepted it and it was invalid - why do I need it until there are two?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו דְּקִבְּלוּהוּ פְּסוּלִין וּזְרָקוּהוּ כְּשֵׁרִים, וְקָתָנֵי מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ,
human_translation: Rather, is it not where collected unfit but sprinkled fit? And teaches misusing it.
llm_translation: Rather, no, if they received it, they are invalid, but if they threw it, they are valid, and the Mishnah teaches that they are acting treacherously towards it.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הֶיתֵּר זְרִיקָה שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: learn from fitness sprinkling we learned.
llm_translation: Hear the conclusion: the permissibility of sprinkling we have learned.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אִיכָּא לְפַלּוֹגֵי הָכִי, הָא דִּתְנַן הָתָם:
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this But if enters your mind there is to make this distinction that which we learned there
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: And if according to your opinion there is room to dispute thus, is this not what we learned there:

hebrew_text: חַטָּאת פְּסוּלָה – אֵין דָּמָהּ טָעוּן כִּיבּוּס, בֵּין שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסְלָה, וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסְלָה.
human_translation: a disqualified sin offering, its blood does not require laundering whether had a period of fitness or whether it did not have a period of fitness.
llm_translation: Sin-offering disqualified - its blood requires washing, whether it was fit and became disqualified, or whether it was never fit and became disqualified.

hebrew_text: אִי זוֹ הִיא שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר וְנִפְסְלָה? שֶׁלָּנָה, וְשֶׁנִּטְמֵאת, אוֹ שֶׁיָּצְאָה.
human_translation: Which is that had a period of fitness and was disqualified? that was left overnight or that became ritually impure; or that left
llm_translation: If which is it that she had a time of validity and became disqualified? If for herself, and if she became impure, or if she left.

hebrew_text: אֵיזוֹהִי שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר? שֶׁנִּשְׁחֲטָה חוּץ לִמְקוֹמָהּ, חוּץ לִזְמַנָּהּ, וְשֶׁקִּבְּלוּ פְּסוּלִין וְזָרְקוּ אֶת דָּמָהּ.
human_translation: Which is that did not have a period of fitness? that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area; or collected disqualified and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: Which is a case where she did not have a valid time for slaughter? That it was slaughtered outside of its place, outside of its designated time, and they received it while invalid and they threw its blood.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקִבְּלוּהוּ פְּסוּלִין וְזָרְקוּ פְּסוּלִין – הוּא דְּאֵין דָּמָהּ טָעוּן כִּיבּוּס, הָא קִבְּלוּהוּ וְזָרְקוּ כְּשֵׁרִים – דָּמָהּ טָעוּן כִּיבּוּס.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where collected unfit and sprinkled unfit that its blood does not require laundering, collected fit sprinkled fit, its blood require laundering.
llm_translation: How are the bloods similar? If you say that if they received it while invalid and they threw it while invalid - this is where its blood requires pressing, but if they received it and threw it while valid - its blood does not require pressing.

hebrew_text: קְרִי כָּאן: ״אֲשֶׁר יִזֶּה מִדָּמָהּ״ – וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר הוּזָּה? אֶלָּא: לָאו דַּוְקָא,
human_translation: Read here if any of its blood is sprinkled and not to had already been sprinkled. Rather, not exact,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "קְרִי כָּאן: ״אֲשֶׁר יִזֶּה מִדָּמָהּ״ – וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר הוּזָּה? אֶלָּא: לָאו דַּוְקָא," English translation: "It is read here: 'that he may sprinkle from its blood' - but hasn't it already been sprinkled? Rather, not specifically."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי, לָאו דַּוְקָא. אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אִם כֵּן, לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵי תַּרְתֵּי?
human_translation: so too not exact, Rav Asi said: If so, why do I teach two
llm_translation: So it is said, not specifically. Rav Assi said: If so, why do I need to teach two?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם דִּמְעִילָה דַּוְקָא,
human_translation: Rather, actually with regard to misuse precise,
llm_translation: Rather, always specifically the robe,

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּפָסוּל עוֹשֶׂה שִׁירַיִים,
human_translation: And this teaches us: That unfit renders leftovers.
llm_translation: And here it is implied to us: that an invalid person may recite songs,

hebrew_text: אַף עַל גַּב דְּקִיבֵּל פָּסוּל וְזָרַק, וְקִיבֵּל כָּשֵׁר וְזָרַק – לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּשִׁירַיִים נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: even though unfit collected and sprinkled and fit collected and sprinkled not anything. What is the reason that is leftovers.
llm_translation: Even though he received it invalid and threw it, and he received it valid and threw - it is not considered as if he did anything. What is the reason? Because they are like barley grains.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פָּסוּל, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שִׁירַיִים?
human_translation: But didn’t Reish Lakish ask Rabbi Yoḥanan: unfit what is render leftovers?
llm_translation: The text reads: "And Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yochanan: Pasul, what should one do with leftover barley?" (

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה שִׁירַיִים אֶלָּא חוּץ לִזְמַנּוֹ וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, הוֹאִיל וּמְרַצִּין לְפִיגּוּלָן.
human_translation: And said to him You do not have a matter that renders leftovers except beyond its time or outside its area. since effects acceptance, with regard to piggul .
llm_translation: And he said to him: You have nothing that should be done with singing except outside of its time and outside of its place, since they are pleasing to their defiler.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בַּר מִפָּסוּל? לָא, אֲפִילּוּ פָּסוּל.
human_translation: What, is it not to the exclusion of an unfit No, even an unfit
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is not from a disqualified one? No, even from a disqualified one.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אֵין לְךָ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: But taught You do not have
llm_translation: And this, "you do not have," is taught!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְרַצֶּה בְּצִיבּוּר וְעוֹשֶׂה שִׁירַיִים אֶלָּא חוּץ לִזְמַנּוֹ וְחוּץ לִמְקוֹמוֹ, אֲבָל טָמֵא, דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּצִיבּוּר – מְשַׁוֵּי שִׁירַיִים,
human_translation: this is teaching: You do not have a matter that does not effect acceptance in community, which renders leftovers, except beyond its time or outside its area. But impure who is of community does render leftovers.
llm_translation: So it was taught: There is nothing that is not pleasing in the congregation and one recites songs, except outside of its designated time and place. But if one is impure and is present in the congregation, he may recite songs.

hebrew_text: שְׁאָר פְּסוּלִין דְּלָא אִיתַנּוּן בְּצִיבּוּר – לָא מְשַׁוִּין שִׁירַיִים.
human_translation: other invalid are not of community, do not render leftovers.
llm_translation: Remainder disqualified that not have them in public - not compare songs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַפִּיגּוּל – לְעוֹלָם מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear piggul , from it always misuse
llm_translation: Come and hear: "HaPigul - always we are dealing with it."

hebrew_text: לָאו דְּלֹא זָרַק, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הֶיתֵּר זְרִיקָה שָׁנִינוּ!
human_translation: not where not sprinkle conclude from fitness sprinkling we learned
llm_translation: Not one who did not throw, and heard from it: we taught the permissibility of throwing!

hebrew_text: לָא, זַרְקֵהּ.
human_translation: No, sprinkled
llm_translation: Not, throw it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״לְעוֹלָם״? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כִּדְרַב גִּידֵּל, דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: זְרִיקַת פִּיגּוּל – אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא מִידֵי מְעִילָה, וְאֵינוֹ מֵבִיא לִידֵי מְעִילָה.

human_translation: But did Rav Asi say this? Didn’t Rav Asi raise dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is intended which is poured tomorrow?
llm_translation: And who said thus, Rav Assi? This, Rav Assi asked of Rabbi Yochanan: "If one intended for the pouring out of wine for tomorrow, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: כְּבָר שָׁנִיתָ לָנוּ אָלָל! אַלְמָא הַאי אָלָל, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ מְשָׁשָׁא – לֹא קִיבֵּל טוּמְאָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to You already taught us meat residue Evidently this meat residue, since it has no substance is not susceptible to impurity.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira: "You have already changed for us the 'Alal'! This means that since it does not have any handle, it does not accept impurity."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי נִשְׁפָּכִין נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דִּלְאִיבּוּד אָזְלִי – בְּהוּ מַחְשָׁבָה לָא מַהְנְיָא!
human_translation: this which is poured since it is going to be lost also intent with regard to it is not effective
llm_translation: These liquids are permissible, once they have been poured out - for there is no significance to intent!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי עַל הָאָבוּד וְעַל הַשָּׂרוּף – קַשְׁיָא! אָמַר רָבָא: אֵימָא: עַל הָעוֹמֵד לְאִיבּוּד וְעַל הָעוֹמֵד לִישָּׂרֵף.
human_translation: But that teaches: with regard to lost and with regard to burned. a difficulty, Rava said say with regard to stand to be lost or with regard to stand to be burned,
llm_translation: Rather, it is taught concerning the lost object and the burnt object - difficult! Rava said: I will say: concerning the one who stands for destruction and the one who stands for burning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא זְרִיקָה מוֹעֶלֶת לַיּוֹצֵא אֶלָּא שֶׁיָּצָא בָּשָׂר, אֲבָל דָּם – אֵין זְרִיקָה מוֹעֶלֶת לַיּוֹצֵא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says Rabbi Akiva says sprinkling is effective that left only where meat left But blood sprinkling left is not effective
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Rabbi Akiva did not say that throwing is effective for the one who goes out, except that flesh has gone out, but blood - throwing is not effective for the one who goes out.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שָׁחַט בִּשְׁתִיקָה וְיָצָא דָּם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָזַר וּזְרָקוֹ – לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ, בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: this is also taught slaughtered in silence, and blood left even though returned and sprinkled it, he has done nothing, in offerings of the most sacred order, from it misuse in offerings of lesser sanctity, from it not misuse,
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If one slaughtered in silence and blood emerged, even though he went back and sprinkled it – he has not performed the act and it is not valid. With regard to most holy sacrifices – one is liable for misuse, with regard to lesser holy sacrifices – one is not liable for misuse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הָא זֶה, לְמָה דּוֹמֶה?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said, To what is this comparable?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Akiva: "This, to what is it similar?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, בְּבַת אַחַת, אֲבָל בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – לֹא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: When Rabbi Akiva says at the same time, But where one after the other, Rabbi Akiva did not say
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: When Rabbi Akiva said, in one case, but in this case after that - Rabbi Akiva did not say.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לִכְפַר פָּאנִי, מְצָאַנִי זָקֵן אֶחָד וְאָמַר לִי: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא זְרִיקָה מוֹעֶלֶת לַיּוֹצֵא? אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: הֵן. וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי וְהִרְצֵיתִי דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי חֲבֵירַי שֶׁבַּגָּלִיל, אָמְרוּ לִי: הֲלֹא פָּסוּל הוּא, הֵיאַךְ מְרַצֶּה עַל הַפָּסוּל?
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Shimon said: When I went to the village of Pani, a certain old man found me and said to me: Rabbi Akiva would say sprinkling is effective that left I said to him: Yes. And when I came and presented matter before my colleagues in Galilee, they said, is unfit, how effect acceptance for unfit?
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: When I went to the village of Pa'ani, I found an elderly man who said to me: Does Rabbi Akiva say that a disqualified offering is effective for the one who brings it out? I said to him: Yes. And when I came and related the matter before my colleagues in the Galilee, they said to me: Is he not disqualified? How can one be appeased with the disqualified?

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁיָּצָאתִי וְהִרְצֵיתִי דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָמַר לִי: בְּנִי, אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן? וַהֲרֵי הַמַּפְרִישׁ חַטָּאתוֹ וְאָבְדָה, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִמְצֵאת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַהֲרֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן עוֹמְדוֹת – מוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. שְׁחָטָן, וַהֲרֵי דָּמָן מוּנָּח בְּכוֹסוֹת – מוֹעֲלִין בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: But when I left and presented matter before Rabbi Akiva, he said: my son, do you not say so, But designated his sin offering and it was lost and he designated another in its stead, and thereafter the first was found and both of them stand both misuse. slaughtered them and their blood placed in cups both of them misuse.
llm_translation: When I went out and expressed words before Rabbi Akiva, he said to me: My son, do you not say so? But behold, one who separates his sin offering and it gets lost, and he separates another in its place, and afterwards the first one is found, yet both of them stand - they are both invalidated. If one slaughters, and their blood is placed in their respective cups - they are both invalidated.

hebrew_text: נִזְרַק דָּם שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶם, אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁדָּמָהּ פּוֹטֵר אֶת בְּשָׂרָהּ מִן הַמְּעִילָה, אַף יִפְטוֹר בְּשַׂר חֲבֶירְתָּהּ מִן הַמְּעִילָה?
human_translation: blood of one was sprinkled, do you not concede that just as its blood exempts its meat from misuse, so too, it exempts the meat of the other from misuse?
llm_translation: Blood of one of them was thrown, if you admit that just as its blood exempts its flesh from the outer altar, so too should the flesh of its fellow be exempt from the outer altar?

hebrew_text: אִם הִצִּיל בְּשַׂר חֲבֶירְתָּהּ מִן הַמְּעִילָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל, דִּין הוּא שֶׁיַּצִּיל אֶת בְּשָׂרָהּ!
human_translation: If spared the meat of the other from misuse, even though is unfit, right that exempt its own meat,
llm_translation: If he saved flesh of her friend from the coat, even though it is disqualified, it is the law that he should save her flesh!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: תְּשׁוּבָה גְּנוּבָה הֱשִׁיבוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְאוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד, בְּבַת אַחַת – אִין, בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – לָא,
human_translation: Reish Lakish says in the name of Rav Oshaya: Rabbi Akiva gave a deceptive response to that student at the same time, yes, one after the other, not
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Rav Oshaya: "Repentance that is stolen, Rabbi Akiva returned it to that student, in one instance - yes, in this one after that - no."

hebrew_text: דְּכֵיוָן דְּפָסוּל הוּא, מָה לִי בְּבַת אַחַת, מָה לִי בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה?!
human_translation: since is unfit, what to me whether at the same time one after the other?
llm_translation: As it is invalid, what do I need with one daughter, what do I need with another after another?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְאַתָּה, אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Reish Lakish And you, do you not say the same,
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yochanan to Reish Lakish: "And you, do you not say so?"

hebrew_text: אִילּוּ הִפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי אֲשָׁמוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת, וְשָׁחַט אֶת שְׁנֵיהֶן, וְקָדַם וְהֶעֱלָה אֵימוּרִין שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן קוֹדֶם זְרִיקָה, אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁאִם עָלוּ – יֵרְדוּ?
human_translation: where separated two guilt offerings as a guarantee and one slaughtered both of them, first brought up sacrificial portions of one of them before sprinkling would you not concede that if ascended they shall descend
llm_translation: If he separated two guilt offerings for afterbirth, and he slaughtered both of them, and he offered the statement of one of them before the sprinkling, do you not agree that if they ascended, they should descend?

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חַד גּוּפָא הוּא, אַמַּאי אִם עָלוּ – יֵרְדוּ? הָאָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים שֶׁהֶעֱלָן לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּם – לֹא יֵרְדוּ, נַעֲשָׂה לַחְמוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ!
human_translation: And if enters your mind one entity, why if ascended they shall descend? Doesn’t Ulla say sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity which brought up before sprinkling of blood, shall not descend, have become the food of altar,
llm_translation: If your mind is settled that it is one entity, why, if they ascended, should they descend? This is what Ulla said: The sacrificial portions that were brought before the sprinkling of the blood - they should not descend, let it become the bread of the altar!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קַצֵּצְתִּינּוּן לְרַגְלוֹהִי דְיָנוֹקָא.
human_translation: was silent, Rabbi Yoḥanan said We have cut off the legs of the child,
llm_translation: אִישְׁתִּיק. - He remained silent. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: - Rabbi Yochanan said: קַצֵּצְתִּינּוּן - We have cut them לְרַגְלוֹהִי דְיָנוֹקָא. - at the foot of the palm tree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יֵשׁ מַעֲשֵׂה דָמִים בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לְהָקֵל וּלְהַחֲמִיר, וּבְקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים כּוּלְּהוּ לְהַחֲמִיר.
human_translation: there is leniency and stringency in the act blood of offerings of the most sacred order. But in offerings of lesser sanctity, in its entirety stringency,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is a case of blood in the Holy of Holies to be lenient and to be stringent, and in the lighter sanctities, all are to be stringent.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים – מוֹעֲלִין בְּאֵימוּרֵיהֶן וּבַבָּשָׂר. לְאַחַר זְרִיקַת דָּמִים – מוֹעֲלִין בְּאֵימוּרֵיהֶן, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: How so? offerings of the most sacred order before the sprinkling of blood, one is for misusing their sacrificial portions and for the meat After the sprinkling of the blood one is for misuse of their sacrificial portions, but one is not for misuse of the meat,
llm_translation: How so? Holy of Holies before sprinkling of blood - they become disqualified by their utterance and by the flesh. After sprinkling of blood - they become disqualified by their utterance, but not by the flesh.

hebrew_text: וְעַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה – חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. נִמְצָא, מַעֲשֵׂה דָמִים בְּקׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לְהָקֵל וּלְהַחֲמִיר,
human_translation: for this, and that, one is liable due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. the act of blood of offerings of the most sacred order found leniency and stringency.
llm_translation: "And on this and on this - liable because of Pigul, leftover, and impure. It is found, an act of blood in the holiest of holies to be lenient and to be stringent,"

hebrew_text: וּבְקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים כּוּלָּן לְהַחֲמִיר. כֵּיצַד? קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָמִים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין לֹא בָּאֵימוּרִין וְלֹא בַּבָּשָׂר, לְאַחַר זְרִיקַת דָמִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּאֵימוּרִין וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: But with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity, all of their stringency. How so? offerings of lesser sanctity before the sprinkling of blood, one is not misuse, not for sacrificial portions nor for the meat. After the sprinkling of blood, one is misuse of sacrificial portions, but one is not misuse of the meat.
llm_translation: In holy things, all are stringent. How so? Light holy things before the sprinkling of blood - one does not invalidate either with intent or with the flesh. After the sprinkling of blood - one invalidates with intent and does not invalidate with the flesh.

hebrew_text: עַל זֶה וְעַל זֶה חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. נִמְצָא מַעֲשֵׂה דָמִים בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים כּוּלָּן לְהַחֲמִיר.
human_translation: for this, and that, one is liable due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. the act of blood of offerings of lesser sanctity, found all of their stringency.
llm_translation: Regarding this and regarding this one is liable upon it from the matter of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei. It was found a case of blood in the holy things, all of them to be stringent.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי ״אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר״ – מְעִילָה הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, הָא אִיסּוּרָא אִיכָּא, וְאַמַּאי? הָא מָמוֹנָא דְכֹהֵן הוּא!
human_translation: teaches: not misusing the meat. that there is no misuse but there is a prohibition But why Isn’t the property of the priests
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught: "One does not commit treachery with meat" – this is regarding a cloak where there is no prohibition, but why? Because it is the money of the priest!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּנָסֵיב רֵישָׁא ״מוֹעֲלִין״, נָסֵיב סֵיפָא ״אֵין מוֹעֲלִין״.
human_translation: not difficult, Since the first clause mentions misusing, the latter clause also mentions not misusing.
llm_translation: Not difficult, because at the beginning it says "we are liable," but at the end it says "we are not liable."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״בְּקָדָשִׁים קַלִּים כּוּלְּהוּ לְהַחֲמִיר. כֵּיצַד? בְּשַׂר קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן וּבְאֵימוּרֵיהֶן, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. לְאַחַר זְרִיקַת דָּמִים – מוֹעֲלִין בְּאֵימוּרֵיהֶן וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: Say the latter clause: with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity, all of their stringency. How so? the meat of offerings of lesser sanctity before the sprinkling of blood, one is not misuse, not for nor for their sacrificial portions. And one is not liable due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure. After the sprinkling of blood, one is misuse of their sacrificial portions, and one is not misuse of the meat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: 'Bekodashim kalim kullehu lehachmir. Keitzad? Basar kodashim kalim lifnei zrikat damim - ein moalin bahen uveimureihen, ve'ein hayavim aleihen mishum pigul, notar, vetamei. Le'achar zrikat damim - moalin beimureihen ve'ein moalin babasar.'" English translation: "Say the latter clause: 'In light holy things, all are to be stringent. How so? Light holy meat before the sprinkling of the blood - one does not commit a trespass with them and with their sacrificial portions, and one is not liable for them due to the offenses of pigul, leftover, and impurity. After the sprinkling of the blood - one commits a trespass with their sacrificial portions and one does not commit a trespass with the meat.'"

hebrew_text: מְעִילָה הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, הָא אִיסּוּרָא אִיכָּא, וְאַמַּאי? הָא מָמוֹנָא דִבְעָלִים הוּא!
human_translation: There is no misuse but there is a prohibition But why Isn’t the property of the owners
llm_translation: Cloak it is that not, the here prohibition there is, and why? The money of owners it is!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לַיּוֹצְאִין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says that taken out And is Rabbi Akiva
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: "Regarding the 'yotzei,' and Rabbi Akiva is the one."

hebrew_text: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא זְרִיקָה מוֹעֶלֶת, לַיּוֹצֵא לִשְׂרֵיפָה,
human_translation: when Rabbi Akiva says sprinkling is effective that left specifically with regard to burning,
llm_translation: For Rabbi Akiva said: throwing is effective, for it is considered as if it were burned.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לַאֲכִילָה הוּא דְּלֹא מְרַצָּה.
human_translation: But for eating, that does not effect acceptance.
llm_translation: But for eating, it is that it is not desirable.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים
llm_translation: We will return to you, Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: חַטַּאת הָעוֹף מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשָׁה, נִמְלְקָה – הוּכְשְׁרָה לְהִפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים וּבְלִינָה.
human_translation: One from a bird sin offering is misuse from that it was consecrated. was pinched, it was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight,
llm_translation: Sin offering of bird benefit from it from something sanctified, was peeled – was fit to disqualify in immersion day and in lack of atonements and in soaking.

hebrew_text: הוּזָּה דָּמָהּ – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא, וְאֵין בָּהּ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: its blood was sprinkled, one is liable for it due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. But there is no misuse
llm_translation: "This blood - liable upon it from the matter of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei, and it does not have atonement."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי הוּכְשְׁרָה לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה. לִיפָּסֵל – אִין, אֲבָל לְטַמּוֹיֵי – לָא.
human_translation: teaches: was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight. yes, to disqualification, but not to impure.
llm_translation: The text states: "If it was designated for immersion for one day, or if it lacks atonement, or if it was soaked. To disqualify - no, but for invalidation - yes."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: טְבוּל יוֹם
human_translation: Whose the mishna? is the Rabbis, as it is taught Abba Shaul says: one who immersed that day,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Who is the Tanna? It is the Rabbis, as it was taught: Abba Shaul says: Tevul Yom.

hebrew_text: תְּחִלָּה לַקֹּדֶשׁ.
human_translation: first- to sacrificial
llm_translation: Beginning for the Holy.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ, וּפוֹסֵל אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהוּא פּוֹסֵל מַשְׁקֵה תְרוּמָה וְאוֹכְלֵי תְרוּמָה, כָּךְ הוּא פּוֹסֵל מַשְׁקֵה קֹדֶשׁ וְאוֹכְלֵי קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: renders sacrificial impure and disqualifies teruma . And the Rabbis say: Just as he disqualifies teruma liquids and teruma foods, so too, he disqualifies sacrificial liquids and sacrificial foods.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: He renders holy impure, and disqualifies the terumah. And the sages say: Just as he disqualifies those who drink terumah and those who eat terumah, so too he disqualifies those who drink holy and those who eat holy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל מַעֲלָה עָשׂוּ בַּקֳּדָשִׁים, שַׁוִּינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לִטְבוּל יוֹם כָּרִאשׁוֹן,
human_translation: Rava says: according to Abba Shaul, established a higher standard with regard to consecrated Sages equated immersed that day to first-
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding Abba Saul, they made a decree in matters of sanctity, the Rabbis compared him to one who immerses on the first day.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּאוֹכֶל שֵׁנִי. לְרַבָּנַן, כֵּיוָן דִּטְבַל – קְלַשׁ טוּמְאָה, פָּסוּל – מְשַׁוֵּי, טָמֵא – לָא מְשַׁוֵּי.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Meir, to food second- according to the Rabbis since he has immersed, his impurity is weak. renders disqualified, not render impure.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir, like one who eats a second time. To the Rabbis, once he immerses - he invalidates impurity, if he is disqualified - he rectifies, if he is impure - he does not rectify.

hebrew_text: הוּזָּה דָּמָהּ – חַיָּיבִין כּוּ׳. מְעִילָה הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא, אֲבָל אִיסּוּרָא – אִיכָּא. וְאַמַּאי? הָא מָמוֹנָא דְכֹהֲנִים הוּא!
human_translation: its blood was sprinkled, one is liable There is no misuse but there is a prohibition But why Isn’t the property of the priests
llm_translation: "This blood - liable to lashes. It is a covering garment that is not there, but there is prohibition. And why? Because it is the money of the priests!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לַיּוֹצְאִין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר זְרִיקָה מוֹעֶלֶת לַיּוֹצֵא, דְּלָאו בַּת אֲכִילָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says to taken out And is Rabbi Akiva, who said: Sprinkling renders fit those that were taken out not fit for consumption.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina: regarding those who go out of the boundaries on Shabbat, and Rabbi Akiva is the one who said that throwing is beneficial for those who go out, as it is not considered a form of carrying.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מִיצּוּי חַטַּאת הָעוֹף – אֵינוֹ מְעַכֵּב. דְּתָנֵי רַב: ״הוּזָּה דָּמָהּ״.
human_translation: Rav Huna says Rav says: squeeze out a bird sin offering does not invalidate as Rav teaches its blood was sprinkled.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: The sprinkling of the sin offering of a bird - does not delay. As Rav taught: "Its blood is sprinkled."

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר רַב: מִיצּוּי חַטַּאת הָעוֹף מְעַכֵּב. וְתָנֵי רַב: ״מִיצָּה דָּמָהּ״.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rav says: squeeze out a bird sin offering does invalidate And Rav teaches its blood was squeezed out.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said Rav: The offering of a bird sin-offering delays. And Rav taught: "Its squeezing is like its blood."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהַנִּשְׁאָר בַּדָּם יִמָּצֵה אֶל יְסוֹד הַמִּזְבֵּחַ חַטָּאת הִיא״. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַנִּשְׁאָר בַּדָּם יִמָּצֵה... חַטָּאת הִיא״, אֶלָּא לְרַב הוּנָא, מַאי ״וְהַנִּשְׁאָר״?
human_translation: Come hear and the remainder of the blood shall be squeezed out at the base of the altar, it is a sin offering” Granted, according to Rav Adda bar Ahava, this is as it is written: “And the remainder of the blood shall be squeezed out is a sin offering.” But according to Rav Huna, what “The remainder
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And the remainder in the blood shall be found at the base of the altar, it is a sin offering.'" Granted according to Rav Adda bar Ahava, that is as it is written: 'And the remainder in the blood shall be found... it is a sin offering.' But according to Rav Huna, what is meant by 'and the remainder'?"

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: שֶׁאִם נִשְׁאַר. וּמַאי ״חַטָּאת הִיא״? אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: as it is taught of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: that if remains And what is a sin offering”? to the first clause
llm_translation: As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "For if it remained. And what is 'it is a sin offering'? The first part."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי מִנְחָה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַנּוֹתֶרֶת״. הָכִי נָמֵי שֶׁאִם נִיתּוֹתַר? וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי,
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, that it is written with regard to a meal offering: “But that which is left also that if remains And if you would say indeed
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, regarding the Mincha offering as it is written: "And the remainder." Is it also considered leftover? And if you might say: Is it so,

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מִסׇּלְתָּהּ וּמִשַּׁמְנָהּ עַל כׇּל לְבֹנָתָהּ״ – פְּרָט שֶׁחָסְרָה סׇלְתָּהּ וְחָסְרָה שַׁמְנָהּ וְחָסְרָה לְבוֹנָתָהּ!
human_translation: but isn’t it taught of its fine flour, and of its oil, together with all its frankincense; excludes where its flour was missing, or its oil was missing, or its frankincense was missing,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'From its fine flour and from its oil, with all its frankincense' - this excludes when its fine flour is lacking, and its oil is lacking, and its frankincense is lacking!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם כְּתִיב ״וְהַנּוֹתֶרֶת״, קְרָא יַתִּירָא כְּתִיב.
human_translation: said there it is written: “But that which is left the verse superfluous,
llm_translation: They said: There it is written "and the remnant," the verse adds extra by writing.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב הוּנָא: אֶחָד חַטַּאת הָעוֹף וְאֶחָד עוֹלַת הָעוֹף שֶׁמְּלָקָן וּמִיצָּה דָּמָן חוּץ לִמְקוֹמָן – פָּסוּל וְאֵין בּוֹ כָּרֵת. חוּץ לִזְמַנָּן – פִּיגּוּל וְחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו כָּרֵת. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת מִיצָּה דָּמָן!
human_translation: Shmuel’s father raises an objection to Rav Huna both a bird sin and a bird burnt offering, where pinched their nape or squeezed out their blood outside its area, not valid, there is no karet beyond its time, piggul and one is liable karet In any event, teaches: Squeezed out their blood,
llm_translation: The father of Shmuel raised an objection to Rav Huna: One, a sin-offering of a bird, and one, a burnt-offering of a bird, if their blood was squeezed out outside of their designated place - they are invalid and do not incur karet. If outside of their designated time - it is considered pigul, and one is liable to karet. The objection was raised from the case of squeezing out their blood!

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: raises the objection and he resolves it teaches it disjunctively.
llm_translation: He is responding to her and he is explaining to her: The Tanna'im taught on the side.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: שֶׁאִם נִשְׁאַר בַּדָּם.
human_translation: the itself, The tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael that if of blood remains
llm_translation: Body, it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: that if it remained in the blood.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הָתָם: שִׁירַיִים מְעַכְּבִין, וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִיצּוּי חַטַּאת הָעוֹף אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ! תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: But the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught there, remainder invalidates and Rav Pappa said: between them is squeeze out a bird sin offering two tanna’im and with regard to of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael taught there: "Songs delay (the offering of the afternoon sacrifice)." And Rav Pappa said: "What difference is there between the atonement of the bird offering and them (the songs)?" Two Tannaim, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Ishmael.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עוֹלַת הָעוֹף – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשָׁה. נִמְלְקָה – הוּכְשְׁרָה לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה. מִיצָה דָּמָהּ – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: One is misusing a bird burnt offering from that it was consecrated. was pinched, it was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight. its blood was squeezed out, one is liable for it, due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. And one is its misuse until it leaves to the place of the ashes,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An offering of a bird - one may benefit from it once it has been sanctified. If it became blemished - it is fit to render it invalid through immersion, being left overnight, or being disqualified. If its blood was squeezed out - one is liable for the transgressions of offering it in a disqualified manner, leaving over from it, and making it impure. And one may benefit from it until it is taken out to the place of the ashes.

hebrew_text: פָּרִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים, וּשְׂעִירִים הַנִּשְׂרָפִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ. נִשְׁחֲטוּ – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה. הוּזָּה דָּמָן – חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן בְּבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן עַד שֶׁיַּתִּיךְ הַבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: One is misuse of bulls that are burned and goats that are burned from that they were consecrated. they were slaughtered, they were rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight. its blood was sprinkled, one is liable for it, due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. And one is its misuse in the place of the ashes, until the flesh has been scorched.
llm_translation: Cows that were burnt, and goats that were burnt - one may benefit from them after they have been sanctified. If they were slaughtered - they are fit to render impure through immersion of the day, and through lack of atonements, and through salting. If their blood was sprinkled - one is liable for them due to the prohibitions of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei, and one may benefit from them in the Temple courtyard until the flesh is consumed.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹלָה – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשָׁה. נִשְׁחֲטָה – הוּכְשְׁרָה לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה. מִשֶּׁנִּזְרַק דָּמָהּ – חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּעוֹרוֹת, אֲבָל מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: One is misuse of the burnt offering from that it was consecrated. it was slaughtered it was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight. its blood was sprinkled, one is liable for it, due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. And one is not misuse of the hides, but one is misuse of the flesh until it leaves to the place of the ashes.
llm_translation: The burnt offering - we are disqualified in it from when it is sanctified. If it was slaughtered - it is fit to disqualify through immersion of the day, and in a state of lacking atonement, and in the evening. From when its blood is sprinkled - one is liable upon it for the prohibition of "Pigul," "Notar," and "Tamei." And we are not disqualified in the hides, but we are disqualified in the flesh until it goes out to the place of ashes.

hebrew_text: חַטָּאת, וְאָשָׁם, וְזִבְחֵי שַׁלְמֵי צִיבּוּר – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ. נִשְׁחֲטוּ – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה. נִזְרַק דָּמָן – חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּבָּשָׂר, אֲבָל מוֹעֲלִין בְּאֵימוּרֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁיֵּצְאוּ לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: One is misuse of a sin offering, and a guilt offering, and communal peace offerings from that they were consecrated. they were slaughtered they were rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight. their blood was sprinkled, one is liable for them, due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. One is not misuse of the flesh, but one is misuse of their sacrificial portions, until they leave to the place of the ashes.
llm_translation: Sin offering, guilt offering, and communal peace offerings - we are treacherous with them from the moment they are sanctified. If they were slaughtered - they are fit to disqualify through immersion of the day, and through lack of atonements, and through overnight. If their blood was thrown - they are liable upon them for the matter of pigul, leftover, and impure. We are not treacherous with the meat, but we are treacherous with their limbs until they are taken out to the place of ashes.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ. קָרְמוּ בַּתַּנּוּר – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה, וְלִישְׁחוֹט עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַזֶּבַח. נִזְרַק דָּמָן שֶׁל כְּבָשִׂים – חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא, וְאֵין בָּהֶן מְעִילָה.
human_translation: One is misuse of the two loaves from that they were consecrated. they formed a crust, they were rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight, and to slaughter with them the offering the blood of lambs is sprinkled, one is liable for due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. And they are not misuse,
llm_translation: Two loaves - one may benefit from them after they have been sanctified. If they became charred in the oven - they are fit to disqualify with immersion of the day, and with lack of atonements, and with linseed, and to sprinkle the sacrifice on them. If the blood of the lambs was thrown - one is liable for them due to pigul, leftover, and impurity, and there is no covering for them.

hebrew_text: לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשָׁה. קָרַם בַּתַּנּוּר – הוּכְשַׁר לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּלְהִסָּדֵר עַל גַּבֵּי הַשּׁוּלְחָן.
human_translation: One is misuse of the shewbread, from that it was consecrated. it formed a crust in the oven it was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and for arrangement upon the Table
llm_translation: Bread of the Presence - one may benefit from it once it has been sanctified. He baked in the oven - it is fit to disqualify with tevul yom and lacking atonement, and to arrange on the table.

hebrew_text: קָרְבוּ הַבָּזִיכִּין – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא, וְאֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: the bowls were sacrificed, one is liable for due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. But it is not misuse,
llm_translation: Approached the Bazichin - obligated upon it due to Pigul, Nosar, and Tamei, and it does not have Me'ilah.

hebrew_text: הַמְּנָחוֹת – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ. קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה.
human_translation: One is misuse of the meal offerings from that they were consecrated. they were consecrated in vessel, they were rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight.
llm_translation: The meal offerings - are disqualified if they were sanctified. If they were sanctified in a vessel - they are fit to become disqualified through immersion of the day, and through lack of atonement, and through overnight waiting.

hebrew_text: קָרַב הַקּוֹמֶץ – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, נוֹתָר, וְטָמֵא. וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בַּשִּׁירַיִם, אֲבָל מוֹעֲלִין בַּקּוֹמֶץ עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: Once the handful was sacrificed, one is liable for due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure. And one is not misuse of the remainder but one is misuse of the handful until it leaves to the place of the ashes.
llm_translation: "Korav ha'komets - chayavin alav mi'shum pigul, notar, ve'tamei. Ve'ein mo'alim ba'shirayim, aval mo'alim ba'komets ad sheyetzeh le'veit hadeshen." "Close to the handful - one is liable on account of pigul, leftover, and impurity. And one does not commit treachery with the leftovers, but one does commit treachery with the handful until it reaches the house of the ashes."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר, הַנֶּהֱנֶה מֵאֵפֶר תַּפּוּחַ שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, רַב אָמַר: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
