human_translation: was stated one who derives benefit from the ash of the round that is on top of the altar. Rav says: from it not misuse and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from it misuse
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: one who benefits from the ashes of the apple on the altar, Rav said: it is not considered benefit, and Rabbi Yochanan said: it is considered benefit.

hebrew_text: לִפְנֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי – לְאַחַר תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: Before the removal of the ashes, everyone agrees that from it misuse When they disagree after the removal of the ashes,
llm_translation: Before the offering of the ashes, everyone agrees that they are not disqualified. When do they disagree? After the offering of the ashes.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ – הֲרֵי נַעֲשָׂה מִצְוָתוֹ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָבַשׁ הַכֹּהֵן מִדּוֹ בַד וְגוֹ׳״ – כֵּיוָן דִּצְרִיךְ לְבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, בִּקְדוּשְּׁתֵיהּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav says from it not misuse as its mitzva has been performed And Rabbi Yoḥanan says since it is written: “And the priest shall put on his linen garment, Since requires the priestly vestments, remains in its consecrated
llm_translation: Rav said: We do not circumcise him - behold, his commandment has been fulfilled. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Since it is written: "And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and so forth" - since he requires the priestly garments, he stands in his sanctity.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן, קַשְׁיָא לְרַב! אָמַר לְךָ רַב: עַד שֶׁתֵּרָאֶה לְבֵית הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: We learned One is its misuse until it leaves to the place of the ashes, difficult for Rav. Rav said to you: until is fit to the place of ashes,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One may benefit from them until they are taken out to the ash heap. This is difficult for Rav! Rav said to you: Until you see them taken out to the ash heap.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְכוּלָּן, שֶׁפָּקְעוּ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – לֹא יַחֲזִיר, וְכֵן גַּחֶלֶת שֶׁפָּקְעָה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – לֹא יַחֲזִיר. הָא עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: raises an objection And all of where they were dislodged from upon the altar, does not restore And likewise, an ember that was dislodged from upon the altar, does not restore on the altar, restore
llm_translation: Challenger: And all of them, that were removed from upon the altar - shall not be returned, and so too a coal that was removed from upon the altar - shall not be returned. But if it was on the altar - it shall be returned.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַב, קַשְׁיָא! אָמַר לְךָ רַב: שָׁאנֵי גַּחֶלֶת, דְּאִית בַּיהּ מְשָׁשָׁא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan works out well, But according to Rav difficult. Rav said to you: An ember is different, as it has substance [ meshasha ]
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yochanan, pleasant, but to Rav, difficult! Rav said to you: The coal is different, for it has a glow within it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמַר לַהּ לְהָךְ גִּיסָא: טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם גַּחֶלֶת, דְּאִית בַּיהּ מְשָׁשָׁא, הָא אֵפֶר דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ מְשָׁשָׁא, אֲפִילּוּ לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב, נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: There is who stated in manner: the reason because an ember, that it has substance. from this from ash, which does not have substance, is not misuse even on the top of the altar. Granted, according to Rav well, but according to Rabbi Yoḥanan difficult.
llm_translation: There is one who said to her to hit a piece of wood: The reason is because of a coal, for it has a worm in it. Now, ashes that do not have a worm in them, even on the altar - one may not benefit from them. It is understandable according to Rav, it is fine, but according to Rabbi Yochanan, it is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ אֵפֶר, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּקָתָנֵי גַּחֶלֶת – קָאָתֵי לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ גַּחֶלֶת, דְּאִית בַּהּ מְשָׁשָׁא, כִּי פָּקְעָה מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – לֹא יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: The same is true that even ash And this is the reason that teaches an ember, is coming to teach us that even an ember, which has substance, if it is dislodged from upon the altar not return
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: The same applies even to ashes, and this is the reason that the Mishnah teaches about a coal - it comes to teach us that even a coal, if it has a worm in it, when it bursts forth from upon the altar - it shall not be returned.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִבְּשַׂר קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים, וְאֵמוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לְאַחַר זְרִיקַת דָּמִים, רַב אָמַר: מַה שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה – יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: יָבִיא דָּבָר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: was stated one who derives benefit from meat of an offering of the most sacred order before the sprinkling of the blood or sacrificial portions, of offerings of lesser sanctity, after the sprinkling of the blood, Rav says: that benefit which he derived allocated for gift and Levi says: bring an item that is entirely on the altar,
llm_translation: It was stated: One who benefits from the flesh of the most holy offerings before the sprinkling of the blood, and the leftover portions of the holy offerings after the sprinkling of the blood, Rav said: Whatever benefit was derived – let it be designated as a voluntary offering. And Levi said: Let him bring something that is entirely for the altar.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: מְעִילָה זוֹ לְהֵיכָן הוֹלֶכֶת? הַלְּמֵידִין לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָבִיא דָּבָר שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ. מַאי נִיהוּ? קְטֹרֶת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Levi: This misuse to where does it go? Those who learn before the Sages, say: bring an item that is entirely on the altar, what is that? Incense,
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Levi: "This cloak, where does it go?" The students before the sages say: "Let him bring something that is entirely for the altar." What is that thing? Incense.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִדְּמֵי חַטָּאת וּמִדְּמֵי אָשָׁם, עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרְבָה חַטָּאתוֹ – יוֹסִיף וְיָבִיא חַטָּאתוֹ. וְעַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרְבָה אֲשָׁמוֹ – יוֹסִיף וְיָבִיא אֲשָׁמוֹ. קָרַב חַטָּאתוֹ – יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח. כְּבָר קָרַב אֲשָׁמוֹ – יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: is taught in accordance of Rav: who derives benefit from money a sin offering or as money a guilt offering, before his sin offering is sacrificed he add and bring his sin offering. And before his guilt offering is sacrificed, he add and bring his guilt offering. his sin offering sacrificed, is cast into the Dead Sea. his guilt offering already sacrificed, allocated for gift
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav: One who benefits from the money of a sin-offering or from the money of a guilt-offering, until his sin-offering is not brought – he should add and bring his sin-offering. And until his guilt-offering is not brought – he should add and bring his guilt-offering. Once his sin-offering is brought – they should be thrown into the Dead Sea. Once his guilt-offering is brought – they should be designated for voluntary offering.

hebrew_text: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִקׇּדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים לִפְנֵי זְרִיקַת דָּמִים, וְאֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לְאַחַר זְרִיקַת דָּמִים – מַה שֶּׁנֶּהֱנָה יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. כׇּל קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – לַמִּזְבֵּחַ. קׇרְבְּנוֹת קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת – לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת. קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר – לְנִדְבַת צִבּוּר.
human_translation: One who derives benefit from meat of an offering of the most sacred order before the sprinkling of the blood or sacrificial portions, of offerings of lesser sanctity, after the sprinkling of the blood, that benefit which he derived allocated for gift all offerings the altar for the altar, offerings which are consecrated for Temple maintenance to Temple maintenance. communal offerings for communal gift
llm_translation: Behold, the holy of holies before the sprinkling of blood, and the lighter sanctities after the sprinkling of blood - whatever benefit they derive shall fall as a voluntary offering. All sacrifices of the altar - for the altar. Sacrifices of the holy of holies of the Temple chamber - for the Temple chamber. Public sacrifices - for the public voluntary offerings.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא, עַד שֶׁלֹּא קָרְבָה חַטָּאתוֹ – יוֹסִיף וְיָבִיא חַטָּאתוֹ, מִשֶּׁקָּרְבָה חַטָּאתוֹ – יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח. וְקָתָנֵי כׇּל קׇרְבְּנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ – לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּאִיכַּפּוּר בְּעָלִים, וְלָא שְׁנָא הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיכַּפּוּר!
human_translation: this itself difficult, before his sin offering is sacrificed he add and bring his sin offering, if his sin offering sacrificed is cast into the Dead Sea. But it is taught all offerings on the altar for the altar. And is no difference if the owner has achieved atonement and is no difference if not achieved atonement
llm_translation: This body difficult, until not approached sin-offering - add and bring sin-offering, from approached sin-offering - go to Dead Sea. And taught all offerings altar - to altar, and not different that atone owners, and not different where not atone!

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל חַטָּאת שֶׁכִּיפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ – תָּמוּת.
human_translation: the first clause is Rabbi Shimon, who says: Any sin offering whose owners achieved atonement left to die.
llm_translation: The beginning: Rabbi Shimon is the one who said: "Any sin offering that its owners have atoned for - shall die."

hebrew_text: וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן?! אָמַר רַב גְּבִיהָא דְּבֵי כְתִיל לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And the latter clause the Rabbis, Rav Geviha of Bei Katil said to Rav Ashi this Abaye said: The first clause Rabbi Shimon and the latter clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The end of the matter, sages?! Rav said to the daughter of the house of Katil to Rav Ashi, thus said Abbaye: The beginning is Rabbi Shimon and the end is the sages.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם נֶהֱנָה מִבְּשַׂר קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁנִּטְמָא קוֹדֶם זְרִיקָה, וּמֵאֵימוּרַי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּין לְאַחַר שֶׁהֶעֱלָן, דְּפָטוּר.
human_translation: Rava says: everyone concedes that if one derived benefit from meat of an offering of the most sacred order that ritually impure before the sprinkling or sacrificial portions, of offerings of lesser sanctity, after they have been brought up that exempt
llm_translation: Rava said: All agree that if one derives benefit from the meat of holy sacrifices that became impure before being sprinkled, and from the remains of light sacrifices after they were offered, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, מַאי קָא מַפְסֵיד?
human_translation: obvious? What loss
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita, mai ka mafseid?"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא בְּשַׂר קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁנִּטְמָא – אִית לֵיהּ מִצְוַת שְׂרֵיפָה לְכֹהֲנִים, אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּין – אִיכָּא מִצְוָה לְהַפּוֹכֵי בְּצִינּוֹרָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: lest you say meat of an offering of the most sacred order that ritually impure: There is a mitzva for the priests burn sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity: There is a mitzva to turn them with a fork [ betzinnora ] teaches us that no
llm_translation: What is the reasoning if the holy flesh of the most holy things becomes impure - it has the commandment of burning for the priests, the light matters of holy things - there is a commandment for those who turn it in the pipe, it is heard for us that it is not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״כְּבָר קָרְבָה חַטָּאת יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח״, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ קַמֵּי כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה – יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֵין מַפְרִישִׁין מִתְּחִלָּה לְאִיבּוּד.
human_translation: Rava said, This that you say, his sin offering already sacrificed, is cast into the Dead Sea, this statement if was made known to him before atonement, But after atonement, allocated for gift What is the reason? not separate from the outset for to be lost
llm_translation: Rava said: This that you said, "Once the sin-offering has come close, they shall go to the Dead Sea," those words that are recognizable to it before atonement, but after atonement, they shall fall to voluntary offering. What is the reason? We do not separate initially for destruction.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ , הַקּוֹמֶץ, וְהַלְּבוֹנָה, וְהַקְּטוֹרֶת, וּמִנְחַת כֹּהֲנִים, וּמִנְחַת כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ, וּמִנְחַת נְסָכִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶם מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ.
human_translation: One is misuse of the handful and the frankincense and the incense and the meal offering of priests, and the meal offering of the anointed priest, and the meal offering libations from that they were consecrated
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: the incense offering, the frankincense, the ketoret, the meal offering of the priests, the meal offering of the anointed priest, and the drink offerings - if they were misappropriated after they were sanctified.

hebrew_text: קִדְּשָׁן בִּכְלִי – הוּכְשַׁר לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם, וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים, וּבְלִינָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם נוֹתָר, וּמִשּׁוּם טָמֵא וּפִיגּוּל אֵין בָּהּ.
human_translation: one consecrated them in vessel, was rendered susceptible to disqualification through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight, and one is liable for it, due to notar , and due to ritually impure; but there is no piggul in
llm_translation: They sanctified in a vessel - it is valid to disqualify with immersion of the day, and with lack of atonement, and with linah, and they are liable upon it for the sake of leftovers, and for the sake of impurity, and it does not contain pigul.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא עַד שֶׁיַּקְרִיבוּ מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: This is the principle any that has permitting factors, one is not liable due to piggul , and notar , and ritually impure, until they sacrifice permitting factors.
llm_translation: This is the principle: anyone who has matirin - they are not obligated on him because of pigul, notar, and tamei until they bring matirin.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַתִּירִין, כֵּיוָן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ בִּכְלִי – חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם נוֹתָר וְטָמֵא, וּפִיגּוּל אֵין בָּהּ.
human_translation: And any that does not have permitting factors, once one sanctified in the vessel, one is liable for it, due to notar , and ritually impure; but there is no piggul in
llm_translation: And all that does not have a designated person to permit it, once it has been sanctified in a vessel - one is liable on account of it being left over and impure, but it does not have the status of pigul.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָכוֹל אֵין חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין?
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught might liable due to ritual impurity only with regard to an item that has permitting factors.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of these words? For the Rabbis taught: One might have thought that they are not liable for impurity except in a matter that has a permit?

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא: וּמָה פִּיגּוּל שֶׁהוּא בִּידִיעָה אַחַת, וְקׇרְבָּנוֹ קָבוּעַ, וְלֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין,
human_translation: And is a logical inference: If piggul , which through one awareness, and its offering is fixed, and no its general prohibition was permitted, one is liable due to only for an item that has permitting factors,
llm_translation: And the judgment is: And what is Pigul that it is with one knowledge, and its offering is fixed, and it was not permitted from its entirety - one is liable only for something that has those who permit it.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָה, שֶׁהִיא בִּשְׁתֵּי יְדִיעוֹת, וְקׇרְבָּנוֹ עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד, וְהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין?!
human_translation: ritual impurity, where of two awarenesses, and its offering a sliding-scale and its general prohibition was permitted is it not right that one should be liable only for an item that has permitting factors?
llm_translation: Impure, that it is in two knowledges, and its offering goes up and descends, and it is permitted from its category - is it not a judgment that he should only be liable for something that has those who permit it?!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱמֹר אֲלֵהֶם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶם כׇּל אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקְרַב מִכׇּל זַרְעֲכֶם וְגוֹ׳״ – בְּכׇל הַקֳּדָשִׁים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן מִיָּד? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יִקְרַב״.
human_translation: the verse states: “Say to them: Anyone of all your seed throughout your generations, that approaches The verse, is speaking of all the sacred items, might they should be liable for them immediately, The verse states: “That approaches
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Say to them, 'Throughout your generations, any man who comes near from all your seed, etc.'" - in all the holy things the Scripture speaks. Could one think they are immediately obligated? The Scripture teaches: "Who comes near."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וְכִי יֵשׁ נוֹגֵעַ שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב?! הָא כֵּיצַד? כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַתִּירִין – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּקְדַּשׁ בִּכְלִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: But is there touches who is liable? how this any item that has permitting factors, not liable until the permitting factors sacrificed. And any item that does not have permitting factors, not liable until it is sanctified in vessel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Is there one who is liable for touching something that is not yet permitted?! How so? Anything that has those who permit it - is not liable until the permissive ones approach it, and anything that does not have those who permit it - is not liable until it is sanctified in a vessel.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ חַטַּאת הָעוֹף .
llm_translation: We will return to you, sin offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: וְלַד חַטָּאת , וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ – יָמוּתוּ,
human_translation: The offspring of a sin offering, and the substitute for a sin offering, and a sin offering whose owners have died shall die.
llm_translation: A child of a sin-offering, and a substitute for a sin-offering, and a sin-offering whose owners died - they shall die.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁעִיבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, וְשֶׁאָבְדָה וְנִמְצֵאת בַּעֲלַת מוּם, אִם מִשֶּׁכִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים – תָּמוּת. וְאֵינָהּ עוֹשָׂה תְּמוּרָה, וְלֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: And whose year passed and that was lost and found blemished, If after the owner achieved atonement shall die, and it does not render a substitute, And may not derive benefit but not misuse.
llm_translation: And when her year passed, and she got lost and was found to have a blemish, if the owners appease - she shall die. And she does not make an exchange, and they do not benefit and do not incur a loss.

hebrew_text: וְאִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא כִּיפְּרוּ הַבְּעָלִים – תִּרְעֶה עַד שֶׁתִּסְתָּאֵב, וְתִמָּכֵר וְיִקְחוּ בְּדָמֶיהָ אַחֶרֶת. וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: And if before the owner achieved atonement, shall graze until it becomes blemished [ shetista’ev ], and it shall be sold and shall purchase another with money its renders a substitute, misusing it.
llm_translation: And if until not atoned the owners - graze until will be satiated, and sell and they take with her blood another. And makes exchange, and trespass with it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דְּקָא מִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: What is different about the first clause that does not distinguish and what is different about the latter clause that does distinguish
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about the beginning that it does not argue, and what is different about the end that it does argue?

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא – פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, סֵיפָא – לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: the first clause are absolute, the latter clause are not absolute,
llm_translation: Beginning - it interrupts him, end - it does not interrupt him.

hebrew_text: הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה! תְּנָא הָתָם מִשּׁוּם תְּמוּרָה, תְּנָא הָכָא מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה.
human_translation: Didn’t teach in connection with substitution, taught there, because substitution, taught here because misuse.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha, tena lei gabbei temurah! Tena hatam mishum temurah, tena hacha mishum meilah." English translation: "Here, let him teach about temurah! He taught there because of temurah, he taught here because of meilah."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לִנְזִירוּתוֹ – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן רְאוּיִן לָבֹא כּוּלָּן שְׁלָמִים.
human_translation: who designated money for his naziriteship, may not derive benefit but not misuse. due to that all is fit peace offering,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who separates terumot for his nazirite vow - they do not benefit from them, nor are they considered to have misappropriated them, because they are fit to be brought as peace offerings.

hebrew_text: מֵת וְהָיוּ לוֹ מָעוֹת סְתוּמִין – יִפְּלוּ לִנְדָבָה. מָעוֹת מְפוֹרָשִׁים, דְּמֵי חַטָּאת – יֵלְכוּ לְיָם הַמֶּלַח, לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: died and he had undesignated funds, will be allocated for gift specified money, money of sin offering shall go to the Dead Sea may not derive benefit and not misuse.
llm_translation: Deceased and there are hidden coins - they shall fall to charity. Explicit coins, the value of a sin offering - shall go to the Dead Sea, not benefiting and not causing a blemish.

hebrew_text: דְּמֵי עוֹלָה – יָבִיאוּ עוֹלָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. דְּמֵי שְׁלָמִים – יָבִיאוּ שְׁלָמִים, וְנֶאֱכָלִין לְיוֹם אֶחָד. וְאֵין טְעוּנִין לֶחֶם.
human_translation: money of burnt offering, one shall bring burnt offering, and one is liable for misusing money of peace offering, one shall bring peace offering. and eaten for one day And does not require loaves
llm_translation: The value of an Olah - they shall bring an Olah, and they are redeemed with it. The value of a Shelamim - they shall bring a Shelamim, and they are eaten in one day. And there is no requirement for bread.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: הַמַּפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לְקִינִּים –
human_translation: Reish Lakish objects to this: And let also teach one who designated money for nests,
llm_translation: Gemara: Reish Lakish objects to it: And it should have taught: One who separates coins for nests -

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן רְאוּיִן לְהָבִיא תּוֹרִין שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּן וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנָּן!
human_translation: may not derive benefit but not misuse. due to that is fit doves whose time has not arrived, pigeons whose time has passed,
llm_translation: Not benefitting and not causing harm, because they are fit to bring offerings before their designated time, and the sons of Yonah who have passed their designated time!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה בְּמָעוֹת סְתוּמִין: הָבֵא שְׁלָמִים, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: הָבֵא תּוֹרִין שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּן? אֵינָן רְאוּיִין לַמִּזְבֵּחַ!
human_translation: Rava says In undesignated money, Torah said bring a peace offering Torah say to bring doves whose time has not arrived? are not fit to the altar.
llm_translation: Rava said: The Torah said in closed places: one who brings peace offerings, the Torah said: one who brings tithes before their time? They are not fit for the altar!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַדָּם – קַל בַּתְּחִלָּה וְחָמוּר בְּסוֹפוֹ. נְסָכִין – חוֹמֶר בִּתְחִלָּתָן וְקַל בְּסוֹפָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: the blood lenient at the outset and stringent at its conclusion. libations stringent at their outset and lenient at their conclusion.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says: Blood - light at the beginning and severe at the end. Libations - severe at their beginning and light at their end.

hebrew_text: דָּם, בִּתְחִלָּתוֹ – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין. יָצָא לְנַחַל קִדְרוֹן – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. נְסָכִין בִּתְחִלָּתָן – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן. יָרְדוּ לַשִּׁיתִין – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: blood, at its outset, one is not liable for misusing emerges to the Kidron Valley one is liable for misusing it. libations, at their outset, one misusing them, they descended to the drainpipes one is no misusing them,
llm_translation: Blood, at its beginning - not circumcised. It went out to Nahal Kidron - circumcised in it. Libations at their beginning - circumcised in them. They descended to the pits - not circumcised in them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹעֲלִין בְּדָמִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught One misusing blood the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon. And the Rabbis say: One is not misusing
llm_translation: The Sages taught: We may use blood, the words of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon. And the sages say: We may not use blood.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מוֹעֲלִין? אָמַר עוּלָּא: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַאֲנִי נְתַתִּיו לָכֶם״ – שֶׁלָּכֶם הוּא. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: ״לְכַפֵּר״ – לְכַפָּרָה נְתַתִּיו, וְלֹא לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: What is the reason of the one who says one is not misusing Ulla said the verse states: and I have given it to you it shall be yours, of the school Rabbi Yishmael taught “to atone” I gave it for atonement, and not for misuse
llm_translation: What is the reason for one who says we do not circumcise? Ulla said: Scripture says, "And I have given it to you" - it is yours. The school of Rabbi Ishmael taught: "For atonement" - I have given it for atonement, and not for rebellion.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״ – לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה כִּלְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה הוּא. מָה לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה, אַף לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says the verse states: it is the blood that atones by life” is, before atonement as after atonement: Just as after atonement not subject to misuse so too, before atonement it is not subject to misuse
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse says: "For the blood is the life, and it shall make atonement for the soul" - before atonement it is like after atonement. Just as after atonement there is no need for a covering, so too before atonement there is no need for a covering.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מַה לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה, אַף לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה!
human_translation: But say Just as before atonement it is subject to misuse so too, after atonement it is subject to misuse
llm_translation: And why? What is before atonement - it has a covering, so too after atonement - it has a covering!

hebrew_text: וְכִי יֵשׁ לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית מִצְוָתוֹ וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה? אַמַּאי לָא?!
human_translation: Is there anything whose mitzva has been performed and it is subject to misuse Why not?
llm_translation: "And if you have a matter that you fulfilled his commandment, and there is in it a transgression? Why not?!"

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה מִצְוָתוֹ, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה!
human_translation: there is removal of the ashes whose mitzva has been performed and it is subject to misuse
llm_translation: Behold, the terumat hadeshen, that its mitzvah has been fulfilled, and it contains a covering!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וְאֵיבְרֵי שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ שְׁנֵי כְּתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד – אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the limbs of the scapegoat are two verses that come as one, And Any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because there is the heave-offering of the ashes and the limbs of the goat that are consumed, two Scriptures that come as one, and any two Scriptures that come as one - do not teach.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵיבְרֵי שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ – אֵין נֶהֱנִין מֵהֶן, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נֶהֱנִין מֵהֶן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?!
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who said one may not derive benefit from the limbs of the scapegoat, But according to one who said one may derive benefit from what can be said
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says the hairs of the goat that are plucked out - one does not benefit from them, but for the one who says one does benefit from them, what can be said?!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וּבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד – אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the priestly vestments, are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because there is the obligation of the removal of the ashes and the priestly garments, two written sources that come as one, and any two written sources that come as one - they do not teach us.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי: ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֵן טְעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה, שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: This works out well according to the Rabbis, who say and shall leave them there” teaches that they require interment. well.
llm_translation: The sages left it, for they say: "And He placed them there" - teaches that they require genizah, it is good.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא, דְּאָמַר: מוּתָּר לְהִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Dosa, who said are permitted for use by an ordinary priest what can be said
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Dosa, who said: It is permitted for a common priest to make use of them. What is there to say?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken, are two verses that come as one
llm_translation: Because the terumah of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken are two written laws that come as one.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach but according to the one who said teach what is there to say?
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanicha leman d'amar ein melamdin, ela leman d'amar melamdin, mai ikka lemeimar?" Translation: "It is satisfactory for the one who says we do not teach, but for the one who says we do teach, what is there to say?"

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי מִיעוּטֵי כְּתִיבִי. כְּתִיב הָתָם: ״הָעֲרוּפָה״,
human_translation: Two exclusions are written There, it is written: “The one whose neck was broken”
llm_translation: Two minimal writings. It is written there: "Ha'arufah."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב הָתָם ״וְשָׂמוֹ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, הָנֵי – אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: And there, it is written: “And he shall put it next to the altar” these, yes, other matters no
llm_translation: And it is written there, "And place it beside the altar," those - no, from another source - yes.

hebrew_text: נְסָכִים בַּתְּחִילָּה מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן [וְכוּ׳]. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק,
human_translation: libations, at their outset, one misusing them, Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Tzadok.
llm_translation: Offerings at the outset are disqualified and so forth. Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok,

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: לוּל קָטָן הָיָה בֵּין כֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ. אַחַת לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה יוֹרְדִין בּוֹ, וּמְבִיאִין יַיִן קָרוּשׁ, שֶׁהוּא דּוֹמֶה לְעִגּוּלֵי דְבֵילָה, וְשׂוֹרְפִין אוֹתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ הַסֵּךְ נֶסֶךְ שֵׁכָר לַה׳״ – כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּיסּוּכָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, כָּךְ שְׂרֵיפָתָהּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Tzadok says: There was a small gap between ramp and altar west of ramp. Once in seventy years young priests descend there and bring congealed wine which resembled round cakes of pressed figs. And burn it in sanctity as it is stated: “In sanctity shall you pour a libation of strong drink to the Lord” just as its pouring is in sanctity, so too, its burning in sanctity.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Tzadok says: If a small worm was found between the lamb and the altar, on the western side of the lamb. Seventy priests in training would descend into it, and bring a libation of diluted wine, which resembles the curls of a ram, and they would burn it in the sanctuary. As it is stated: "With the libation you shall offer a libation of strong drink to the Lord" - just as its libation is poured in the sanctuary, so too its burning is in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? וְאָמַר רָבִינָא: אַתְיָא ״קֹדֶשׁ״ ״קֹדֶשׁ״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּקֹּדֶשׁ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְשָׂרַפְתָּ אֶת הַנּוֹתָר בָּאֵשׁ וְלֹא יֹאכַל כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הֵם״,
human_translation: From where is inferred? Ravina said: It is derived sanctity sanctity It is written here, “In sanctity and it is written there, “You shall burn the leftovers in fire; they are not to be eaten, because it is sanctified”
llm_translation: What is implied? And Rabinah said: It comes to teach "holy" "holy." It is written here: "in the holy," and it is written there: "and you shall burn the remainder with fire and it shall not be eaten, for it is holy."

hebrew_text: מָה נוֹתָר – שְׂרֵיפָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, אַף הַאי נָמֵי בִּקְדוּשָּׁה!
human_translation: just as burning of leftover be in sanctity, so too, these also in sanctity.
llm_translation: What remains - its burning in holiness, so too this one in holiness!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק, דְּאִי קְלַט.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Tzadok, as where collected
llm_translation: Even if you say Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok, because he heard.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק, דְּאִי קְלַט?
human_translation: There are who say Let us say that the mishna is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Tzadok, where collected
llm_translation: There are those who say: Let us say the Mishnah according to Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok, for if we accept?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן. וְהָא קְרָא קָנָסֵיב לַהּ? אַסְמַכְתָּא.
human_translation: say No; And by rabbinic law. But cites a verse support,
llm_translation: They said: No, and from the Rabbis. But isn't the verse supporting her? A support.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דִּישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, וְהַמְּנוֹרָה – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. הַמַּקְדִּישׁ דִּישּׁוּן בַּתְּחִלָּה – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ. תּוֹרִין שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּן, וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנָּן – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: the removal of ash the inner altar and the Candelabrum, may not derive benefit but not misuse. one who consecrates anew ash removed, misusing it. doves whose time has not arrived, and pigeons whose time has passed, may not derive benefit but not misuse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Regarding the maintenance of the inner altar and the menorah - one may not benefit from them nor may one derive benefit from them. If one consecrated them initially - one may derive benefit from them. The tithes that have not reached their designated time, and the young doves that have passed their designated time - one may not benefit from them nor may one derive benefit from them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא
human_translation: Granted
llm_translation: Gemara: In Shlama.

hebrew_text: מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וְשָׂמוֹ אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי מְנָלַן?
human_translation: the external altar as it is written in “And he shall put it beside the altar” from where do we the inner altar
llm_translation: Outer Altar, as it is written in it: "And place it beside the altar." Where is the Inner Altar from?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהֵסִיר אֶת מֻרְאָתוֹ בְּנֹצָתָהּ״ – אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְמִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְמִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said that the verse states “And he shall take away its crop with its feathers, If is not needed for matter of the external altar, apply it matter of the inner altar,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: As the verse states, "And he shall remove its crop with its feathers" - if it is not fit for the outer altar, make it fit for the inner altar.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּמִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, וְלִקְבּוֹעַ לוֹ מָקוֹם!
human_translation: say this and that, with regard to the external altar, and to fix its place,
llm_translation: Concerning what? Both sacrifices on the outer altar, and to establish a place for it!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא: ״אֵצֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. מַאי ״הַדָּשֶׁן״? דַּאֲפִילּוּ מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי.
human_translation: If so, let verse state: beside the altar,” What the ashes”? that even inner altar
llm_translation: If so, let us say the verse: "beside the altar." What is "the ash"? Even from the inner altar.

hebrew_text: מְנוֹרָה מְנָלַן? ״דָּשֶׁן״, ״הַדָּשֶׁן״.
human_translation: From where do we Candelabrum “ashes” “the ashes.”
llm_translation: Menorah, where is it placed? "Deshen," "the deshen."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר תּוֹרִין שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּן – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, בְּנֵי יוֹנָה שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנָּן – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: doves whose time has not arrived, misusing them. pigeons whose time has passed, may not derive benefit but not misuse.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says: If the appointed time has not arrived for tithing, one may benefit from them; regarding the young doves whose time has passed, one may neither benefit from them nor tithe them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, כׇּל הָרָאוּי לְאַחַר זְמַן, וְהִקְדִּישׁוֹ בְּתוֹךְ זְמַנּוֹ – הֲרֵי הוּא בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וְאֵין בּוֹ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Shimon, as teaches reason As Rabbi Shimon would say: any that is fit to after time, one consecrated it before its time that in a prohibition but there is no karet for it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rabbi Shimon said, as it is taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon used to say, anything fit for a later time, and he consecrated it within its time - it is considered as if it were not consecrated, and it does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן: מַאי שְׁנָא מִמְּחוּסַּר זְמַן?
human_translation: But the Rabbis, what is different from whose time has not yet
llm_translation: Rabbis: What is the difference from "mehusar zman"?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מְחוּסַּר זְמַן – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבַּעַל מוּם, דְּבַר פִּדְיוֹן הוּא. אֲבָל הָנֵי עוֹפוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּאֵין מוּם פּוֹסֵל בְּעוֹפוֹת – אֵין לָעוֹפוֹת פִּדְיוֹן.
human_translation: say whose time has not yet just as is with regard to a blemished which that is subject to redemption. But these birds, since a blemish does not render birds unfit, there is no redemption for birds.
llm_translation: They said: If there is a lack of time - it is like being a blemished ba'al mum, it is a matter of redemption. But these birds, since a blemish does not disqualify birds, there is no redemption for the birds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ, יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה דְּבַר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Sacrificial that died are excluded from misuse by Torah law.
llm_translation: Said Ula, said Rabbi Yochanan: Holy items that died, have exited from the obligation of covering according to the Torah.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב עוּלָּא וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאן שָׁמַע לָךְ וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רַבָּךְ?! וְכִי קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה?!
human_translation: Ulla was sitting and he recited this halakha Rav Ḥisda said to him: Who will listen to you and Rabbi Yoḥanan, your teacher, to where has sanctity that was in them gone?
llm_translation: Sitting Ulla and saying to that report, said to him Rav Ḥisdah: who heard to you and to Rabbi Yoḥanan your teacher?! And the holiness that in them to where went?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תִּיקְשֵׁי מַתְנִיתִין: ״תּוֹרִין שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּן וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנָּן – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין״, הָכָא נָמֵי נֵימָא: קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה?!
human_translation: said to the mishna should present a difficulty, doves whose time has not arrived, and pigeons whose time has passed, may not derive benefit but not misuse. Here too, say: To where has sanctity that was in gone?
llm_translation: He said to him: The Mishnah is difficult: "Birds that have not reached their time and young doves whose time has passed - they do not benefit and do not cause damage." Here it is stated: Where is the sanctity in them going?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ דְּאִיכָּא מְעִילָה מִדְּרַבָּנַן. וְקַשְׁיָא לִי: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא אִית בֵּיהּ מְעִילָה, וּלְבַסּוֹף אִית בֵּיהּ מְעִילָה?
human_translation: said to I concede to you that there is misuse by rabbinic law. But difficult for me: Is there anything where initially, not subject to misuse, and ultimately subject to misuse
llm_translation: He said to him: We admit to you that there is a cloak from the Rabbis. And it is difficult for me: Is there a cloak from the outset? There is no cloak in it, and in the end there is a cloak?

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא אִיכָּא דָּם, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לֵית בַּהּ מְעִילָה, וּלְבַסּוֹף אִית בַּהּ מְעִילָה, דִּתְנַן: דָּם, בַּתְּחִלָּה – אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ, יָצָא לְנַחַל קִדְרוֹן – מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ!
human_translation: And no But there is blood, which initially not subject misuse, and ultimately subject misuse. As we learned blood, at outset, not misusing it, emerges to the Kidron Valley misusing it.
llm_translation: And not? And there is a case where there is blood, which initially does not have a cloak, and in the end it has a cloak, as we learned: blood, initially - one may not benefit from it, once it has flowed into the Kidron Valley - one may benefit from it!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם נָמֵי אִיכָּא מְעִילָה מֵעִיקָּרָא,
human_translation: say there too, it is misuse initially.
llm_translation: They said: There, indeed, is a cloak from the outset,

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב: הַמַּקִּיז דָּם לְבֶהֱמַת קָדָשִׁים, אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: As Rav said: one who lets blood from sacrificial animal, benefit is prohibited and misusing it
llm_translation: As Rav said: One who spills the blood of consecrated animals, it is forbidden to derive benefit from it, and it is considered a trespass.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמַר רַב: הַמַּקִּיז דָּם לְבֶהֱמַת קָדָשִׁים – אָסוּר בַּהֲנָאָה, וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא חֲלֵב הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, וּבֵיצֵי תוֹרִין – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין!
human_translation: the itself. Rav Huna says Rav says: one who lets blood from a sacrificial animal, deriving benefit is prohibited and misusing it. Rav Hamnuna raises an objection the milk of consecrated and the eggs of doves may not derive benefit but not misuse,
llm_translation: Body. Rav Huna said, Rav said: One who sprinkles blood for consecrated animals - forbidden in benefit, and we are treacherous with it. Rav Hamnuna raises an objection: The fat of consecrated animals, and eggs of torim - not benefiting and not treacherous!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן, לְגַבֵּי דָּם, דְּלֹא מִתְקַיֶּימֶת בְּלָא דָּם. אֲבָל חֵלֶב, דְּקָא מִקַּיְימָא בְּלֹא חֵלֶב – לָא.
human_translation: said to When we said with regard to blood, as cannot exist without blood But milk, since exist without milk, not
llm_translation: He said to him: When we say, regarding blood, that it does not endure without blood. But regarding fat, which endures without fat - no.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: הַזֶּבֶל וְהַפֶּרֶשׁ שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר – אֵין נֶהֱנִין וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין. וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמֶיהָ לַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raises an objection may not derive benefit the manure and the dung in the courtyard but not misusing and money their will allocated for the chamber
llm_translation: Challenger: Rav Mesharshaya raises an objection: The dung and the straw in the courtyard - one may not benefit from them and one may not move them. And their blood shall be poured out in the chamber.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי, לָא מְקַיֵּים בְּלֹא פֶּרֶשׁ! אָמְרִי: מַאי אִירְיָא, הָדֵין פֶּרֶשׁ דְּמִן עָלְמָא קָאָתֵי לַהּ, אָזֵיל הַאי – אָתֵי אַחֲרִינָא. לְאַפּוֹקֵי דָּם, מִגּוּפַהּ.
human_translation: Why Here too, cannot exist without dung, say How compare this dung that comes to from an external this goes that other comes to exclude blood, which is of body
llm_translation: "Why? Here it is stated, not fulfilled without explanation! They said: What is the meaning? Thus, the explanation from the world comes to it, this one goes – another one comes. To remove blood from its body."

hebrew_text: הָא קָתָנֵי לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין וְדָמָיו לַלִּשְׁכָּה. מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ – דָּמָיו יִפְּלוּ לַלִּשְׁכָּה.
human_translation: teaches may not derive benefit but not misuse, and money their will allocated for the chamber supports Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: Wherever the Sages said consecrated and not consecrated, money its allocated for the chamber
llm_translation: The text states: "One does not benefit from it, nor does one commit a trespass, and its value is for the Chamber. This supports the view of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: Any place where the Sages said 'holy' and it is not holy - its value shall fall to the Chamber."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲלֵב הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין וּבֵיצֵי תוֹרִין – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: the milk of sacrificial and the eggs of doves, may not derive benefit but not misuse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The forbidden fat of consecrated animals and eggs of a bird – one may not benefit from them, and one may not derive benefit from them.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּקׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ. אֲבָל בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, הִקְדִּישׁ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ וּבְבֵיצָתָהּ, חֲמוֹרָה – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ וּבַחֲלָבָהּ.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? in sacrificial altar, But in consecrated for Temple maintenance. consecrated a hen misusing it and for its egg; a donkey misusing it and for its milk,
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? - regarding the holy items of the altar. But regarding the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard, if one consecrated a hen - it is effective with regard to it and its egg, a donkey - it is effective with regard to it and its milk.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, כִּי אַקְדְּשַׁהּ קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, לָא אִית בַּהּ מְעִילָה?
human_translation: But on the altar, if he consecrated it a sanctity value, not subject to misuse?
llm_translation: Gemara: Rather, regarding the altar, when I sanctify it with the holiness of blood, does it not have a covering?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – כְּשֶׁהִקְדִּישׁ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, אֲבָל הִקְדִּישׁוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ – נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁהִקְדִּישׁוֹ לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת. הִקְדִּישׁ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ וּבְבֵיצָתָהּ, חֲמוֹרָה – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ וּבַחֲלָבָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: is incomplete and this it is teaching: In what is this statement, said? when he consecrated inherent sanctity on the altar. But he consecrated it a sanctity value, on the altar, it is as though he consecrated it for Temple maintenance one consecrated a hen misusing it and for its egg; a donkey misusing it and for its milk.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The deficiencies of the body are lacking, and thus it is taught: In what case are these matters said - when one sanctified the sanctity of the body upon the altar, but if one sanctified the sanctity of blood upon the altar - it is considered as if he had sanctified it for the inspection of the house. If one sanctified a hen - we may benefit from it and from its eggs, a donkey - we may benefit from it and from its milk.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ , כׇּל הָרָאוּי לַמִּזְבֵּחַ
human_translation: any that is fit for the altar
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Any animal fitting for the altar..."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת וְלֹא לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, לֹא לַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְלֹא לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ. כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: but is not for Temple maintenance, for Temple maintenance but not for the altar, neither for the altar nor for Temple maintenance, misusing it. how so?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And not for inspecting the house, for inspecting the house and not for the altar, not for the altar and not for inspecting the house - one is liable. How so?" English translation:

hebrew_text: הִקְדִּישׁ בּוֹר מָלֵא מַיִם, אַשְׁפּוֹת מְלֵאוֹת זֶבֶל, שׁוֹבָךְ מָלֵא יוֹנִים,
human_translation: one consecrated a cistern full of water, garbage full of manure, a dovecote full of pigeons,
llm_translation: He sanctified a pit full of water, garbage heaps full of dung, a ditch full of doves.

hebrew_text: אִילָן מָלֵא פֵּירוֹת, שָׂדֶה מְלֵאָה עֲשָׂבִים –
human_translation: a tree full of fruit, a field full of grass.
llm_translation: A tree full of fruits, a field full of grass -

hebrew_text: מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶם וּבְמַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: misusing them and that which is within
llm_translation: We are dealing with them and with what is within it.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם הִקְדִּישׁ בּוֹר וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַלֵּא מַיִם, אַשְׁפָּה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַלָּא זֶבֶל, שׁוֹבָךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַלֵּא יוֹנִים, אִילָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַלֵּא פֵּירוֹת, שָׂדֶה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַלְּאָה עֲשָׂבִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶם, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בְּמַה שֶּׁבְּתוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: But if one consecrated cistern and it was subsequently filled with water, garbage and it was subsequently filled with manure, dovecote and it was subsequently filled with pigeons, a tree and it was subsequently filled with fruit, or field and it was subsequently filled with grass; misusing them but not misusing that which is within
llm_translation: But if he sanctified a pit, and afterwards it became filled with water, a cesspit, and afterwards it became filled with dung, a ditch, and afterwards it became filled with doves, a tree, and afterwards it became filled with fruits, a field, and afterwards it became filled with weeds - they are considered as having been misused, but one does not misuse that which is within it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה וְהָאִילָן – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלָהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן גִּידּוּלֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: one who consecrates the field or the tree misusing them and their growth, because these are growths of consecrated
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: One who sanctifies the field and the tree - they are benefited by them and by their growth, because they are the growth of consecration.

hebrew_text: וְלַד הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת – לֹא יִנַוק מִן הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת, וַאֲחֵרִים מִתְנַדְּבִים כֵּן. וְלַד הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין – לֹא יִנַוק מִן הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין, וַאֲחֵרִים מִתְנַדְּבִים כֵּן.
human_translation: an offspring to a tithed may not suckle from the tithed And others stipulate this offspring of sacrificial may not suckle from the sacrificial And others stipulate this
llm_translation: Child of the wealthy woman - shall not nurse from the wealth, and others may volunteer thus. Child of the consecrated ones - shall not nurse from the consecrated ones, and others may volunteer thus.

hebrew_text: הַפּוֹעֲלִים לֹא יֹאכְלוּ מִן גְּרוֹגְרוֹת הֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְכֵן פָּרָה מִכַּרְשִׁינֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: The laborers, may not eat from consecrated dried figs, And likewise, a cow from consecrated vetch [ mikarshinei ].
llm_translation: The workers shall not eat from the dried figs of the Temple. Similarly, a cow shall not eat from the leeks of the Temple.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָתָנֵי: וְלַד הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת לֹא יִנַק מִן הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: teaches an offspring to a tithed may not suckle from the tithed From where are these matters
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "A son of a woman who is wealthy shall not nurse from a woman who is wealthy. What is the reason?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: אָתְיָא ״הַעֲבָרָה״ ״הַעֲבָרָה״ מִבְּכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ – אַף חֲלֵב הַמְעוּשֶּׂרֶת מוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami said: It is derived “passing” “passing,” from a firstborn Just as firstborn misusing it, so too, milk of a tithed misusing it,
llm_translation: Rav Ahadboi bar Ammi said: It is derived "ha'avara" "ha'avara" from "bekhor," just as with "bekhor" one can act treacherously, so too with the fat of the tithe one can act treacherously.

hebrew_text: חֲלֵב הַמּוּקְדָּשׁ נָמֵי, אָתְיָא ״אִמּוֹ״ ״אִמּוֹ״ מִבְּכוֹר.
human_translation: milk of a sacrificial also derived “its mother” “its mother,” from a firstborn
llm_translation: The sacred fat is considered equivalent to "his mother" "his mother" from the firstborn.

hebrew_text: הַפּוֹעֲלִין לֹא יֹאכְלוּ כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תַחְסֹם שׁוֹר בְּדִישׁוֹ״, ״דִּישׁוֹ״ – שֶׁלְּךָ, וְלֹא דִּישׁוֹ שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: the laborers may not eat from What is the reason Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami said: As the verse states: “Do not muzzle the ox during its treading” “its treading” your and not treading a consecrated
llm_translation: Workers should not eat "ko." What is the reason? Rav Ahadbuvy son of Ammi said, as the verse states: "Do not muzzle an ox while it is threshing," "its threshing" – yours, and not the threshing of consecrated property.

hebrew_text: הַדָּשׁ קַלְעִילִין בִּשְׂדֵה הֶקְדֵּשׁ – מָעַל. וְהָא בְּתָלוּשׁ בָּעִינַן! אָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַבְקַהּ מְעַלֵּי לַהּ.
human_translation: One who threshes kalilin , in a consecrated field misuse But we require detached Ravina said: Conclude from it dust is beneficial for
llm_translation: The fish nets in the field of the Temple - invalid. But isn't it suspended that we require! Rabinah said: Learn from it, dust rises to it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׇׁרְשֵׁי אִילָן שֶׁל הֶדְיוֹט הַבָּאִין בְּשֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְשֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁבָּאִין בְּשֶׁל הֶדְיוֹט – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. מַעְיָן שֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא מִתּוֹךְ הַשָּׂדֶה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. יָצָא חוּץ לַשָּׂדֶה – נֶהֱנִין מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: the roots of tree of an ordinary person that enter into consecrated and a consecrated that enter into of an ordinary person, may not derive benefit but not misuse. a spring which emerges from into a consecrated field, may not derive benefit but not misuse. emerges outside one may derive benefit from
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The roots of a tree belonging to a commoner that enter the domain of consecrated property, and the roots of a tree belonging to consecrated property that enter the domain of a commoner - they do not benefit nor cause damage. A spring that emerges from the field of consecrated property - they do not benefit nor cause damage. If it emerges outside the field - one may benefit from it.

hebrew_text: הַמַּיִם שֶׁבַּכַּד שֶׁל זָהָב – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. נְתָנָן בִּצְלוֹחִית – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: the water that into golden jug, may not derive benefit But not misuse, one places into the flask, misusing
llm_translation: The water in a vessel of gold - not benefitting and not deteriorating. Placed in a glass vessel - deteriorating in them.

hebrew_text: עֲרָבָה – לֹא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: נוֹהֲגִין הָיוּ הַזְּקֵנִים שֶׁנֶּהֱנִים מִמֶּנּוּ בְּלוּלְבֵיהֶן.
human_translation: willow may not derive benefit but not misuse. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: The elders were accustomed to derive benefit from in their lulav ,
llm_translation: Aravah - not benefitting and not causing harm. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: The elders used to be accustomed to benefit from it with their lulavs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בְּכוּלָּן, אֲבָל מוֹעֲלִין בְּשָׁלֹשׁ לוּגִּין.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: not misusing all of But misusing three log
llm_translation: Gemara. Reish Lakish said: We do not perform circumcision on all of them, but we do perform circumcision on three log.

hebrew_text: וְהָקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״נְתָנוֹ לִצְלוֹחִית – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן״, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁלֹשֶׁת לוּגִּין נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: But the latter clause teaches one placed into the flask misusing by inference that the first clause not even if three log .
llm_translation: And the later clause teaches: "If one placed it in a window - it is considered as if he has rendered it unfit for use," this is derived from the principle of the earlier clause, even with three logs it is not effective!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר אַסֵּיפָא אִיתְּמַר. מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated it was stated with regard to the latter clause misusing Reish Lakish says its misuse only if three log
llm_translation: Rather, if the end is disputed, the end is disputed. They are disqualified, Reish Lakish said: One is only disqualified with three logs.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר – מוֹעֲלִין בְּכוּלָּן. לְמֵימְרָא דְקָסָבַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: יֵשׁ שִׁיעוּר לַמַּיִם, וְהָתְנַן, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַמְנַסֵּךְ מֵי חַג, בֶּחָג בַּחוּץ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: misusing any of to say that Reish Lakish holds there is measure for water But didn’t we learn Rabbi Eliezer, says: One who pours, as a libation, water of the festival during the Festival, outside liable
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said - they are effective in all of them. To say that Reish Lakish holds: there is a measurement for water, and we learned, Rabbi Eliezer said: one who pours water of the festival, on the festival outside - is liable.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם מְנַחֵם יוֹדָאפָה: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אָמַר, דְּדָרֵישׁ ״נִסְכֵּיהֶם״ – אֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם, וְאֶחָד נִיסּוּךְ הַיַּיִן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Menaḥem Yodafa: Rabbi Elazar says in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, who interprets its libations” One water libation, and one wine libation,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Menachem Yodafa: Rabbi Elazar in the name of Rabbi Akiva said, as it is interpreted, "their libations" - one poured the water libation, and one poured the wine libation.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אִי מָה יַיִן שָׁלֹשׁ לוּגִּין, אַף מַיִם שָׁלֹשׁ לוּגִּין! מִכְּלָל דְּסָבַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אֵין שִׁיעוּר לַמַּיִם! לְטַעְמָא דִּמְנַחֵם יוֹדָאפָה, קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said If Just as wine three log , so too water, three log . by inference that Reish Lakish holds there is no measure for water stated according to explanation of Menaḥem Yodafa,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: If wine is three log, also water is three log! From the principle that Reish Lakish holds, there is no measure for water! The reason is because of Menachem Yodafa, he said.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַקֵּן שֶׁבְּרֹאשׁ הָאִילָן שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – לָא נֶהֱנִין וְלֹא מוֹעֲלִין. שֶׁבָּאֲשֵׁירָה – יַתִּיז בְּקָנֶה. הַמַּקְדִּישׁ אֶת הַחוֹרֶשׁ – מוֹעֲלִין בְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: nest that is atop the consecrated tree, may not derive benefit but not misuse. that is a tree worshipped as idolatry, one should dislodge with a pole. one who consecrates forest, one is misusing in the entire
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The nest on top of the tree of the Temple - one does not benefit from it, nor is it considered a trespass. If it is in a tree designated for idol worship - one should be cautious with it. One who sanctifies the plowman - it is considered a trespass in its entirety.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר, עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּבְּרָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲסוּרָה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: was stated: idol worship that broke by itself, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: prohibited and Reish Lakish says: permitted
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: foreign worship that was broken from it. Rabbi Yochanan said: prohibited. And Reish Lakish said: permitted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אֲסוּרָה – דְּלָא בַּטְּלַהּ גּוֹי. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מוּתֶּרֶת – מֵימָר אָמַר: הִיא גּוּפַהּ לָא מַצְּלָה, לְדִידִי מַצְּלָה לִי?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says prohibited, as a gentile did not nullify And Reish Lakish says permitted, saying not save itself save me
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Asurah - because a non-Jew did not nullify it." And Reish Lakish said: "Muteres - from what statement did he say: 'It is not a safeguard for itself, but for me it is a safeguard'?"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַקֵּן שֶׁבְּרֹאשׁ הָאִילָן שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – אֵין נֶהֱנִין וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין. שֶׁבָּאֲשֵׁירָה יַתִּיז בְּקָנֶה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan the nest that is atop the consecrated tree, may not derive benefit but not misuse. that is the tree worshipped as idolatry one should dislodge with a pole.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: The nest on top of the tree of the Temple - one may not benefit from it and one may not move it. If it is in a tree, it is permitted to shake it off with a stick.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו דְּאִיתְּבַר מִגּוּפַהּ, וְקָתָנֵי, יַתִּיז בְּקָנֶה? לָא, דְּאַיְיתִי עֵצִים מֵעָלְמָא.
human_translation: What, is it not that broke from itself, and teaches: One should dislodge with a pole? No, where brought branches from elsewhere,
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is not considered part of its body, yet it is taught, "He shall flee to one of those cities"? No, for he brings wood from elsewhere.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֵין נֶהֱנִין וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין?
human_translation: If so, why of a consecrated may not derive benefit but not misuse?
llm_translation: If so, why is it that the sanctified item is neither enjoyed nor misused?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בְּגִידּוּלִין הַבָּאִין לְאַחַר מִכָּאן, וְקָסָבַר אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בְּגִידּוּלִין.
human_translation: Rather, to growths that came afterward, And holds not misusing growths
llm_translation: Rather, in regards to sinews that come after this, and he holds that one does not violate with sinews.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּאַיְיתִי מֵעָלְמָא, אַמַּאי יַתִּיז בְּקָנֶה? לִשְׁקְלֵיהּ מִשְׁקָל!
human_translation: This, too, stands to reason, as, if enters your mind where brought from elsewhere, why, dislodge with a pole? Let him take it
llm_translation: So it was said: If it enters your mind that I brought it from the world, why should he be particular about the reed? Weigh it with a weight!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם דְּאַיְיתִי מֵעָלְמָא, וּמַאי ״יַתִּיז״? יַתִּיז אֶפְרוֹחִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said Actually, where brought from elsewhere, and what One should dislodge? should dislodge chicks
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu, said Rabbi Yochanan: Always bring from the world, and what is "yattiz"? Yattiz feathers.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב לְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אֶפְרוֹחִים כָּאן וְכָאן – מוּתָּרִין. בֵּיצִים, כָּאן וְכָאן – אֲסוּרִין. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם אֶפְרוֹחִים צְרִיכִין לְאִמָּן – כְּבֵיצִים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya: chicks here and there, permitted eggs, here and there, prohibited Rav Ashi says: If chicks need their mother are considered like eggs,
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Yaakov to Rabbi Yirmiyah, peeled eggs here and there - permissible. Eggs, here and there - prohibited. Rav Ashi said: If peeled eggs require preparation - they are like eggs that are cooked.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגִּזְבָּרִים שֶׁלָּקְחוּ עֵצִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּעֵצִים, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין לֹא בַּשִּׁיפּוּיי וְלֹא בַּנְּבִיָּיה.
human_translation: the treasurers who purchased logs misusing the wood but not misusing sawdust, nor for leaves [ baneviyya ]
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Those who gather wood - are disqualified with regard to the wood, but they are not disqualified neither with regard to the ashes nor with regard to the coals."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בּוֹנִין בַּחוֹל וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְדִּישִׁין.
human_translation: Shmuel says builds with non-sacred and afterward consecrates
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said: "One builds with sand, and afterwards sanctifies."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? מַאן דְּמִתְנַדֵּב מָעוֹת מַקְדֵּשׁ לְהוּ, דְּאָמַר: ״תֵּיחוּל קְדוּשַּׁת מָעוֹת אַבִּנְיָן״,
human_translation: What is the reason One who donates money consecrates if said sanctity of money take effect on structure,
llm_translation: "What is the reason? One who donates money consecrates it, as it says: 'The holiness of money shall be for the building.'"

hebrew_text: וִיהֵיב לְהוֹן לְאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן.
human_translation: And give to the artisans as their wages.
llm_translation: And he gave to them to craftsmen in their wages.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מוֹתַר הַקְּטֹרֶת מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בּוֹ? הָיוּ מַפְרִישִׁין מִמֶּנָּה שְׂכַר הָאוּמָּנִין.
human_translation: raises an objection incense left over what would they do with it would set aside of it wages of the artisans
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: The leftover incense, what would they do with it? They would separate from it the wages of the craftsmen.

hebrew_text: וּמְחַלְּלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מְעוֹת הָאוּמָּנִין, וְנוֹתְנִין אוֹתָהּ לָאוּמָּנִין, וְחוֹזְרִין וְנוֹטְלִין אוֹתָהּ מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: And they would desacralize to money the artisans. And they give to the artisans And they would return and buy from the new collection
llm_translation: And we desecrate it for the sake of the craftsmen, and we give it to the craftsmen, and then we take it back from a new contribution.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לַיחֲלַיהּ אַבִּנְיָן!
human_translation: But why Let them desacralize to structure,
llm_translation: And why? To establish the building!

hebrew_text: דְּלָא אִיכָּא בִּנְיָן. וְהָא ״מְעוֹת הָאוּמָּנִין״ קָתָנֵי! דְּלֵיכָּא בִּנְיָן כְּשִׁיעוּר מָעוֹת.
human_translation: where there is no structure But teaches: wages of the artisans, where there is no construction equaling the amount of value
llm_translation: There is no building. But it is written, "the craftsmen's wages"! There is no building as the amount of wages.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְחוּלָּל! הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּאִי עֲבַד, לְכַתְּחִלָּה – לָא.
human_translation: But doesn’t Shmuel say consecrated worth one hundred that redeemed it for worth one peruta , redeemed, This statement where one did not ab initio .
llm_translation: And Samuel said: If consecrated property is equal to a hundred, and one profanes it for the sake of a single perutah - it is profaned! These are the words of one who acts, but ideally - no.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּבוֹנִין בַּחוֹל – לֹא נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, אִמְרֵי דִּלְמָא בָּעֵי לְמִיזְגָּא, וּזְגָא עֲלַיְיהוּ. אִי בְּנָא בְּקוּדְשָׁא – אִישְׁתְּכַח דְּקָמָעֵיל בְּקוּדְשָׁא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: This is reason that one builds with non-sacred Torah was not given to the ministering angels, said perhaps want to sit and sit on them. if he builds with consecrated be found that he misused consecrated
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This is the reason for building with sand - the Torah was not given to ministering angels, perhaps they may want to mix and the sand will be upon them. If it were built with holiness - it would be found that it is fitting for holiness.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַגִּזְבָּרִין שֶׁלָּקְחוּ אֶת הָעֵצִים – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין לֹא בַּשִּׁיפּוּיי וְלֹא בַּנְּבִיָּיה.
human_translation: we learned the treasurers who purchased logs misusing but not misusing sawdust, nor for leaves
llm_translation: We learned: The Gazbarin who took the wood - they are disqualified, and one does not disqualify neither in the burning nor in the ashes.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן? הָכָא נָמֵי לֶיעְבַּד בַּחוֹל, אָמְרִי דְּדִלְמָא בָּעֵי לְמִיזְגָּא, וּזְגָא עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח דְּקָא מוֹעֵל בְּקָדָשִׁים!
human_translation: But why for misusing Here too, let him work with non-sacred said that perhaps want to sit and sit on them, and be found that he misused consecrated
llm_translation: And why are they disqualified? Here it is said to be done on a weekday, they say perhaps he wants to mix, and he mixes with them, and it is found that he is being deceitful with holy things!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי בְּעֵצִים דְּמִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא כִּי תְּנַן בְּמַתְנִיתִין, בְּעֵצִים דְּיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said if to logs from this forward, indeed But when we learned in the mishna to logs on that day.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If regarding wood from here and onwards, so it is said. Rather, as we learned in the Mishnah, regarding wood of its day.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ וְלַד חַטָּאת
llm_translation: We will return to you, and to the sin-offering.

hebrew_text: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ , מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לִמְעִילָה וּלְחַיֵּיב עֲלֵיהֶם מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא. קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: consecrated altar join together for misuse And to liable due to piggul , or notar , or ritually impure. consecrated Temple maintenance join together Both consecrated altar and consecrated Temple maintenance join together for misuse.
llm_translation: The holy items of the altar, they combine with each other for the purpose of liability for the transgressions of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei. The holy items of the Temple floor combine with each other. The holy items of the altar and the holy items of the Temple floor combine with each other for the purpose of liability.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ וְאֶחָד קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת״ דְּהַאי קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף וְהַאי קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי קָתָנֵי: ״מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה״. ״קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ עִם קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ״ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Now one says that teaches Both consecrated altar and consecrated Temple maintenance where this inherent sanctity and that sanctity value, even so teaches join together for misuse, is necessary consecrated altar with consecrated altar?
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Can it be said that it is taught: "One is the sanctities of the altar and one is the sanctities of the Temple chamber," for this sanctity of the body and this sanctity of blood, even so it is taught: "They combine with each other." "The sanctities of the altar with the sanctities of the altar" - what is the question?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ ״לְחַיֵּיב עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל נוֹתָר וְטָמֵא״, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לָא אִיכָּא הָכִי, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָא פְּלִיג לֵיהּ.
human_translation: because he teaches with regard to to liable due to piggul , or notar , or ritually impure. as these do not Temple maintenance. due to that divides
llm_translation: Due to the fact that it is taught regarding it "liable for them due to the prohibition of Pigul, remaining and impure," since the consecrated items of the Temple floor are not thus, therefore he disputes with it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: מְחַוַּורְתָּא, אֵין חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם מְעִילָה אֶלָּא עַל קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת וְעוֹלָה בִּלְבַד. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תִּמְעֹל מַעַל מִקׇּדְשֵׁי ה׳״,
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: It is clear liable for misuse only for consecrated Temple maintenance and a burnt offering alone. What is the reason? that the verse states: “If anyone commit a misuse, and sin through error, in the sacred items of the Lord,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: Mechavvurta, one is not liable for misappropriation except for the holy things of the Temple courtyard and burnt offerings alone. What is the reason? As the verse states: "When a person commits a trespass and sins inadvertently in regard to the holy things of the Lord" (Leviticus 5:15).

hebrew_text: קֳדָשִׁים הַמְיוּחָדִין לַה׳ – יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מְעִילָה. אֲבָל קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ – אִית בְּהוּ לַכֹּהֲנִים, וְאִית בְּהוּ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: consecrated that are uniquely for the Lord are subject to misuse; but consecrated altar, have to the priests and have to the owners,
llm_translation: Holy items designated for the Lord - have in them a covering garment. But items of the altar - there are in them for the priests, and there are in them for the owners.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לִמְעִילָה! מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: We learned consecrated altar join together for misuse, by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The consecrated items of the altar combine with each other for the purpose of being taken up! This is according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בַּדָּרוֹם – מוֹעֲלִים בָּהֶן! מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered them in the south misusing them. by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Holy of Holies that slaughtered in the south - they are disqualified! From the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הַחַטָּאת כְּשֶׁהִיא חַיָּה – לֹא מָעַל עַד שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם. כְּשֶׁהִיא מֵתָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – מָעַל! מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: We learned One who derives benefit from sin offering while it is alive has not misuse until he depletion when it is dead once he derives benefit he is liable for misuse. by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: We learned: One who benefits from the sin-offering while it is alive - does not transgress until it is blemished. When it is dead, as soon as one benefits in any way - he transgresses! This is the opinion of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב לַה׳״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֵימוּרֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים לִמְעִילָה!
human_translation: And by Torah law no But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: all the fat is the Lord’s” to include the portions of offerings of lesser sanctity to misuse.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from the Torah not? And it was taught, Rabbi says: "All fat is for the Lord" - to include light sayings of holy things for burning!

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבָּנַן. וְהָא קְרָא קָא נָסֵיב לַהּ! אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: by rabbinic law. But cites a verse a mere support,
llm_translation: From the sages. But this verse is being used to support it! A mere support.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר עוּלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁמֵּתוּ – יָצְאוּ מִידֵי מְעִילָה דְּבַר תּוֹרָה. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, אֲפִילּוּ כִּי מֵתוּ נָמֵי, לָא יְהֵא אֶלָּא דְּאַקְדֵּישׁ אַשְׁפָּה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת, לָאו אִית בַּהּ מְעִילָה?
human_translation: But didn’t Ulla say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Sacrificial that died are excluded from of misuse by Torah law? To what If we say to consecrated Temple maintenance, even when they are dead be only where one consecrated a garbage to Temple maintenance, isn’t that subject to misuse
llm_translation: And this, Ula said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Holy items that died - they are exempt from the obligation of Torah. With what? If you say with the sanctified items of the Temple courtyard, even if they died, should it not be that one should only sanctify ashes for the Temple courtyard, does it not have an obligation of Torah?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! מִי אִית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה?
human_translation: Rather, consecrated altar, by Torah law. are subject to misuse
llm_translation: Rather, the sanctified items of the altar, which are from the Torah! Who has a cloak in them?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: מֵהַאי קְרָא קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת שָׁמְעִין מִינַּהּ, קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ לָא שָׁמְעִין מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, the school of Rabbi Yannai says as follows: From this verse: we learn consecrated Temple maintenance we do not learn altar
llm_translation: Rather, thus they say in the school of Rabbi Yannai: From this verse, we learn that the sanctity of the Temple courtyard is derived from it, but the sanctity of the altar is not derived from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בָּעוֹלָה מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה: הַבָּשָׂר, וְהַחֵלֶב, וְהַסּוֹלֶת, וְהַיַּיִן, וְהַשֶּׁמֶן. וְשִׁשָּׁה בַּתּוֹדָה: הַבָּשָׂר, וְהַחֵלֶב, וְהַסּוֹלֶת, וְהַיַּיִן, וְהַשֶּׁמֶן וְהַלֶּחֶם.
human_translation: Five items in the burnt offering join together The flesh; the fat the fine flour the wine and the oil And there are six in the thanks offering The flesh, the fat, the fine flour, the wine, the oil, and the loaves
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Five things in an offering combine with each other: the meat, the fat, the flour, the wine, and the oil. And six things in a thanksgiving offering: the meat, the fat, the flour, the wine, the oil, and the bread.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרָבָא: ״חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בָּעוֹלָם מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה״. אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״בָּעוֹלָם״ קָא אָמְרַתְּ? וְהָא קָתָנֵי בַּתּוֹדָה ״שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹדָה – הַבָּשָׂר וְהַחֵלֶב וְהַסּוֹלֶת וְהַיַּיִן וְהַשֶּׁמֶן וְלַחְמֵי תוֹדָה״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנִי ״בָּעוֹלָה״.
