human_translation: Rav Huna taught Rava Five items in the world [ ba’olam ] join together. said to Did you say: In the world, But isn’t it taught with regard to a thanks offering there are six in the thanks offering The flesh, the fat, the fine flour, the wine, the oil, and the loaves thanks offering? said to teach in the burnt offering [ ba’ola ]
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches Rav Huna to Rava: "Five things in the world combine with each other." He said to him: "In the world you are saying? But it is taught in the blessing, 'Six things in the blessing - the meat, the fat, the flour, the wine, the oil, and the loaves of the blessing'!" He said to him: Teach 'in the world.'

hebrew_text: תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: עוֹלוֹת וְאֵימוּרִים מִצְטָרְפִין לִכְזַיִת לְהַעֲלוֹתָן בַּחוּץ, וּלְחַיֵּיב עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא.
human_translation: we learned this, as the Sages taught burnt offerings and sacrificial portions join together to an olive-bulk for sacrificing them outside and to render liable for them due to piggul , notar , and ritually impure.
llm_translation: We have learned in that which the Rabbis taught: Burnt offerings and sacrificial portions combine to form a minimum measure for their offering outside, and one is liable for them due to the prohibition of "Piggul," "leftover," and "impure."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: בְּעוֹלָה – אִין, בִּשְׁלָמִים – לָא. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְהַעֲלוֹתָן בַּחוּץ, עוֹלָה דְּכָלִיל הִיא – מִצְטָרְפִין, שְׁלָמִים – לָא מִצְטָרְפִין. אֶלָּא לְחַיֵּיב עֲלֵיהֶן מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא, שְׁלָמִים אַמַּאי לָא מְחַיֵּיב?
human_translation: teaches with regard to a burnt offering, yes, with regard to a peace offering, not Granted, with regard to sacrificing them outside a burnt offering, which is consumed joins together, peace offerings, not join together. But with regard to rendering liable piggul , and notar , and them ritually impure, a peace offering why not rendered liable?
llm_translation: The text states: It was taught: regarding an Olah - no, regarding Shelamim - yes. Regarding Shelamim, to offer them outside the Temple, since an Olah is entirely consumed, they combine with other sacrifices, but Shelamim do not combine. Rather, one is liable for them due to Pigul, Nosar, and Tamei. Why are Shelamim not liable for combining with other sacrifices?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַפִּיגּוּלִים מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וְכׇל הַנּוֹתָרוֹת מִצְטָרְפוֹת זוֹ עִם זוֹ!
human_translation: But didn’t we learn All piggul join together with one another and all notar join together with one another
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: All disqualified sacrifices combine with each other, and all remnants combine with each other!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: עוֹלָה וְאֵימוּרֶיהָ מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לִכְזַיִת לִיזְרֹק עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: Rather, say a burnt offering and its sacrificial portions join together to an olive-bulk to sprinkle the blood for them.
llm_translation: Rather say: "The burnt offering and its accompanying rites combine with each other for sprinkling the blood upon them."

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּמִצְטָרְפִין לִיזְרֹק אֶת הַדָּם – חַיָּיב וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: And since they join together with regard to sprinkling the blood, liable
llm_translation: And since they are combined to sprinkle the blood - liable, and so on.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַזְּבָחִים שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵהֶן כְּזַיִת בָּשָׂר וּכְזַיִת חֵלֶב – זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, כַּחֲצִי זַיִת בָּשָׂר וְכַחֲצִי זַיִת חֵלֶב – אֵינוֹ זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם.
human_translation: And who is who teaches It is Rabbi Yehoshua, as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all the offerings in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of meat or an olive-bulk of fat one sprinkles the blood. half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, one may not sprinkle the blood.
llm_translation: And who taught this? It is Rabbi Yehoshua, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says: All sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them the size of an olive of meat and an olive of fat - one should sprinkle the blood; if there remains half an olive of meat and half an olive of fat - one should not sprinkle the blood.

hebrew_text: וּבָעוֹלָה, אֲפִילּוּ כַּחֲצִי זַיִת בָּשָׂר וְכַחֲצִי זַיִת חֵלֶב – זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ כָּלִיל. וּבַמִּנְחָה, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלָּהּ קַיֶּימֶת – לֹא יִזְרוֹק.
human_translation: But with regard to a burnt offering, even half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, one sprinkles the blood, because it is all consumed And in a meal offering, even all of it remains, one may not sprinkle
llm_translation: In the burnt offering, even if it is half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat - one throws the blood, because its entirety is complete. And in the meal offering, even if it is entirely intact - it shall not be thrown.

hebrew_text: מִנְחָה מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִנְחַת נְסָכִים.
human_translation: What is the relevance of a meal offering Rav Pappa said: the meal offering libations
llm_translation: Mincha, what does it do? Rav Papa said: A meal offering of libations.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַתְּרוּמָה, וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁל דְּמַאי, וְהַחַלָּה, וְהַבִּיכּוּרִים – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לֶאֱסוֹר וּלְחַיֵּיב עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ. כׇּל הַפִּיגּוּלִים – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. וְכׇל הַנּוֹתָרִים – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: , and teruma of the tithe, and teruma of the tithe of doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ], and ḥalla , and first fruits join together with one another to prohibit and to obligated for their of one-fifth All piggul join together with one another and all notar joins together with one another
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The Terumah, and the tithe of the tithe, and the tithe of Demai, and the Challah, and the first-fruits - they combine with each other to render one liable to the prohibition and to obligate the payment of the fifth. All disqualified priests combine with each other. And all remnants combine with each other.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? כּוּלְּהוּ אִיקְּרוּ ״תְּרוּמָה״. גַּבֵּי חַלָּה כְּתִיב: ״רֵאשִׁית עֲרִסֹתֵכֶם חַלָּה תָּרִימוּ תְרוּמָה״,
human_translation: What is the reason all of them are called teruma With regard to ḥalla it is written: “Of the first of your dough you shall set apart ḥalla for a teruma ;
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? All of them are called "terumah." Regarding challah, it is written: "The first of your dough you shall give to the kohen as terumah."

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי בִּיכּוּרִים נָמֵי אִיקְּרוּ ״תְּרוּמָה״, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּתְרוּמַת יָדֶךָ״ – אֵלּוּ בִּיכּוּרִים, אֲבָל אִינָךְ – לָא צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: With regard to first fruits, they are also called teruma , as it is taught “And the offering of your hand”; these are first fruits. But the other is not necessary
llm_translation: Regarding the pits of figs, they are called "terumah," as it was taught: "and the offering of your hand" - these are the pits, but not - it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַנְּבֵילוֹת – מִצְטָרְפִין זוֹ עִם זוֹ. וְכׇל הַשְּׁקָצִים – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: All animal carcasses, join together with one another And all repugnant creatures join together with one another
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All neveilot - combine with each other. And all shekatzim - combine with each other.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav says:
llm_translation: Gemara, Rav said:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן אֲכִילָה – טְהוֹרִין בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וּטְמֵאִים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לַאֲכִילָה נָמֵי מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: taught only with regard to ritual impurity. But with regard to eating kosher distinct, and non-kosher distinct. And Levi says: Even with regard to eating join together.
llm_translation: They did not teach except regarding matters of ritual impurity, but regarding matters of eating - the pure are separate by themselves, and the impure are separate by themselves. And Levi said: Even for eating, they also combine.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אַסִּי אָמַר: טְהוֹרִים לְעַצְמָן וּטְמֵאִין לְעַצְמָן. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: פְּלִיגָא אַדְּרַב, וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לָא פְּלִיגָא.
human_translation: And Rav Asi says: Kosher distinct, and non-kosher distinct. there are who say disagrees with of Rav, And there are who say does not disagree
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: The pure remain pure, and the impure remain impure. Some say: This is a dispute of Rav, and some say: It is not a dispute.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מִיתַת פָּרָה, וְחַיֵּי גָמָל – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. הָא מִיתַת שְׁנֵיהֶם – מִצְטָרְפִין, וְקַשְׁיָא לְרַב אַסִּי!
human_translation: raises an objection a dead cow and a live camel, do not join together with one another. both of them dead, they join together. but a difficulty to Rav Asi.
llm_translation: Challenger: The death of a cow and the life of a camel - they do not combine with each other. But the death of both of them - they combine, and it is difficult for Rav Assi!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: הָא חַיֵּי שְׁנֵיהֶם – מִצְטָרְפִין, וּמַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵבֶר מִן הַחַי נוֹהֵג בַּטְּמֵאָה.
human_translation: say both of them alive, they join together. And who is is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: a limb from a living applies to a non-kosher
llm_translation: Mother: The life of both - combine, and count - Rabbi Yehuda it is, for he said: a limb from a living animal is subject to ritual impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִיתַת שְׁנֵיהֶם, מַאי? לָא מִצְטָרְפִי? אִם כֵּן, מַאי אִירְיָא דְּרָהֵיט וְתָנֵי ״מִיתַת פָּרָה וְחַיֵּי גָמָל״, הָא אֲפִילּוּ מִיתַת שְׁנֵיהֶם לָא מִצְטָרְפִי!
human_translation: But what both of them, are dead? not join together? If so, why run specifically and teach: a dead cow and a live camel? even both of them dead, they not join together.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But their death, what? Not combined? If so, what is the meaning of "the death of the cow and the life of the camel," for even their death is not combined! English translation:

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: חֲצִי זַיִת פָּרָה בְּחַיֶּיהָ וַחֲצִי זַיִת גָּמָל בְּמִיתָתָהּ – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. אֲבָל חֲצִי זַיִת מִפָּרָה וַחֲצִי זַיִת מִגָּמָל, בֵּין בְּחַיֶּיהָ בֵּין בְּמִיתָתָהּ – מִצְטָרְפִין. קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא אַסֵּיפָא! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִיתַת שְׁנֵיהֶם – מִצְטָרְפִין!?
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught Half an olive-bulk a cow when it is alive and half an olive-bulk a camel when it is dead do not join together; but half an olive-bulk from a cow and half an olive-bulk from a camel, whether alive or dead, do join together. The first clause difficult by the latter clause. Rather, isn’t it conclude from the two of them dead, join together?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And furthermore, it was taught: Half an olive-bulk of a cow in its lifetime and half an olive-bulk of a camel in its death - they do not combine. But half an olive-bulk from a cow and half an olive-bulk from a camel, whether in its lifetime or in its death - they combine. The difficulty is in the beginning of the Mishnah! Rather, is it not logical from it: their deaths - they combine!?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב אַסִּי: הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Rav Asi said to you this tanna holds a prohibition takes effect prohibition
llm_translation: Rav Assi said to you: This Tanna holds that one prohibition takes effect upon another prohibition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב: אֲכִילַת שְׁרָצִים – לוֹקֶה עָלָיו בִּכְזַיִת. מַאי טַעְמָא? ׳אֲכִילָה׳ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: eating creeping animals, is flogged for an olive-bulk What is the reason? “eating” is written with regard to them.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: Eating sheratzim - one is lashed on account of it with a stick. What is the reason? "Eating" is written in it.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״וְהִבְדַּלְתֶּם בֵּין הַבְּהֵמָה הַטְּהֹרָה לַטְּמֵאָה וּבֵין הָעוֹף הַטָּמֵא לַטָּהֹר וְלֹא תְשַׁקְּצוּ אֶת נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶם בַּבְּהֵמָה וּבָעוֹף וּבְכֹל אֲשֶׁר תִּרְמֹשׂ הָאֲדָמָה אֲשֶׁר הִבְדַּלְתִּי לָכֶם לְטַמֵּא״ – פָּתַח הַכָּתוּב בַּאֲכִילָה, וְסִיֵּים בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina teach before Rabbi Yoḥanan: “You shall separate between the kosher animal and the non-kosher, and between the non-kosher bird and the kosher; and you shall not make your souls detestable by animal, or by bird, or by anything that swarms on the ground, which I have set apart for you as impure” The verse opens with eating and ends with ritual impurity
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught by Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, before Rabbi Yochanan: 'And you shall separate between the clean animal and the unclean, and between the unclean bird and the clean; and you shall not make yourselves detestable with the animal, or with the bird, or with anything that creeps on the ground, which I have set apart for you to make unclean.'" - The Scripture begins with eating and concludes with impurity.

hebrew_text: מָה טוּמְאָה בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה, אַף אֲכִילָה בְּכַעֲדָשָׁה. וְקַלְּסֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְקַשְׁיָא לִדְרַב!
human_translation: just as ritual impurity when a lentil-bulk, so too, eating when a lentil-bulk. And Rabbi Yoḥanan praised [ vekilseih ] And a difficulty to Rav,
llm_translation: "What is the impurity in a lentil, so too is the consumption in a lentil." And Rabbi Yochanan disparaged it, and it is difficult for the Master!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בְּמִיתָתָן, כָּאן – בְּחַיֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, when they are dead, there, when they are alive,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here - in their death, here - in their life.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא רַב אַמַּתְנִיתִין קָאֵי, וּמַתְנִיתִין ״כׇּל הַשְּׁרָצִים״ קָתָנֵי, אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִיתָתָן. לָאו דְּאִיכָּא פּוּרְתָּא מֵהַאי וּפוּרְתָּא מֵהַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הָהִיא דִּיּוּקָא דִּילָךְ הוּא. רַב – שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Abaye said to But Rav referring to the mishna, and the mishna teaches: And all the creeping animals even when they are dead. not where there is a bit of this and a bit of that Rav Yosef said to This inference, is yours. Rav merely saying a halakha
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: But Rav stands on the authority of the Mishnah, and the Mishnah teaches "all swarming things," even in their death. Is there not a distinction between this and that? Rav Yosef said to him: That is your own reasoning. Rav - he is stating a general principle.

hebrew_text: וְקַלְּסֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. מֵיתִיבִי: הָאֵיבָרִין – אֵין לָהֶן שִׁיעוּר, אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּזַיִת נְבֵלָה וּפָחוֹת מִכַּעֲדָשָׁה מִן הַשֶּׁרֶץ – מְטַמְּאִין. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לוֹקִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא בִּכְזַיִת!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan praised raises an objection The limbs have no measure Even less than an olive-bulk of a carcass or less than a lentil-bulk of a creeping animal, impart impurity. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one is flogged for them only an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yochanan disparaged it. It was asked: The limbs - they have no measure, even less than the size of an olive of a carcass and less than the size of a lentil of a creeping thing - they render impure. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One is only lashed for them with an olive's size!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּמוּבְדָּלִין דִּבֵּר הַכָּתוּב.
human_translation: Rava says the verse speaks, which are separated
llm_translation: Rava said: In Muvdalim the Scripture spoke.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְרָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בְּהֵמָה נָמֵי, לִיפְלְגִי בֵּין מוּבְדֶּלֶת לְשֶׁאֵינָהּ מוּבְדֶּלֶת.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: If that is so, also an animal. Let distinguish between separated which is not separated,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Ahava to Rava: Rather, from now on, let us distinguish between a designated animal and one that is not designated.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קָא מַקֵּישׁ רַחֲמָנָא – לְבַל תְּשַׁקְּצוּ, אֲבָל לְשִׁיעוּרִין – לָא.
human_translation: said to When the Merciful One juxtaposes to not make detestable” But with regard to measures not
llm_translation: He said to him: "When the Merciful One is being strict - it is to prevent abominations, but for leniencies - no."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דַּם הַשֶּׁרֶץ וְהַבָּשָׂר – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כֹּל שֶׁטּוּמְאָתוֹ וְשִׁיעוּרוֹ שָׁוִין – מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: The blood of the creeping animals and flesh join together Rabbi Yehoshua stated a principle: any whose impurity, and measure are equal, they join together
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: the blood of a creeping creature and the flesh - combine with each other. Rabbi Yehoshua said in general: anything whose impurity and measurement are equal - combine.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָתוֹ וְלֹא שִׁיעוּרוֹ, שִׁיעוּרוֹ וְלֹא טוּמְאָתוֹ, לֹא טוּמְאָתוֹ [וְלֹא] שִׁיעוּרוֹ – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: impurity but measure not measure but whose impurity not neither in their impurity their measure, they do not join together
llm_translation: His impurity and not his measure, his measure and not his impurity, not his impurity and not his measure - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חָנִין אָמַר רַב זְעֵירָא,
human_translation: Rav Ḥanin says Rav Zeira says:
llm_translation: "Gema' said, Rav Chanin said, Rav Zeira said,"

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״הַטְּמֵאִין״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֵן מִצְטָרְפִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁרֶץ וָשֶׁרֶץ, שֶׁרֶץ וָדָם, בֵּין מִשֵּׁם אֶחָד, בֵּין מִשְּׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת!
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina says, the impure [ hateme’in ] teaches that they join together And even a creeping animal and creeping animal, a creeping animal and blood whether from one category, or from two categories
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina: "The impure ones" - teaches that they combine, even a creeping thing and a creeping thing, a creeping thing and blood, whether from one name, or from two names!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן – בְּכוּלּוֹ. כָּאן – בְּמִקְצָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: not difficult. Here, from an entire There, from part of
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Not difficult, here - in its entirety. Here - in part.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא? מִדְּתַנְיָא: נִשְׁפַּךְ עַל הָרִצְפָּה וְהָיָה מְקוֹמָהּ קָטַפְרֵס, אִיהֵל עַל מִקְצָתוֹ – טָהוֹר, אִיהֵל עַל כּוּלּוֹ – טָמֵא.
human_translation: And from where do you say From that which is taught spilled on the floor, and its place was a slope [ ketafres ], covered part of it, ritually pure. covered all of it, impure.
llm_translation: And what is the reason for saying? From what is taught: If it spilled onto the floor and its place is tile, if it is on part of it - it is pure, if it is on all of it - it is impure.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״מִקְצָתוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא מִקְצָת דָּם, וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַבִּי: רְבִיעִית דָּם שֶׁהֵגִיס בָּהּ – טְהוֹרָה!
human_translation: What Part of it, If we say part of blood, But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say Rabbi says: one quarter- blood that one stirred pure,
llm_translation: "What is 'its end'? Perhaps the end of the blood, but Rabbi Hanina said in the name of Rabbi: A quarter-log of blood that was coagulated in it - is pure!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן – בְּכוּלּוֹ, כָּאן – בְּמִקְצָתוֹ? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t it conclude from here from an entire There, from part of conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a conclusive proof. Here - in its entirety, here - in part? Conclusive proof.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי בָּעִיר רוֹמִי: מִנַּיִן לְדַם שְׁרָצִים שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai in the city of Rome: From where with regard to blood of creeping animals that it is impure? said to him: that the verse states: “And these are they that are impure
llm_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Charash asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai in the city of Rome: From where do we derive that the blood of swarming creatures is impure? He said to him: As the verse states: "This shall be impure to you."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: חֲכֵים לֵיהּ בֶּן יוֹחַאי. אָמַר לָהֶם: תַּלְמוּד עָרוּךְ בְּפִיו שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. שֶׁפַּעַם אַחַת גָּזְרָה הַמַּלְכוּת גְּזֵרָה שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁמְרוּ אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָמוּלוּ אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם, וְשֶׁיִּבְעֲלוּ אֶת נִדּוֹת.
human_translation: students said to him wise is ben Yoḥai! said to them: a set tradition in the mouth of Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Yosei, As, on one occasion the monarchy issued a decree that may not observe Shabbat, and that they may not circumcise their sons, and that they must engage in intercourse with menstruating.
llm_translation: His students said to him: Wise is Ben Yohai. He said to them: The Talmud is arranged in the mouth of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei. For once the kingdom decreed a decree that they should not observe the Sabbath, and that they should not circumcise their sons, and that they should marry women who are forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ רַבִּי רְאוּבֵן בֶּן אִיסְטְרוֹבָּלִי, וְסִיפֵּר קוֹמֵי, וְהָלַךְ וְיָשַׁב עִמָּהֶם. אָמַר לָהֶם: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוֹיֵב, יַעֲנִי אוֹ יַעֲשִׁיר? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יַעֲנִי. אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם כֵּן, לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ מְלָאכָה בַּשַּׁבָּת, כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּעֲנוּ! אָמְרוּ: טָבֵית אָמַר, לִיבְטַל, וּבִטְּלוּהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Reuven ben Isterobeli went and cut a komei and he went and sat with He said to them: One who has an enemy, to become poor or to become rich? They said to him: to become poor. said to them: If so, they will not perform labor on Shabbat in order that they will become poor? said: a good he said; let us nullify And they nullified it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Reuven ben Isterovli walked, and he told a parable, and he walked and sat with them. He said to them: "If one has an enemy, should he make him poor or rich?" They said to him: "Make him poor." He said to them: "If so, they should not work on Shabbat, so that they become poor!" They said: "You have spoken well, let it be nullified, and they nullified it."

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְאָמַר לָהֶם: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוֹיֵב, יַכְחִישׁ אוֹ יַבְרִיא? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יַכְחִישׁ. אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם כֵּן, יָמוּלוּ בְּנֵיהֶם לִשְׁמוֹנָה יָמִים וְיַכְחִישׁוּ. אָמְרוּ: טָבֵית אָמַר, וּבִטְּלוּהָ.
human_translation: Again spoke to them One who has an enemy, to become weak or to become healthy? They said to him: to become weak. said to them: If so, they circumcise their sons after eight days and become weak? said: a good he said, and they nullified
llm_translation: He returned and said to them: "If one has an enemy, should he appease or strengthen him?" They said to him: "He should appease." He said to them: "If so, let their sons be circumcised on the eighth day and appease him." They said: "You have spoken well, and they annulled it."

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְאָמַר לָהֶם: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אוֹיֵב, יִרְבֶּה אוֹ יִתְמַעֵט? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יִתְמַעֵט. אִם כֵּן, לֹא יִבְעֲלוּ נִדּוֹת. אָמְרוּ: טָבֵית אָמַר, וּבִטְּלוּהָ.
human_translation: again spoke to them One who has an enemy, to multiply or to decrease? They said to him: to decrease. said to them: If so, do not engage in intercourse with menstruating? said: a good he said, and they nullified
llm_translation: He returned and said to them: "If one has an enemy, should he increase or decrease interactions?" They said to him: "Decrease." If so, they will not have menstrual impurity. They said: "Tavaita said, and they annulled it."

hebrew_text: הִכִּירוּ בּוֹ שֶׁהוּא יְהוּדִי, הֶחֱזִירוּם. אָמְרוּ: מִי יֵלֵךְ וִיבַטֵּל הַגְּזֵרוֹת?
human_translation: they recognized that was a Jew, reinstated said: Who will go and nullify decrees?
llm_translation: Recognize in him that he is a Jew, return them. They said: Who will go and annul the decrees?

hebrew_text: יֵלֵךְ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי, שֶׁהוּא מְלוּמָּד בְּנִסִּים. וְאַחֲרָיו מִי יֵלֵךְ? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai go as he is accustomed to miracles. And who shall go after him, Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai will go, for he is learned in miracles. And after him, who will go? Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְאִילּוּ הָיָה אַבָּא חֲלַפְתָּא קַיָּים, יְכוֹלִין אַתֶּם לוֹמַר לוֹ: תֵּן בִּנְךָ לַהֲרִיגָה? אָמַר לָהֶם ר׳ שִׁמְעוֹן: אִילּוּ הָיָה יוֹחַאי אַבָּא קַיָּים, יְכוֹלִין אַתֶּם לוֹמַר לוֹ: תֵּן בִּנְךָ לַהֲרִיגָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, said to But if Abba Ḥalafta, were alive, you be able to say to him: Give your son to be killed? Rabbi Shimon said to If Yoḥai, father, were alive, you be able to say to him: Give your son to be killed?
llm_translation: He said to them Rabbi Yosei: And if Abba Chalfata was alive, could you say to him, "Give your son for killing?" He said to them Rabbi Shimon: And if Yochai Abba was alive, could you say to him, "Give your son for killing?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנָא אָזְלִין, דִּלְמָא עָנֵישׁ לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּקָא מִסְתְּפֵינָא. קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ דְּלָא לִיעְנְשֵׁיהּ. אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, עַנְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to I will go as I fear: lest Rabbi Shimon, punish accepted upon himself that he would not punish even so, punish him
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Yosei: I will go, perhaps Rabbi Shimon will be punished, as I am suspected. He accepted upon himself not to be punished. Even so, he was punished.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, נִשְׁאֲלָה שְׁאֵלָה זוֹ בִּפְנֵיהֶם: מִנַּיִן לְדַם הַשֶּׁרֶץ שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא? עִקֵּם פִּיו רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְאָמַר: ״וְזֶה לָכֶם הַטָּמֵא״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מֵעֲקִימַת שְׂפָתֶיךָ אַתָּה נִיכָּר שֶׁתַּלְמִיד חָכָם אַתָּה, אַל יַחְזוֹר הַבֵּן אֵצֶל אָבִיו.
human_translation: When they were walking on the road, this question was asked before them: From where with regard to blood of a creeping animal that it is impure? Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Yosei twisted his mouth and said: “And these are they that are impure Rabbi Shimon said to him: From the twisting of your mouth it is clear you are a Torah scholar. the son will not return to his father.
llm_translation: When they were walking on the road, this question was asked before them: From where is the impurity of the creeping thing blood? Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei turned his mouth and said: "And this shall be unclean to you." Rabbi Shimon said to him: From the way your lips are turned, it is recognized that you are a Torah scholar; let not the son return to his father.

hebrew_text: יָצָא לִקְרָאתוֹ בֶּן תְּמַלְיוֹן: רְצוֹנְכֶם אָבוֹא עִמָּכֶם? בָּכָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְאָמַר: מַה שִּׁפְחָה שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא, נִזְדַּמֵּן לָהּ מַלְאָךְ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים. וַאֲנִי, לֹא פַּעַם אַחַת? יָבֹא הַנֵּס מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: ben Temalyon emerged to greet them. you wish I come with you Rabbi Shimon cried and said: What, a maidservant of father’s home, an angel was made available to her three times But I not one time, In any case, let the miracle come
llm_translation: He went out to meet him Ben Temalyon. "Do you wish that I come with you?" Rabbi Shimon wept and said: "The maidservant of the house of my father, an angel appeared to her three times. And I, not even once? The miracle may come from any place."

hebrew_text: קְדֵים הוּא, עַל בִּבְרַתֵּיהּ דְּקֵיסָר. כִּי מְטָא הָתָם, אָמַר: בֶּן תְּמַלְיוֹן, צֵא! בֶּן תְּמַלְיוֹן, צֵא! וְכֵיוָן דִּקְרוֹ לֵיהּ, נְפַק אֲזַל. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: שְׁאִילוּ כׇּל מָה דְּאִית לְכוֹן לְמִישְׁאַל. וְעַיְּילִינְהוּ לְגִנְזֵיהּ לִשְׁקוֹל כֹּל דְּבָעוּ. אַשְׁכַּחוּ הָהוּא אִיגְּרָא, שַׁקְלוּהָ וּקְרָעוּהָ.
human_translation: before ascended into the emperor’s daughter When arrived there, he said: Ben Temalyon, emerge! Ben Temalyon, emerge! And once called him, emerged and left he said to them: Ask any that you want to ask. And he took them up to his treasury to take whatever they wanted. They found that letter they took it and tore it
llm_translation: It is east, on the outskirts of the Caesar. When he arrived there, he said: "Son of Temalyon, come out! Son of Temalyon, come out!" And once he called to him, he went out. He said to them: "Ask for anything you need to ask for." They brought him to his treasury to weigh all that they needed. They found a letter there, took it and tore it.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ בָּעִיר רוֹמִי, וַהֲווֹ עָלֶיהָ כַּמָּה טִיפֵּי דָמִים.
human_translation: And this is which Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Yosei said I saw in the city of Rome, and on were several drops of blood
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw it in the city of Rome, and there were many drops of blood upon it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפִּיגּוּל וְהַנּוֹתָר – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן שְׁנֵי שֵׁמוֹת. הַשֶּׁרֶץ וְהַנְּבֵלָה, וְכֵן הַנְּבֵלָה וּבְשַׂר הַמֵּת – אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לְטַמֵּא, אֲפִילּוּ בַּקַּל שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: piggul and notar do not join together due to that they two categories the creeping animal and the animal carcass, and likewise the animal carcass and the flesh of the corpse, do not join together to transmit ritual impurity, even for the lenient of the two
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Pigul and Notar do not combine, because they are two different names. Sheretz and Neveilah, and likewise Neveilah and the flesh of a dead body, do not combine with each other to render impure, even in the smallest quantity in both of them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְטוּמְאַת הַיָּדַיִם, דְּמִדְּרַבָּנַן הִיא. אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן אֲכִילָה – מִצְטָרְפִין. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יֵאָכֵל כִּי קֹדֶשׁ הוּא״ – כֹּל שֶׁבַּקֹּדֶשׁ פָּסוּל, בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: taught only with regard to impurity of the hands is by rabbinic law. But with regard to matter of eating, they do join together. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: “It shall not be eaten because it is sacred” anything sacred disqualified the verse comes to apply a prohibition with regard to its consumption.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only made a distinction regarding the impurity of the hands, as it is a Rabbinic decree. But regarding matters of eating, they combine. As it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Eliezer says: "It shall not be eaten because it is holy" – anything that is disqualified in matters of holiness, the verse comes to say, "You shall not do upon its eating."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹכֶל שֶׁנִּטְמָא בְּאַב הַטּוּמְאָה, וְשֶׁנִּטְמָא בִּוְלַד הַטּוּמְאָה – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לְטַמֵּא בַּקַּל שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם. כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִים מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה לִפְסוֹל הַגְּוִיָּיה כְּבַחֲצִי פְרָס.
human_translation: The food that became ritually impure with a primary source of ritual impurity, and that became ritually impure with a secondary source of ritual impurity, join together to transmit impurity in accordance with the lenient of the two, All the foods join together to disqualify the body [ hageviyya ] half of a half-loaf-bulk [ peras ]
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who becomes impure through the father of impurity, and one who becomes impure through the offspring of impurity - they combine with each other to render impure through the lighter impurity of the two. All foods combine with each other to render unfit the size of half a barleycorn.

hebrew_text: כְּבִמְזוֹן שְׁתֵּי סְעוּדוֹת לְעֵירוּב, וּכְבֵיצָה לְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין, וְכִגְרוֹגֶרֶת לְהוֹצָאַת שַׁבָּת, וּכְכוֹתֶבֶת בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. כׇּל הַמַּשְׁקִין מִצְטָרְפִין זוֹ עִם זוֹ לִפְסוֹל אֶת הַגְּוִיָּיה בִּרְבִיעִית, וְכִמְלֹא לוּגְמָא בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: of food two meals, to a joining of boundaries; and of an egg-bulk, to render impure the ritual impurity of food; and of fig-bulk, for carrying out Shabbat; and of a large date, on Yom Kippur. All the liquids join together to disqualify the body of a quarter- log and of a cheekful, on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Like in the case of two meals for an Eruv, and like an egg for rendering food susceptible to impurity, and like a dried fig for carrying on Shabbat, and like writing on Yom Kippur. All liquids combine with each other to disqualify the ritual bath in a quantity of a quarter-log, and like a dried fig on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מָה טַעַם? שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַשֵּׁנִי שֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂה רִאשׁוֹן. וּמִי קָא עָבֵיד שֵׁנִי רִאשׁוֹן? הָא לָא אֶפְשָׁר!
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Shimon says: What is the reason that it is possible for second- to render first- But can second- render first- not possible.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, Rabbi Shimon omer: Mah ta'am? She'efshar la'sheni sheye'aseh rishon. Umi ka avid sheni rishon? Ha lo efshar!" English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says: What is the reason? That it is possible for the second to be made first. But who can make the second first? It is not possible!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִי גָּרַם לַשֵּׁנִי? לָאו רִאשׁוֹן?! רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי, לְגַבֵּי שְׁלִישִׁי – בְּנֵי חֲדָא בִּיקְתָּא אִינּוּן.
human_translation: Rava said this is saying: What caused second- not first- Rav Ashi said: first- and second- with regard to third- are members of one house,
llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: Who caused the second? Not the first?! Rav Ashe said: The first and the second, in comparison to the third - they are like the sons of one courtyard.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעׇרְלָה וְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: The fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ] and diverse kinds, in a vineyard join together Rabbi Shimon says: They do not join together.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The foreskin and mixtures of the vineyard - they combine with each other." Rabbi Shimon says: "They do not combine."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי צָרִיךְ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְצָרוֹפֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא לְמַכּוֹת? תְּנִי: אֵין צְרִיכִין לְצָרֵף.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, do need to join But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: any measure to lashes, teach They do not need to join together,
llm_translation: Gemara: And who needs Rabbi Shimon for the refiners? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who is for striking? It was taught: We do not need to refine.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבֶּגֶד וְהַשַּׂק, הַשַּׂק וְהָעוֹר, הָעוֹר וְהַמַּפָּץ – כּוּלָּן מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה.
human_translation: The garment and the sack, the sack and the hide, the hide and the mat all join together
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The garment and the sack, the sack and the skin, the skin and the mat – all of them combine with each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן רְאוּיִן לִיטָּמֵא בְּמוֹשָׁב.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason Because are fit to become ritually impure to a seat
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: What is the reason? Because they are fit to become impure through sitting.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: קִיצַּע מִכּוּלָּן שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְעָשָׂה מֵהֶן בֶּגֶד לְמִשְׁכָּב – שְׁלֹשָׁה, לְמוֹשָׁב – טֶפַח, לַאֲחִיזָה – כׇּל שֶׁהוּ.
human_translation: taught cut from each of three and fashioning a garment from them; for lying three for sitting, handbreadth. for holding, any measure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Kitzah mikullan shloshah, ve'asa mehen beged le'mishkav - shloshah, le'moshav - tefach, la'achizah - kol shehu." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: If one cuts from all of them three threads, and makes from them a garment for lying down - three threads, for sitting - a handbreadth, for holding - any amount."

hebrew_text: מַאי לַאֲחִיזָה? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: שֶׁכֵּן עוֹמֵד לְנַוְולָה. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְקוֹצְצֵי תְאֵנִים.
human_translation: What for holding? Reish Lakish says Rabbi Yannai says: because it stands when weaving [ lenavla ], was taught in a baraita : since it is suited for fig cutters
llm_translation: What is meant by "l'achizah"? Reish Lakish said, Rabbi Yannai said: because it is fit for being grafted. In the Mishnah it was taught: since it is fit for pruning figs.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ
llm_translation: We will return to you, O holy altar.

hebrew_text: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא פָּגַם – מָעַל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ פְּגָם – לֹא מָעַל, עַד שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם. וְשֶׁאֵין בּוֹ פְּגָם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה – מָעַל.
human_translation: One who derives benefit equal to one peruta from a consecrated item, even though he did not damage liable for misuse; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis say: any item that has damaged, not liable for misuse until he damage; and that does not have damaged, once he derives benefit liable for misuse.
llm_translation: Behold, from the consecrated item worth a perutah, even though it did not become blemished - he is liable, the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the sages say: Anything that has a blemish - he is not liable until it becomes blemished. And if it has no blemish, once he benefits from it - he is liable.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? נָתְנָה קַטְלָא בְּצַוָּארָהּ, טַבַּעַת בְּיָדָהּ, שָׁתָה בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה – מָעַל. לָבַשׁ בְּחָלוּק, כִּסָּה בְּטַלִּית, בִּיקַּע בְּקַרְדּוֹם – לֹא מָעַל עַד שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם.
human_translation: How so? placed chain [ ketala ] around her neck, ring on her hand, one drank from gold cup, once he derives benefit liable for misuse. one wore robe, covered with garment, chopped with ax, not liable for misuse until he damage.
llm_translation: How so? She placed a ketala on her neck, a ring in her hand, drank from a cup of gold, once she enjoyed - she is divorced. She wore a cloak, covered herself with a veil, pierced with a needle - she is not divorced until it wounds.

hebrew_text: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הַחַטָּאת, כְּשֶׁהִיא חַיָּה – לֹא מָעַל, עַד שֶׁיִּפְגּוֹם. כְּשֶׁהִיא מֵתָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה – מָעַל.
human_translation: One who derives benefit from a sin offering while it is alive not liable for misuse until he damage. When it is dead, once he derives benefit one peruta liable for misuse.
llm_translation: Behold, from the sin-offering, when it is alive - it does not commit a trespass, until it is blemished. When it is dead, once it derives benefit - it commits a trespass.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ : תָּנָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לַחֲכָמִים בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ פְּגָם. בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי?!
human_translation: taught Rabbi Akiva concedes to the Rabbis in an item that has damaged with regard to what disagree?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Tana: Modeh Rabbi Akiva la'Chachamim b'davar sheyesh bo pegam. B'mai ka mifalgai?! English translation: Gemara: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva concedes to the sages regarding a matter that has a flaw. With what does he disagree?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בִּלְבוּשׁ מְצִיעָאָה, וּמַלְמְלָא.
human_translation: Rava said: in a middle garment, And malmala ,
llm_translation: Rava said: "With a garment of linen, and a cloak."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״נֶפֶשׁ״ – אֶחָד הַיָּחִיד, וְאֶחָד הַנָּשִׂיא, וְאֶחָד הַמָּשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught anyone whether individual, and whether the king, and whether the anointed
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Nefesh" - one the individual, and one the prince, and one the anointed one.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי תִמְעֹל מַעַל״, אֵין ״מַעַל״ אֶלָּא שִׁנּוּי, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי תִשְׂטֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ וּמָעֲלָה בוֹ מַעַל״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּמְעֲלוּ בֵּאלֹהֵי
human_translation: commits a misuse [ ma’al ], ma’al means nothing other than deviation And similarly, states “If any man’s wife goes aside, and acts unfaithfully [ ma’al ] against him” And states “And they broke faith [ vayimalu ] with the God of
llm_translation: "When you act treacherously," 'treachery' is nothing but a substitution, as it says: "If a man commits adultery with another man's wife, committing treachery with him," and it says: "And they acted treacherously with the God."

hebrew_text: אֲבֹתֵיהֶם וַיִּזְנוּ אַחֲרֵי הַבְּעָלִים״.
human_translation: their fathers, and went astray after
llm_translation: Their fathers and they committed harlotry after the Baalim.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל פָּגַם וְלֹא נֶהֱנָה, אוֹ נֶהֱנָה וְלֹא פָּגַם,
human_translation: might damaged but did not derive benefit Or, he derived benefit but did not damage
llm_translation: Could damage and not benefit, or benefit and not damage.

hebrew_text: וּבִמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע, וּבְשָׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ?
human_translation: And of attached to the ground. And in an agent who he performed his agency,
llm_translation: And in a case of "bimchubar" to the ground, and in a case of "shaliach" who has fulfilled his agency?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְחָטְאָה״. נֶאֱמַר: ״חֵטְא״ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״חֵטְא״ בִּמְעִילָה.
human_translation: the verse states: and sins “sin” is stated with regard to teruma , and “sin” is stated with regard to misuse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is taught to say "and she sinned." It is stated: "sin" regarding Terumah, and it is stated: "sin" regarding Me'ilah.

hebrew_text: מָה ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּתְרוּמָה, פּוֹגֵם וְנֶהֱנֶה, וּמִי שֶׁפָּגַם נֶהֱנֶה, וּבַדָּבָר שֶׁפּוֹגֵם בּוֹ נֶהֱנֶה, וּפְגִימָתוֹ וַהֲנָאָתוֹ כְּאֶחָד, וּבְתָלוּשׁ מִן הַקַּרְקַע, וּבְשָׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ –
human_translation: Just as “sin” stated with regard to teruma , damages and derives benefit, and one who damaged derived benefit; and he derives benefit from the same item that he damages; and his damage and his benefit simultaneously; and to detached from the ground; and in an agent who performed his agency
llm_translation: "What is the 'sin' mentioned in regards to Terumah? It affects both the one who causes the blemish and the one who benefits from it. And in a matter where one causes a blemish and benefits from it, his blemish and benefit are considered as one. And if it is detached from the ground, and through an agent who performs his agency -"

hebrew_text: אַף ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּמְעִילָה, פּוֹגֵם וְנֶהֱנֶה, וּמִי שֶׁפָּגַם נֶהֱנֶה, וּבַדָּבָר שֶׁפּוֹגֵם בּוֹ נֶהֱנֶה, וּפְגִימָתוֹ וַהֲנָאָתוֹ כְּאֶחָד, וּבְתָלוּשׁ מִן הַקַּרְקַע, וּבְשָׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: So too, “sin” stated with regard to misuse damages and derives benefit and one who damaged derived benefit and he derives benefit from the item that he damages; and his damage and his deriving benefit simultaneously; and to detached from the ground; and in an agent who performed his agency.
llm_translation: Even the word "sin" mentioned in regards to a garment, it damages and benefits, and one who damages benefits, and in a matter where he damages he benefits, and his damage and benefit are considered as one, and if it is suspended from the ground, and through an agent who performs his agency.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אוֹכֵל, וְנֶהֱנֶה בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ פְּגָם, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: I have only he eats But derives benefit from an item that does not have damaged, from where
llm_translation: I have only one who eats, and enjoys something that has no defect, from where?

hebrew_text: אֲכִילָתוֹ וַאֲכִילַת חֲבֵרוֹ, הֲנָיָיתוֹ וַהֲנָיַית חֲבֵרוֹ, הֲנָאָתוֹ וַאֲכִילַת חֲבֵרוֹ, אֲכִילָתוֹ וַהֲנָיַית חֲבֵרוֹ שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה, אֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: his consumption and another’s consumption; his benefit and another’s benefit; his benefit and another’s consumption; his consumption and another’s benefit; that combine with one another, even a long time From where
llm_translation: Eating his and eating his friend's, drinking his and drinking his friend's, benefiting his and eating his friend's, eating his and drinking his friend's, that they combine with each other, even to invite many, from where?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּמְעֹל מַעַל״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The verse states: commits a misuse.” in any case,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Timol Ma'al" - from every place.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּתְרוּמָה – לֹא צֵירַף שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת כְּאֶחָד, אַף ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּמְעִילָה – לֹא צֵירַף שְׁתֵּי אֲכִילוֹת כְּאַחַד. מִנַּיִן אָכַל הַיּוֹם וְאָכַל לְמָחָר, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּמְעֹל מַעַל״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: If Just as “sin” that is stated with regard to teruma , not combine two consumption as one so too, “sin” that is stated with regard to misuse, not combine two consumption as one. From where ate today and ate tomorrow, even if much time The verse states: commits a misuse.” in any case.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If what "sin" is said in regards to Terumah - he did not combine two eatings as one, also "sin" said in regards to Me'ilah - he did not combine two eatings as one. From where do we know he ate today and ate tomorrow, and even to a distant time? The verse teaches: "He shall bear his iniquity" - in any case.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּתְרוּמָה – פְּגִימָתוֹ וַהֲנָאָתוֹ כְּאֶחָד, מִנַּיִן לַאֲכִילָתוֹ וַאֲכִילַת חֲבֵרוֹ? וַאֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּמְעֹל מַעַל״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: If Just as “sin” that is stated with regard to teruma , damage to and deriving benefit simultaneously, From where for his consumption and another’s consumption, and even from now until three years from where The verse states: commits a misuse.” in any case.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If what is the "sin" mentioned regarding Terumah - its blemish and its benefit are like one, from where do we learn the law regarding its consumption and the consumption of its fellow? And even from here until three years, from where? The Torah teaches: "He shall surely make restitution" - in any case.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה ״חֵטְא״ הָאָמוּר בִּתְרוּמָה
human_translation: If Just as “sin” that is stated with regard to teruma ,
llm_translation: If what is "sin" mentioned in regards to Terumah

hebrew_text: – עֵד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ לַחוֹל.
human_translation: until leaves from the sacred to the non-sacred,
llm_translation: Witness that goes out from the holy to the secular.

hebrew_text: מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ לַקֹּדֶשׁ, כְּגוֹן: לָקַח קִינֵּי זָבִים, וְקִינֵּי זָבוֹת, וְקִינֵּי יוֹלְדוֹת,
human_translation: from the sacred to the sacred such as acquired bird nests, for zavim or the bird nests for zavot or the bird nests for women after childbirth
llm_translation: From the holy to the holy, such as: he took the nests of males, and the nests of females, and the nests of those who have given birth,

hebrew_text: וְשָׁקַל שִׁקְלוֹ, וְהֵבִיא חַטָּאתוֹ וַאֲשָׁמוֹ מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ – כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹצִיא – מָעַל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיִּזְרוֹק הַדָּם. מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּמְעֹל מַעַל״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: And contributed his shekel, or brought his sin offering or his guilt offering from consecrated once he spends he has committed misuse. the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: until sprinkles the blood From where The verse states: commits a misuse.” in any case.
llm_translation: And he shall weigh his shekel, and bring his sin offering and guilt offering from the sanctuary - once he has brought them out - he has transgressed, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until the blood is sprinkled. From where? It is derived from the verse: "He has indeed trespassed" - in any case.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״נֶפֶשׁ״ – אֶחָד הַיָּחִיד וְאֶחָד הַנָּשִׂיא וְאֶחָד הַמָּשׁוּחַ בַּמַּשְׁמָע. שֶׁיָּכוֹל, מַאי? פְּשִׁיטָא, ״נֶפֶשׁ״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: The Master said anyone are included whether the individual, and whether the king, and whether the anointed What might obvious it is written: “Anyone.”
llm_translation: Master said: "Nefesh" - one the individual and one the prince and one the anointed for anointment. That he can, what? Obvious, "Nefesh" is written!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״וַאֲשֶׁר יִתֵּן מִמֶּנּוּ עַל זָר״, וְהַאי לָאו ״זָר״ הוּא, דְּהָא אִימְּשַׁח בְּגַוֵּויהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say the Merciful One states “Or whosoever puts any of it upon a stranger, And this not a “stranger,” as he is anointed with it. teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? The Merciful One said, "And whatever he gives to a stranger," but this is not a "stranger," for he anointed her with his spittle, which indicates to us.

hebrew_text: וְאַקְּשַׁהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְסוֹטָה, וְלַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְלִתְרוּמָה. לְסוֹטָה, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא פָּגַם, גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ נָמֵי, נָתְנָה טַבַּעַת בְּיָדָהּ – מָעֲלָה.
human_translation: The Merciful One compared to a sota , and to idol worship, and to teruma , to a sota , as even though did not damage With regard to consecrated as well, placed ring on her hand, liable for misuse.
llm_translation: And the Merciful One will be exacting in judgment for the Sotah, and for foreign worship, and for offerings. For the Sotah, even though she has not been defiled, in the case of the hekdesh, she placed the ring in her hand - she is elevated.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַקְּשַׁהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּעַד דְּאִית בַּהּ שִׁינּוּי, גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ נָמֵי, עַד דְּבִיקַּע בְּקַרְדּוֹם, וְיִפְגֹּם וּפָגוּם.
human_translation: When the Merciful One compared to idol worship, that until there is a change by With regard to consecrated as well, until where chops with ax and damages damaged.
llm_translation: When the Merciful One makes it difficult for foreign worship, as long as there is a change in it, specifically regarding the Holy of Holies, until it reaches the innermost part, and it is examined and found to be flawed.

hebrew_text: אַקְּשַׁהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִתְרוּמָה: מָה תְּרוּמָה, ״כִּי יֹאכַל״ – פְּרָט לְמַזִּיק, גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ נָמֵי – כֹּל דְּבַר אֲכִילָה, כִּי מַזֵּיק לֵיהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: the Merciful One compared to teruma What teruma ? if eats excludes one who causes damage With regard to consecrated as well, any edible item, when damages it exempt
llm_translation: The Merciful One made the contribution difficult: What is a contribution? "When he eats" - excluding harmful things, regarding consecrated items too - anything that is edible, if it harms him - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? נָתְנָה קַטְלָא כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב זְבִיד: וְדַהֲבָא לָאו בַּר אִיפְּגוֹמֵי הוּא? וְהָא דַּהֲבָא דְּכַלְּתֵיהּ דְּנוּן, לְהֵיכָא אֲזַל?
human_translation: How placed chain Rav Kahana said to Rav Zevid: And gold not subject to damage? But where did the gold of the daughter-in-law of Nun go?
llm_translation: How so? She gave a ketala like this. Rav Kahana said to Rav Zebid: Is gold not from the land of Ophir? And the gold, all of it, where does it go?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא, דַּהֲבָא דְּרָמְיָין כַּלָּתָיךְ הוּא. וְעוֹד: נְהִי דְּלָא אִיכָּא נֶהֱנָה וּפָגַם לְאַלְתַּר, לְעוֹלָם מִי לָא אִיכָּא פְּגִימָה?
human_translation: said to Perhaps the gold that your daughters-in-law cast aside. And furthermore, granted that does not have damaged immediately [ le’altar ] derives benefit does never damage?
llm_translation: He said to him: Perhaps, the goblet that you are holding is your daughter's. And furthermore: Let it be that there is no enjoyment now, but it will be damaged later, is there ever a case where there is no damage?

hebrew_text: הַנֶּהֱנֶה מִן הַחַטָּאת וְכוּ׳. מִכְּדֵי אִי בִּבְהֵמָה תְּמִימָה, הַיְינוּ כּוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּבַעֲלַת מוּם עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: One who derives benefit from a sin offering Now, if with regard to an unblemished animal, this is gold cup, Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with a blemished
llm_translation: Behold from the sin offering, etc. From when? If with a blemished animal, that is a golden cup! Rav Papa said: We are dealing with a blemished animal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נֶהֱנָה כְּבַחֲצִי פְרוּטָה וּפָגַם כַּחֲצִי פְרוּטָה, אוֹ שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּדָבָר אֶחָד וּפָגַם בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּדָבָר אַחֵר – לֹא מָעַל, עֵד שֶׁיֵּהָנֶה בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וְיִפְגֹּם בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה בְּדָבָר אֶחָד.
human_translation: one derived benefit to half a peruta and caused half of a peruta of damage, or if he derived benefit the value of one peruta from item and caused damage of the value of one peruta to another item one is not liable for misuse until he derives benefit of the value of one peruta and causes damage of the value of one peruta to one, item.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who benefits like half a Perutah and damages like half a Perutah, or one who benefits with an equivalent of a Perutah in one matter and damages with an equivalent of a Perutah in another matter - he is not liable. He is liable only if he benefits with an equivalent of a Perutah and damages with an equivalent of a Perutah in the same matter.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹעֵל אַחַר מוֹעֵל בְּמוּקְדָּשִׁין אֶלָּא בְּהֵמָה וּכְלִי שָׁרֵת בִּלְבַד. כֵּיצַד? רָכַב עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְרָכַב, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְרָכַב – כּוּלָּן מָעֲלוּ. שָׁתָה בְּכוֹס שֶׁל זָהָב, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְשָׁתָה, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְשָׁתָה – כּוּלָּן מָעֲלוּ. תָּלַשׁ מִן הַחַטָּאת, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְתָלַשׁ, וּבָא חֲבֵרוֹ וְתָלַשׁ – כּוּלָּן מָעֲלוּ. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פִּדְיוֹן – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מוֹעֵל אַחַר מוֹעֵל.
human_translation: misuse after misuse in consecrated items only an animal and service vessels.How so? one rode upon animal, and another came and rode and another came and rode all of them are liable for misuse one drank from a gold cup, and another came and drank and another came and drank all of them are liable for misuse one removed from a sin offering, and another came and removed and another came and removed all of them are liable for misuse Rabbi says: any item that is not subject to redemption, there is misuse after misuse with regard to it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: There is no benefit after benefit in the Temple except with an animal and a sacred vessel alone. How so? If one rode on the back of an animal, and his fellow came and rode, and his fellow came and rode - all of them are culpable. If one drank from a golden cup, and his fellow came and drank, and his fellow came and drank - all of them are culpable. If one removed from the sin offering, and his fellow came and removed, and his fellow came and removed - all of them are culpable. Rabbi says: Anything that does not have redemption - it has benefit after benefit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי? מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, הִיא: דְּתַנְיָא אֵין מוֹעֵל אַחַר מוֹעֵל אֶלָּא בִּבְהֵמָה בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: בְּהֵמָה וּכְלִי שָׁרֵת.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Neḥemya, as it is taught misuse after misuse only in an animal alone. Rabbi Neḥemya says: an animal and service vessels.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the source of this? It was taught in a Baraita by Rabbi Nechemyah: "It was taught: One may only benefit from one who has benefited previously in the case of an animal alone." Rabbi Nechemyah says: "In the case of an animal and a utensil used for the Temple service."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? קָסָבַר: בְּעִנְיָינָא דִבְהֵמָה כְּתִיב, דִּכְתִיב בְּאֵיל הָאָשָׁם.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna he holds written with regard to the case of an animal. As it is written: with the ram of the guilt offering,
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? He holds: In the matter of an animal it is written, as it is written in the case of the ram of guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, אָמַר לָךְ: קַל וָחוֹמֶר: אִם אֲחֵרִים מֵבִיא לִקְדוּשָּׁתָן, הוּא עַצְמוֹ – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya said to you, a fortiori If brings other to their sanctity, all the more so not itself
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah said to you: "Kal vachomer: If others bring themselves to holiness, he himself - all the more so!"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פִּדְיוֹן, יֵשׁ כּוּ׳. הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אָמַר רָבָא: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עֵצִים.
human_translation: Rabbi says: any item that is not subject to redemption, is the first tanna . Rava said: between them wood.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: Any matter that does not have redemption, there is a 'ku'. That is what the first Tanna taught! Rava said: There is a difference between them - wood.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עֵצִים״ – לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי גְזִירִין. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עֵצִים – קׇרְבָּן הֵן, וּטְעוּנִין מֶלַח, וּטְעוּנִין תְּנוּפָה.
human_translation: As the Sages taught one who says, It upon me wood not fewer than two logs Rabbi says: Wood is an offering, and it requires salt, and requires waving,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who says, "Behold, I am obligated to bring wood," may not diminish from two logs. Rabbi says: Wood is a sacrifice, requiring salt and requiring waving.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי, עֵצִים טְעוּנִין עֵצִים. וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי, עֵצִים צְרִיכִין קְמִיצָה.
human_translation: Rava says: According to the statement of Rabbi wood requires wood And Rav Pappa says: According to the statement of Rabbi wood requires removal of a handful.
llm_translation: Rava said: According to the words of Rabbi, one may carry wood on Shabbat that is designated for wood. And Rav Papa said: According to the words of Rabbi, one may carry wood on Shabbat that requires a handful to be carried.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ תְּמִימִין וְנַעֲשׂוּ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין וְעָבַר וּשְׁחָטָן אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said unblemished consecrated for the altar, and they became blemished and transgressed and slaughtered them between the opinion of
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The sacrifices of the altar must be unblemished, but if they were performed by those with blemishes, and he passed them and slaughtered them, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ תְּמִימִין, וְנַעֲשׂוּ בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, וְעָבַר וּשְׁחָטָן, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: יִקָּבְרוּ,
human_translation: And it is taught unblemished consecrated for the altar, and they became blemished, and transgressed and slaughtered them, Rabbi says: must be buried.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: The holy things of the altar must be unblemished, and if they were performed by those with blemishes, and he passed over and slaughtered them, Rabbi says: They should be buried.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִפָּדוּ.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: should be redeemed.
llm_translation: And the sages say: "They shall redeem."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָטַל אֶבֶן אוֹ קוֹרָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא מָעַל.
human_translation: one took a consecrated stone or a beam, that is not liable for misuse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one takes a stone or a beam of the Temple treasury - behold, this does not constitute a trespass.

hebrew_text: נְתָנָהּ לַחֲבֵרוֹ – הוּא מָעַל, וַחֲבֵרוֹ לֹא מָעַל. בְּנָאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא מָעַל, עַד שֶׁיָּדוּר תַּחְתֶּיהָ בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: he gave to another, he is liable for misuse and the other is not liable for misuse. he built into his house, he is not liable for misuse until he resides beneath it the value of one peruta
llm_translation: He gave it to his friend - he is liable, but his friend is not liable. If he built it inside his house - this one is not liable until he dwells beneath it to the value of a perutah.

hebrew_text: נָטַל פְּרוּטָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא מָעַל. נְתָנָהּ לַחֲבֵרוֹ – הוּא מָעַל, וַחֲבֵרוֹ לֹא מָעַל. נְתָנָהּ לְבַלָּן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רָחַץ מָעַל, שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי הַמֶּרְחָץ פָּתוּחַ לְפָנֶיךָ, הִכָּנֵס וּרְחוֹץ.
human_translation: one took a consecrated peruta , that is not liable for misuse. he gave to another, he is liable for misuse and the other is not liable for misuse. he gave to a bathhouse attendant [ levallan ], although he did not bathe, he is liable for misuse that says to The bathhouse is open before you, enter and bathe.
llm_translation: He took a coin of the Temple treasury - this is not a transgression. If he gave it to his friend - he transgresses, but his friend does not transgress. If he gave it to a bathhouse attendant, even though he did not wash, he transgresses, because the attendant says to him: "The bathhouse is open before you, enter and wash."

hebrew_text: אֲכִילָתוֹ וַאֲכִילַת חֲבֵרוֹ, הֲנָיָיתוֹ וַהֲנָיַית חֲבֵרוֹ, אֲכִילָתוֹ וַהֲנָיַית חֲבֵרוֹ, הֲנָיָיתוֹ וַאֲכִילַת חֲבֵרוֹ – מִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה.
human_translation: One’s consumption and another’s consumption one’s benefit and another’s benefit one’s consumption and another’s benefit one’s benefit and another’s consumption, join together and even if much time
llm_translation: Eating his and eating his friend's, feeding him and feeding his friend, eating his and feeding his friend, feeding him and eating his friend's - they combine with each other, even for a large quantity.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא הוּא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֲבֵירוֹ?! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּגִזְבָּר, הַמְּסוּרוֹת לוֹ, עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: What is different him and what is different another, Shmuel said: We are dealing with a treasurer [ begizbar ] to whom is given.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about him, and what is different about his friend?! Shmuel said: In the case of a treasurer, who has entrusted funds, we are dealing with.

hebrew_text: בְּנָאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב כּוּ׳. לְמָה לִי עַד שֶׁיָּדוּר תַּחְתֶּיהָ? כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁנְּיַהּ – מָעַל! אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִנִּיחָהּ עַל פִּי אֲרוּבָּה.
human_translation: he built into his house, he is not liable for misuse Why do I until he resides beneath it? as once he changed it, committed misuse. Rav says: where he placed it upon a window.
llm_translation: In its construction within his house - he is not liable. Why do I need it until he resides beneath it? Since he altered it - he is liable! Rav said: For example, if he placed it on the edge of the roof.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּבָנֵי לַהּ, מִיהַת מָעַל. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב, דְּאָמַר רַב: הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְבַיִת – אֲסָרוֹ.
human_translation: And once he built it in any event he committed misuse. Let us say supports of Rav, as Rav said: one who prostrates to a house he renders prohibited.
llm_translation: And since the sons of Leah, from there he transgressed. Let us say it assists Rav, for Rav said: One who bows to a house - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: הֲנָאָה הַנִּרְאֵת לָעֵינַיִם אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: Torah prohibited benefit that appears to the eyes,
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: "A pleasure that is visible to the eyes, the Torah has prohibited."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַדָּר בְּבַיִת שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנֶּהֱנָה מִמֶּנָּה – מָעַל. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָתָם בְּשֶׁהִקְדִּישׁוֹ וּלְבַסּוֹף בְּנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say supports one who resides in a house consecrated once he derives benefit from committed misuse. Reish Lakish said: There, where he consecrated and ultimately built
llm_translation: Let us say that he assists him: One who dwells in a house of consecration, once he derives benefit from it - he transgresses. Reish Lakish said: There, when he consecrated it, and ultimately built it.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּנָאוֹ וּלְבַסּוֹף הִקְדִּישׁוֹ, מַאי – לֹא מָעַל? מַאי אִירְיָא רָהֵיט וְתָנֵי הַדָּר בְּבַיִת שֶׁל מְעָרָה – לֹא מָעַל. לֵימָא הַדָּר בְּבַיִת שֶׁל אֲבָנִים שֶׁבְּנָאוֹ וּלְבַסּוֹף הִקְדִּישׁוֹ – לֹא מָעַל!
human_translation: But he built and ultimately sanctified it what he has not committed misuse. why run specifically to teach one who resides in house of a cave, he not committed misuse, Let say one who resides in a stone house, which he built and ultimately sanctified, he not committed misuse.
llm_translation: But in Nao and ultimately he consecrated it, what - not ascend? What is the issue? A well-prepared and he taught in the house of the cave - not ascend. Let us say: he taught in the house of stones in Nao and ultimately he consecrated it - not ascend!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ., הָא לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: say this conclusive for him. that not conclusive for him,
llm_translation: They said: "Here it interrupts him., Here it does not interrupt him."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַנֶּהֱנֶה
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who benefits.

hebrew_text: הַשָּׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. לֹא עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: an agent who performed his agency the homeowner, is liable for misuse did not perform his agency the agent is liable for misuse
llm_translation: The agent who performed his agency - the homeowner is liable. If he did not perform his agency - the agent is liable.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן בָּשָׂר לָאוֹרְחִים״, וְנָתַן לָהֶם כָּבֵד כָּבֵד, וְנָתַן לָהֶם בָּשָׂר – הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל. אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לָהֶם חֲתִיכָה חֲתִיכָה״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: טְלוּ שְׁתַּיִם! וְהֵם נָטְלוּ שָׁלֹשׁ – כּוּלָּם מָעֲלוּ.
human_translation: How so? said to Give meat to the guests, and he gave them liver; liver, and he gave them meat, the agent is liable for misuse said to Give them a piece a piece and says: take two and took three all of them are liable for misuse.
llm_translation: "How so? He said to him: 'Give meat to the guests,' and he gave them heavy, heavy portions of meat, and he gave them meat - the messenger transgressed. He said to him: 'Give them pieces, pieces,' and he the host says: 'Give them two pieces!' And they took three - all of them transgressed."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תַּנָּא דְּכׇל מִילְּתָא דְּמִימְּלַךְ עֲלַהּ שָׁלִיחַ תַּרְתֵּי מִילֵּי הָוְיָין?
human_translation: Who taught that any an item which agent consult is two items
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: "G'ma man tana de'kol milta d'mimlach alah shaliach tar'tei millei havyain?" English translation: Who is the Tanna that in every matter that is dependent upon a king, there are two agents?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיָּרָק – מוּתָּר בְּדִילּוּעִין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said that is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As we learned one who takes a vow that vegetables permitted to gourds, but Rabbi Akiva deems it prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Not like Rabbi Akiva, for we learned: One who vows from vegetables - permitted for dilu'in, and Rabbi Akiva prohibits.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מִי לָא בָּעֵי לְאִימְּלוֹכֵי? כִּי אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר נַחְמָנִי!
human_translation: Abaye said: You even say Rabbi Akiva, doesn’t Rabbi Akiva concede that needs to consult When the Rabbis said before Rava, he said to them: Naḥmani, is saying well.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it was Rabbi Akiva, who does not want to be appeased? For the Rabbis said before Rava, he said to them: "Nahmani is speaking well!"

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבָּשָׂר – אָסוּר בְּכׇל מִינֵי בָּשָׂר, וְאָסוּר בָּרֹאשׁ וּבָרַגְלַיִם, בַּקָּנֶה וּבַכָּבֵד וּבַלֵּב. וְאָסוּר בִּבְשַׂר עוֹפוֹת, וּמוּתָּר בִּבְשַׂר דָּגִים וַחֲגָבִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַתִּיר בָּרֹאשׁ וּבָרַגְלַיִם, בַּקָּנֶה וּבַכָּבֵד, וּבָעוֹפוֹת וּבַדָּגִים וּבַחֲגָבִים.
human_translation: Who is the tanna disagrees with of Rabbi Akiva it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught one who takes a vow that meat is prohibited all types of meat, and is prohibited of the head, of the feet, of the windpipe, of the liver, and of the heart, And to meat of birds, But permitted to meat of fish and grasshoppers, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits of the head, of the feet, of the windpipe, of the liver, of the heart, of birds, and of fish and of grasshoppers.
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna who disputes with regard to the ruling of Rabbi Akiva? It is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it was taught: One who vows from eating meat - is prohibited from all types of meat, and is prohibited from the head and the legs, from the windpipe, the liver, and the heart. And is prohibited from the meat of birds, but is permitted with the meat of fish and locusts. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits the head and the legs, the windpipe, the liver, and with birds, fish, and locusts.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: קְרָבַיִים לָאו בָּשָׂר הֵן, וְאוֹכְלֵיהֶן לָאו בַּר אִינִישׁ.
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel would likewise say: Innards are not meat, and one who eats them is not a person,
llm_translation: And so was Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel saying: "Carobs are not meat, and their consumption is not like that of a person."

hebrew_text: וּלְתַנָּא קַמָּא, מַאי שְׁנָא בִּבְשַׂר עוֹפוֹת? מִשּׁוּם דִּרְגִיל אִינִישׁ דְּאָמַר: לָא אַשְׁכַּחִי בִּשְׂרָא דְּחֵיוְתָא, וַאֲתַאי בִּשְׂרָא דְצִיפְּרָא. אִי הָכִי, הָכִי נָמֵי עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ לְמֵימְרָא: לָא אַשְׁכַּחִי בִּשְׂרָא דְּחֵיוְתָא, וַאֲתַאי דָּגִים!
human_translation: And according to the first tanna , what is different about meat of birds because a person normally says, I did not find meat of animals but I brought meat of birds If so, also a person is apt to say: I did not find meat of an animal, but I brought fish
llm_translation: And to the first Tanna, what is the difference with regard to the flesh of birds? Because a person is accustomed to say: I did not find the flesh of a wild animal, but I found the flesh of a bird. If so, likewise, a person will also say: I did not find the flesh of a wild animal, but I found fish!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּיוֹם הַקָּזָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּלָא אָכֵיל אִינִישׁ דָּגִים.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with the day bloodletting, as a person does not eat fish.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: On the day of the eclipse we are occupied, for a person should not eat fish.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, צִיפְּרָא נָמֵי לָא נֵיכוֹל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דִּמְסוֹכַר וְאָכֵל צִיפְּרָא – פָּרַח לִיבֵּיהּ כְּצִיפְּרָא! וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: אֵין מַקִּיזִין דָּם לֹא עַל הַדָּגִים, וְלֹא עַל הָעוֹפוֹת, וְלֹא עַל בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ.
human_translation: If so, he not eat birds either, as Shmuel said: one who lets blood and eats the meat of a bird, his heart flies like a bird. And furthermore it is taught One does not let blood before fish, nor before birds, nor before salted meat.
llm_translation: So it is, a bird named Zippora cannot be eaten, for Shmuel said: If one drinks beer and eats a bird - his heart will flutter like a bird! Furthermore, it was taught: One does not sprinkle blood neither on fish, nor on birds, nor on salted meat.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּיוֹמָא דְּכָיְיבִין לֵיהּ עֵינֵיהּ עָסְקִינַן, דְּלָא אָכֵיל דָּגִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: We are dealing with on a day that his eyes hurt him, as do not eat fish
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: On the day when her eyes are pained, we are dealing with it, so that she does not eat fish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לוֹ חֲתִיכָה כּוּ׳. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מוֹסִיף עַל שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – הָוֵי שָׁלִיחַ!
human_translation: said to Give him a piece learn from adds to his agency is an agent,
llm_translation: He said to him: Give him a piece as well. Learn from it: If one adds to his mission - he is a messenger!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: דְּאָמַר שָׁלִיחַ: טוֹל אַחַת מִדַּעְתּוֹ וְאַחַת מִדַּעְתִּי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said where agent said Take one in accordance with the intent and one in accordance with my intent.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: As the messenger said: Take one from his knowledge and one from my knowledge.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: עָקַר שָׁלִיחַ שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, וְלָא לִמְעוֹל – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say agent has uprooted the agency of the homeowner and not misuse teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: He uprooted the agency of the agent of the homeowner, and not to elevate - this implies to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי מִן הַחַלּוֹן אוֹ מִן הַדְּלוֹסְקָמָא״, וְהֵבִיא לוֹ. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת: ״לֹא הָיָה בְּלִבִּי אֶלָּא מִזֶּה״, וְהֵבִיא מִזֶּה – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. אֲבָל אִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי מִן הַחַלּוֹן״, וְהֵבִיא לוֹ מִן הַדְּלוֹסְקָמָא, אוֹ ״מִן הַדְּלוֹסְקָמָא״, וְהֵבִיא לוֹ מִן הַחַלּוֹן – הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: said to Bring me from the window or from the chest [ hadeluskema ], and brought to him even though the homeowner said: In my heart, only from that and he brought from the homeowner is liable for misuse But said to Bring me from the window and brought to him from the chest; or from the chest, and brought to him from the window, the agent is liable for misuse.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to him, "Bring me from the window or from the balcony," and he brought it to him. Even though the homeowner said, "I only intended for this," and he brought it from that - the homeowner is liable. But if he said to him, "Bring me from the window," and he brought it from the balcony, or "from the balcony," and he brought it from the window - the agent is liable.

hebrew_text: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, אִם עָשׂוּ שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל, לֹא עָשׂוּ שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ – חֶנְווֹנִי מֵעַל.
human_translation: sent in the hand of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, if they performed his agency, the homeowner is liable for misuse, they did not perform his agency the storekeeper is liable for misuse.
llm_translation: Sent by a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor, if they carried out his mission - the homeowner is exempt; if they did not carry out his mission - the agent is liable.

hebrew_text: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד פִּקֵּחַ, וְנִזְכַּר עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ אֵצֶל חֶנְווֹנִי – חֶנְווֹנִי מָעַל לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא.
human_translation: sent in the hand of competent and remembered before reached the storekeeper, the storekeeper is liable for misuse when he spends
llm_translation: Sent by the hand of Pikach, and remembered until he did not reach Henwoni - Henwoni transgressed when he brought out.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? נוֹטֵל פְּרוּטָה אוֹ כְלִי, וְאוֹמֵר: ״פְּרוּטָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא מְחוּלָּל עַל זֶה״, שֶׁהַהֶקְדֵּשׁ נִפְדֶּה בְּכֶסֶף וּבְשָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף.
human_translation: What shall do He takes one peruta or a vessel and says: consecrated peruta , wherever it may be, is desacralized with this as a consecrated item is desacralized with money and with the equivalent money.
llm_translation: How does one do it? He takes a coin or a vessel and says: "The coin of the sanctuary is valid anywhere it is exchanged for this," because the sanctuary is redeemed with silver and its value is like silver.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָם דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: What is teaching us? matters that in the heart are not matters.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the implication of the term "Gema"? Matters of the heart are not considered matters.

hebrew_text: שִׁילַּח בְּיַד חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, אִם עָשׂוּ [וְכוּ׳]. וְהָא לָאו בְּנֵי שְׁלִיחוּתָא נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: sent in the hand of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, if they performed But they cannot be agency.
llm_translation: He sent by the hand of a deaf-mute, imbecile, or minor, if they did etc.. But are they not considered agents?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עֲשָׂאוּם כְּמַעֲטָן שֶׁל זֵיתִים,
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says rendered like a vat [ kema’atan ] of olives
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Make them like the small olives of olives,

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַזֵּיתִים, מֵאֵימָתַי מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה? מִשֶּׁיַּזִּיעוּ זֵיעַת הַמַּעֲטָן, וְלֹא זֵיעַת הַקּוּפָּה.
human_translation: As we learned When do the olives susceptible to impurity? From when they exude moisture the vat, but not the moisture the basket.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: From when do olives receive impurity? From the time they exude the sweat of the vat, but not the sweat of the press.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ, נְתָנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הַקּוֹף וְהוֹלִיכוֹ, אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי הַפִּיל וְהוֹלִיכוֹ, וְאָמַר לְאַחֵר לְקַבְּלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ – הֲרֵי זֶה עֵירוּב. אַלְמָא קָא עָבְדָא שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ. הָכִי נָמֵי, אִיתְעֲבִיד שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: like that which we learned one placed on a monkey, and brought it or on elephant, and brought it and he told another to receive it from it is eiruv . Evidently, the agency is performed So too, the agency is performed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Like that which we learned, they placed it on the back of a monkey and led it, or on the back of an elephant and led it, and he said to another to receive it from him - this is an eruv. This implies that his agency is effective. So too, he is effectively acting through his agency.

hebrew_text: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד פִּקֵּחַ וְכוּ׳. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אִידְּכַר שָׁלִיחַ. וּרְמִינְהִי: נִזְכַּר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְלֹא נִזְכַּר שָׁלִיחַ – הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל, נִזְכְּרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם – חֶנְוָנִי מָעַל!
human_translation: sent in the hand of competent even though the agent did not remember, And raises a contradiction the homeowner remembered but the agent did not remember, the agent is liable for misuse. they both remembered storekeeper is liable for misuse.
llm_translation: Send by the hand of Pikkach and so on. And even though the messenger was not remembered. And they raised an objection: "The homeowner was remembered, but the messenger was not remembered - the messenger is negligent; if both were remembered - they are both negligent!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי, כְּשֶׁנִּזְכְּרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said The mishna also where both remembered
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: The Mishnah states, "When both of them are mentioned."
