hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָתַן לוֹ פְּרוּטָה, אָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי בְּחֶצְיָהּ נֵרוֹת וּבְחֶצְיָהּ פְּתִילוֹת״ וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא לוֹ בְּכוּלָּהּ פְּתִילוֹת אוֹ בְּכוּלָּהּ נֵרוֹת, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי בְּכוּלָּהּ נֵרוֹת״, אוֹ ״בְּכוּלָּהּ פְּתִילוֹת״, וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא בְּחֶצְיָהּ נֵרוֹת וּבְחֶצְיָהּ פְּתִילוֹת – שְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא מָעֲלוּ.
human_translation: gave one peruta said to him: Bring me lamps [ nerot ] with one-half of it and wicks with one-half of it, and went and brought him wicks with the entire or lamps with the entire or where said to Bring me lamps with the entire or wicks with the entire and went and brought lamps with one-half of it and wicks with one-half of it, both of them are not liable
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one gave him a coin, and said to him, "Bring me half of it in candles and half of it in wicks," and he went and brought him all wicks or all candles, or if he said to him, "Bring me all candles," or "Bring me all wicks," and he went and brought him half candles and half wicks - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״הָבֵא לִי בְּחֶצְיָהּ נֵרוֹת מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי וּבְחֶצְיָהּ פְּתִילוֹת מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״, וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא לוֹ נֵרוֹת מִמְּקוֹם פְּתִילוֹת, וּפְתִילוֹת מִמְּקוֹם נֵרוֹת – הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: But if said to Bring me lamps from such and such place with one-half of and wicks from such and such place with one-half of and went and brought him lamps from the place wicks, and wicks from the place lamps, the agent is liable for misuse,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But if he said to him, "Bring me half its lamps from such and such a place, and half its wicks from such and such a place," and he went and brought him the lamps from the place of the wicks, and the wicks from the place of the lamps - the agent has acted improperly.

hebrew_text: נָתַן לוֹ שְׁתֵּי פְרוּטוֹת, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״לֵךְ וְהָבֵא לִי אֶתְרוֹג״, וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא לוֹ בְּאַחַת אֶתְרוֹג וּבְאַחַת רִימּוֹן – שְׁנֵיהֶם מָעֲלוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לֹא מָעַל, שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: אֶתְרוֹג גָּדוֹל הָיִיתִי מְבַקֵּשׁ, וְהֵבֵאתָ לִי קָטָן וְרַע.
human_translation: gave two perutot , and said to him: Go and bring me an etrog , and he went and brought him an etrog with one and a pomegranate with one both of them are liable for misuse. Rabbi Yehuda says: The homeowner is not liable for misuse, as he say to I was seeking a large etrog and you brought me a small, inferior
llm_translation: He gave him two coins, and said to him: "Go and bring me an etrog." And he went and brought him one etrog and one pomegranate - both are invalid. Rabbi Yehuda says: The homeowner did not invalidate it, because he said to him: "I was seeking a large etrog, and you brought me a small and bad one."

hebrew_text: נָתַן לוֹ דִּינַר זָהָב, וְאָמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ וְהָבֵא לִי חָלוּק,
human_translation: gave gold dinar, and said to Go and bring me a robe,
llm_translation: He gave to him a dinar of gold, and said to him: Go and bring me a portion.

hebrew_text: וְהָלַךְ וְהֵבִיא לוֹ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה חָלוּק וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה טַלִּית – שְׁנֵיהֶם מָעֲלוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לֹא מָעַל, שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: חָלוּק גָּדוֹל הָיִיתִי מְבַקֵּשׁ, וְהֵבֵאתָ לִי קָטָן וְרַע.
human_translation: and went and brought him a robe with three and a cloak with three both of them are liable for misuse. Rabbi Yehuda says: homeowner is not liable for misuse, as he say to I was seeking a large robe and you brought me a small, inferior
llm_translation: He went and brought for him in three parts and in three garments - both of them are exempt. Rabbi Yehuda says: The homeowner is not exempt, for he says to him: I requested a large portion, and you brought me a small and bad one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ, מַאן דְּאָמַר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״זִיל זְבֵן לִי כּוֹרָא דְאַרְעָא״, וַאֲזַל וּזְבַן לֵיהּ לִיתְכָּא – קָנֵי לוֹקֵחַ!
human_translation: learn from one who said to his agent: Go sell my a kor of land, and he went and sold for him a half kor , the purchaser acquires
llm_translation: Gemara: You heard her type, who says to send him: "Go buy me a barrel of land," and he went and bought it for her - he acquires the buyer!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָכָא הֵיכִי דָּמֵי – כְּגוֹן דְּאַיְיתִי לֵיהּ שָׁוֶה שֵׁשׁ בְּשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: say What are the circumstances here? where brought him worth six for three
llm_translation: They said: Here is how it is comparable - for example, if one brings to him equal to six in three.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לֹא מָעַל, שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״חָלוּק גָּדוֹל הָיִיתִי מְבַקֵּשׁ, וְהֵבֵאתָ לִי חָלוּק קָטָן וְרַע״!
human_translation: say the latter clause: Rabbi Yehuda says: homeowner is not liable for misuse, as he say to I was seeking a large robe and you brought me a small, inferior robe
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: Rabbi Yehuda omer: Baal habayit lo ma'al, shehu yakhol loymar lo: 'Chaluk gadol hayiti mevakesh, vehaveita li chaluk katan vera.'" English translation: "Say the latter clause: Rabbi Yehuda says: The homeowner did not act improperly, for he can say to him: 'I sought a large portion, and you brought me a small and bad portion!'"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי יָהֲבַתְּ דִּינָר כּוּלֵּיהּ, אַיְיתֵית לִי שָׁוֶה שְׁנֵי דִינָרִין.
human_translation: that said to if you had given the entire dinar you brought me worth two dinars.
llm_translation: He said to him: "If you had given me a dinar in full, you would have brought me two dinars worth."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּקִטְנִית שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מָעֲלוּ, שֶׁהַקִּטְנִית בִּפְרוּטָה וְקִטְנִית בְּדִינָר.
human_translation: This too stands to reason, as it teaches the latter clause, Rabbi Yehuda concedes in legumes that both are liable for misuse of consecrated property. that legumes for one peruta and legumes for a dinar.
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: for it is taught in the latter part: Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding the small vessel, that both of them ascend, for the small vessel with a prutah and the small vessel with a dinar.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי בְּאַתְרָא דְּזָבְנִי בְּשׁוּמָא – גַּבֵּי קִטְנִית נָמֵי, דְּיָהֵב סֶלַע מוֹזְלִי לֵיהּ טְפֵי! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּדוּכְתָּא דִּמְזַבְּנִי בְּכַנֵּי כַּנֵּי, כַּנָּא כַּנָּא בִּפְרוּטָה, דְּהָתָם פְּסִיק מִילְּתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If to a town where they sell by appraisal with regard to legumes as well, that gave a sela become cheaper. Rav Pappa said: to a town where they sell by containers, container Each and every container for one peruta . that there the matter is fixed,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of similarity? If in a place where I bought with a name - regarding a small jug, for example, that he gave a coin of Mezuzah to him! Rav Papa said: In a place where I buy with coins, each coin separately, there it is clear."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד מָעוֹת אֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי, אִם צְרוּרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם הוֹצִיא – מָעַל. אִם מוּתָּרִין – יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם הוֹצִיא – לֹא מָעַל. אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן. לְפִיכָךְ, אִם הוֹצִיא – מָעַל. הַחֶנְווֹנִי – כְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: one who deposits money with a money changer, if is bound, may not use it. Therefore, if spent he is liable for misuse. was unbound he may use it, therefore if spent he is not liable for misuse. with a homeowner, whether is bound or whether is unbound, may not use it, therefore if he spent he is liable for misuse. a storekeeper is like a homeowner; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: like a money changer.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who entrusts coins with a money changer, if they are in bundles, he may not make use of them. Therefore, if he withdraws them, he transgresses. If they are permitted, he may make use of them. Therefore, if he withdraws them, he does not transgress. With regard to the homeowner, whether in this case or in that case, he may not make use of them. Therefore, if he withdraws them, he transgresses. The Hachnuni is like the homeowner, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Like the money changer.

hebrew_text: נָפְלָה פְּרוּטָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ בְּתוֹךְ כִּיסוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר ״פְּרוּטָה בְּכִיס זֶה הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהוֹצִיא אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה – מָעַל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא אֶת כָּל הַכִּיס.
human_translation: a consecrated peruta fell into one’s purse, or where one said: One peruta in this purse is consecrated, once he spent the first he is liable for misuse. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis say: until he spends in the entire purse,
llm_translation: A small coin of the Temple treasury fell into a pocket, or if one said, "This pocket is sanctified with a small coin," once he removes the first one - it is elevated, the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the sages say: until he removes the entire pocket.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לַחֲכָמִים בְּאוֹמֵר ״פְּרוּטָה מִן כִּיס זֶה הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, שֶׁהוּא מוֹצִיא וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא אֶת כָּל הַכִּיס.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva concedes to the Rabbis in one says: One peruta from this purse is consecrated, that he may continue spending once he spends in the entire purse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva concedes to the sages by saying, "A protrusion from this pocket is holy," for he takes out and walks until he takes out the entire pocket.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר: רָמֵי לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא?
human_translation: when Rav Dimi came he said Reish Lakish raised a contradiction to Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is different the first clause, and what is different the latter clause,
llm_translation: Gemara: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Reish Lakish raised a difficulty to Rabbi Yochanan: What is the difference between the beginning and the end?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סֵיפָא בְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא יִפָּטֵור כִּיס זֶה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ״.
human_translation: said to The latter clause where one said: This purse will not be exempt from consecration.
llm_translation: He said to him: The latter part states, "This purse shall not be exempt from hekdesh."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אֲמַר: כִּיסִין אַשְּׁווֹרִים רְמָא לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר ״אֶחָד מִשְּׁווֹרַיי הֶקְדֵּשׁ״ – הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם, הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶן הֶקְדֵּשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סֵיפָא בְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא יִפָּטֵור כִּיס זֶה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ״.
human_translation: when Ravin came he said raised a contradiction to between purses, and bulls. As we learned one who says: One of my bulls is consecrated, he had two the larger of them is consecrated. said to him: The latter clause where one said: This purse will not be exempt from consecration.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: "Kisim Ashvorim rema lei, di'tnan: Ha'omer 'echad mi'shvora'i hekdesh' - hayu lo shnayim, hagadol shebahen hekdesh!" Amar lei: seifa b'omer 'lo yipateir kis zeh min hahekdesh'.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כִּיסִין אַלּוּגִּין רְמָא לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִים
human_translation: Rav Pappa said He raised a contradiction between purses to a log As we learned one who purchases wine from among the Samaritans [ Kutim ]
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: These Kisīn are a hint for him, as we learned: One who buys wine from among the Kutim.

hebrew_text: אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ – הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה, עֲשָׂרָה – מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, תִּשְׁעָה – מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי״, וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: says: Two log that I will separate in the future are teruma , ten first tithe; nine second tithe. And he desacralizes and he may drink immediately, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He says: "Two logs that I am destined to separate - behold they are Terumah, ten - Maaser Rishon, nine - Maaser Sheni," and he waits and drinks immediately, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סֵיפָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין בְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא יִפָּטֵר כִּיס זֶה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon prohibit said to him: The latter clause of the mishna where one said: This purse will not be exempt from consecration,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit! He said to him: The latter clause of the Mishnah states, "This purse shall not be exempt from consecration."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַשָּׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת מְעִילָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, messenger who has fulfilled his mission, and may it be a merit for him, the tractate of Me'ilah.
